reviewText:
I waited almost a year to post this review to see if my initial conclusion was correct.  Essentially it was.  The bottom line is the Polo Ralph Lauren French Rib pants fit and feel the best of any pants.  Unfortunately, they’re expensive and not available on Amazon.  However, there are some pairs available on auction sites for reasonable prices. The next best is between the U.S. Polo Assn. Men's Fleece Cargo Pant and the Champion Men's Champion Eco Open Bottom Pant.  The problem with the U.S. Polo Assn. Men's Fleece Cargo is that they pill a lot and because they’re made of nylon they don’t breathe well if at all.  The problem with the Champion is they’re a bit long, a bit baggy and the waist is a bit big.  The rest of them aren’t even worth trying.  I’m looking forward to some affordable, high quality, great fitting sweat pants.  Unfortunately, they don’t exist at the moment.  Interesting note, I initially bought all the pants in size large, but they all seemed to fit a bit too tight not only in the waist but throughout the whole let as well.  I like my sweatpants loose fitting so I reordered them all in XL and made my conclusions based on that.Polo Ralph Lauren French RibThey are 100% cotton, which is extremely hard to find.  They may be the heaviest of all the pants (not necessarily good or bad), the most naturally soft (cotton soft compared to nylon “fleece” soft), and the best fit (loose, but not too loose, definitely not tight) throughout the waist and legs, and a good length (long enough that you may walk on the back of them when you’re not wearing shoes).  The inseam is very low however.  That is the one thing I would change.  I’d raise the inseam up by 2 inches.U.S. Polo Assn. Men's Fleece Cargo Pant, Black, LargeNOT AFFILIATED WITH POLO RALPH LAUREN CORP.
U.S. Polo Assn. Men's Fleece Cargo Pant
Nice fitting pants, but they’re 100% nylon “fleece” which have pilled horribly over a year and static cling often.  Also, nylon pants don’t breathe well and cause an uncomfortable and unnecessary sweat.U.S. Polo Assn. Men's Classic Fleece Pant, Dark Grey Heather, LargeNOT AFFILIATED WITH POLO RALPH LAUREN CORP.
U.S. Polo Assn. Men's Classic Fleece Pant
Compared to the cargo version of these they fit much tighter.Champion Men's Champion Eco Open Bottom Pant, Oxford Gray, Large
Champion Men's Champion Eco Open Bottom Pant
A bit too long and a bit too loose in the waist.Champion Men's Champion Eco Relaxed Band Pant, Oxford Gray, Large
Champion Men's Champion Eco Relaxed Band Pant
Tighter than the open bottom version and I dislike the band at the bottom of the leg.Jerzees 974MP 8 oz. 50/50 Open Bottom Fleece Pant-Large-Oxford
NuBlend Open Bottom Sweatpant with Pocket
I kept these.  They are a nice loose fit, but the material hasn’t held up as well as the Champion.Russell Athletic Men's Athletic Open-Bottom Pant, Black Heather, Large
Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Performance Open Bottom Pant
These are very light pants.  In fact, I kept them because they were so light.  The size large fits like an XL  compared to all the other pants.  I rarely wear these because they’re so light.Russell Athletic Men's Heavyweight Fleece Open-Bottom Pant - CD1 - L
Russell Athletic Men's Heavyweight Fleece Open-Bottom Pant
The waist band of even the XXL is unbelievable tight.  This must be a design flaw.  It’s unfortunate too because the material was nice and heavy.Russell Athletic Men's Dri-Power Open Bottom Fleece Pocket Pant, Black Heather, Large
Russell Athletic Men's Dr-Power Fleece Open Bottom Pocket Pant
These fit tight compared to the others.  The inseam is higher up as well.  Also, it’s an odd feeling material that I don’t care for.Fruit of the Loom 8 oz 50/50 Adult Open Bottom Sweatpants in Athletic Heather – Large
Fruit of the Loom 51300R 50/50 Fleece Pant with Mesh Pockets
These also fit tight compared to the others.  The pockets were oddly short.  In person you can tell they’re low quality.
clean_reviewText:

reviewText: I've been using the Jerzees Men's Dri-Power Cotton Blend Long Sleeve Tees for quite some time now, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase! These shirts are incredibly comfortable, thanks to the soft cotton blend that feels great against the skin. The moisture-wicking feature is a game changer; it keeps me dry even during my most active days!One of the standout qualities of these tees is the odor protection. reviewText: Great for working in a warehouse. Very protective. I can kick heavy stuff without hurting my foot if I curl my toes slightly. I've used my shoes to avoid pinching my fingers when setting down heavy objects, to get pallet jacks unstuck from pallets by holding the pallet in place with my foot, and to get old rusty latches on delivery vans open by kicking the lever. I know from experience that the steel toe can support over 1,000lbs, just don't tell my boss how I figured that out....I'm not sure how protective they are when it comes to stepping on nails, but I'll let update my review if I find out! (Stepping on nails sticking up out of boards isn't exactly a rare occurrence in warehouse and construction environments)They're surprisingly water resistant. Stepping in puddles, walking through snow, and even pressure-washing vehicles doesn't get my feet wet. They're quite grippy, and the tread on the soles doesn't seem to wear down. While wearing these, I've only ever slipped on ice and soapy concrete, never on wet wood, concrete floor, metal, etc.They're certainly not comfort shoes, but they're comfortable enough for work. Better than broken toes! They're not light, but they don't feel particularly heavy. I'm still fairly agile while wearing them, they're not great for running, but I can run in them comfortably and without tripping. It's quite comfortable to rest one foot on top of the other while sitting, since the shoes don't bend too easily like sneakers do.They're very durable, aside from the memory foam insoles, which develop holes pretty quickly, although you really can't feel the holes. In my experience, they last about 8 months, which is decent, considering they're relatively inexpensive and stand up to a lot. My first pair had a bit of peeling rubber on the front and the holes in the insoles had gotten quite deep, so I replaced them, although they're still wearable as a backup option. I just bought replacements for my second pair, which are actually in pretty good shape other than the inside of the left shoe wearing down, causing the hard protective layer inside to rub on my heel and cause minor discomfort while walking.The sizing seems accurate. I have fairly wide feet, and wear size 13 in most brands, sometimes 14 (eg, Under Armour). The size 13-Wide fits perfectly, with just enough room for my toes to not be squished together like they are in most shoes.9/10, would recommend these for anyone with the risk of injuring their feet at work.

reviewText: The new slip-in technology is the best thing ever for big people like me.  No more bending over to put on the shoes.  It is amazing.  I want to replace all my shoes with this style.  No more crushing your thumb to slip into a loafer.  No more exerting yourself to bend over to put on the shoes.  I raved about this so much that my wife bought a slip-in and loves it also.Also, this version with the arch support and gogamat is far superior then memory foam for cushion for big men, because memory foam crushes down and does not cushion for obese people.  The gogamat does provide longer lasting cushion comfort for longer periods of time.Also, Sketchers has a bunch of slip-in shoes that have very spongee type soles.  I don't recommend those for obese people as there is less support and stability.  I have weak ankles due to a lifetime of obesity and ankle sprains.  The firmer soles on this shoe, and the Goodyear rubber, make for a much more stable and long-lasting shoe.This is a good looking shoe that can be worn casually with dockers or jeans.  And my work is very casual office work, so these look great at work.  I plan on buying more like these, in a dressier version to ware to trade shows, and maybe a gogamat version in an athletic shoe if I can find a version with good sole stability.

reviewText: Interesting sleeves on this T-shirt. I went with the Color: C Blue in Size: XX-Large. For reference I'm over 50 years old. Height 5'6, weight 170lbs measurements Bust: 43 Waist: 34 Hips: 43. I could have gone with the XLarge, but wanted extra room to make adjustments for fit.The fabric on this shirt is lightweight, stretchy on the horizontal and fairly soft. On my softness scale of 1-5, I would give it a 4.25. It has not bothered my sensitive skin. It has been through the washer and dryer, left in the dryer overnight, then folded up for a few days before I got to this review. I can say it holds no wrinkles so would work for traveling. It did not shrink or bleed color in the laundering, nor did it pick up excess lint. There is a tiny bit of twisting, but not sure it's even enough that would be noticed. My only real issue is the stitching on the pleating was not always tied off or back stitched. Some were, some not. Kind of odd that. At least they are long enough to not look like a maternity shirt. The small V on the neckline does not lay flat, but I don't find that to be an issue. Otherwise the construction seems fine, basic and done on a serger.Overall fairly happy with it and feel it's worth taking the time to make adjustments for fit.PeaceI generally get things oversized for comfort but also in-case I need to do any sewing adjustments. This shirt

reviewText: This shirt has been an excellent addition to my wardrobe, especially for active and outdoor activities. The quick-drying fabric is a standout feature, keeping me comfortable and dry even on hot days. It's perfect for golf, casual outings, or just running errands in warm weather. The shirt also offers 40+ UPF protection, which is a great bonus for those sunny days, giving me peace of mind knowing I'm protected from harmful UV rays.One thing I really appreciate is the comfort of this polo. The fabric is soft and breathable, and it moves well with my body without feeling restrictive. The fit is just right, not too tight and not too loose, providing a flattering look without compromising on comfort. While the shirt performs exceptionally well, I did notice that it tends to wrinkle a bit after washing, so it requires a quick iron to look its best. However, this is a minor inconvenience given all the other benefits it offers.I think this shirt is a fantastic choice for anyone looking for a comfortable, practical, and protective polo for active wear. It has become a go-to in my wardrobe, and I highly recommend it for its performance and comfort.

reviewText: 1st of all. I'm short and fluffy. My feet are wide. I walk on concrete all day. I'm exposed to the elements all the time. I have been told by my doctor to wear breathable shoes (mesh) which I do but they make my feet look long and big. I have tried wide toe shoes. (In a size 10) but they still hurt my feet. Most shoes I seem to slide forward and my toes hurt like crazy at the end of the day. I got these shoes in a 10.5 and I can walk all day in them. Good grip on the bottom and my feet stay dry. When I first got the shoes I loosened the laces and they were a little snug. I thought I wasted money yet again. But then I stood up and began walking in them and then relief came. I'm super pleased they had half sizes. It truly made a difference.  I walk more now they are so comfortable. I wish more shoes came in half sizes, I will buy more. I just need this shoe now in a gray color and I'll be set. At my age it's all about comfort not cuteness. I hope they work as good for you as they do for me, by the way I never leave reviews. This is my 1st one. I hope it helps.

reviewText: I recently purchased the Signature by Levi Strauss & Co. Gold Men's Relaxed Fit Flex Jeans for my husband, and they have quickly become his favorite pair of jeans. These jeans offer a perfect blend of comfort, style, and durability, making them ideal for everyday wear.First and foremost, the comfort of these jeans is exceptional. The relaxed fit provides ample room through the seat and thigh, ensuring unrestricted movement and all-day comfort. The inclusion of Flex denim technology adds an extra layer of comfort, allowing the jeans to stretch and move with him without feeling restrictive. This feature is particularly appreciated during activities that require a lot of bending and stretching.The quality of the denim is impressive. Made from a blend of cotton and elastane, the fabric feels sturdy yet soft against the skin. The denim is thick enough to be durable and long-lasting, yet it doesn't feel heavy or uncomfortable. The stitching and construction are solid, indicating that these jeans are built to withstand regular wear and washing.The style of the Signature by Levi Strauss & Co. Gold Men's Relaxed Fit Flex Jeans is versatile and timeless. The relaxed fit offers a classic look that pairs well with a variety of tops, from casual t-shirts to dressier button-down shirts. The jeans come in a range of washes, allowing you to choose the one that best suits your style. My husband particularly likes the dark wash for its ability to transition seamlessly from day to night.One of the standout features of these jeans is their practical design. The traditional five-pocket styling provides plenty of storage for essentials like keys, wallet, and phone. The pockets are deep and functional, which is a big plus for everyday use. The waistband sits comfortably at the waist, and the belt loops are sturdy enough to accommodate a variety of belts.Another advantage of these jeans is their ease of maintenance. They are machine washable and retain their shape and color well even after multiple washes. This durability ensures that they remain a reliable part of my husband's wardrobe for a long time.In terms of fit, the jeans run true to size. My husband found his usual size to be a perfect fit, providing the relaxed feel he was looking for without being too loose. The addition of Flex denim technology means that the jeans adapt well to different body shapes, providing a comfortable fit for various body types.In summary, the Signature by Levi Strauss & Co. Gold Men's Relaxed Fit Flex Jeans are an excellent choice for anyone seeking comfortable, stylish, and durable jeans. Their superior comfort, high-quality construction, and versatile style make them a standout option for everyday wear. I highly recommend these jeans to anyone looking to add a reliable and fashionable pair of jeans to their wardrobe. My husband loves them, and they have quickly become a staple in his collection.

reviewText: When the pants arrived the top was folded in an unusual way. The reason became clear immediately - the button was far too large for the button hole (or the hole was made too small - your choice).  I do not expect to have to modify new trousers before I can wear them. Other than that they fit well - I ordered the large based on the size chart (I usually wear 32 X 32 pants). The length was just right since yoga pants are usually somewhat shorter than regular trousers.However, the slant pockets on the sides are sewn on the outside of the leg, so they stick out like elephant ears. Hoping that this was just the result of the odd folding, I washed the pants in cold water and dried them at normal temperature. Because they are mostly polyester (67% Polyester,20% Linen, 12% Viscose,1% Cotton), I assumed they would handle that routine at least as well as higher percentage cotton pants do. Unfortunately I was wrong - they shrunk so badly that they are a bit tight at the waist and far too short to wear anywhere other than the beach. And the side pockets still stick out.

Enter the Volcom Men's Vmonty Stretch Chino Short - the ultimate summer short.First off, these shorts are stretchy. Not like I just ate a big meal stretchy, but I can do a cartwheel and not rip my pants stretchy. So whether you're lounging on the beach or playing a game of pickup basketball, these shorts have got your back (and your legs).But it's not just about the stretch. These shorts also have all the features you need for a day in the sun. They have pockets (duh), a zipper fly (double duh), and a stylish design that says I'm casual, but I still care about my appearance.Of course, like any product, there are some downsides. For one, the sizing can be a bit tricky, so make sure you double-check the size chart before ordering. And while the stretchiness is great, it does mean that the shorts can sometimes ride up a bit when you're moving around a lot.Overall, though, these shorts are a summer must-have. reviewText: I don't like elastic bands that have to stretch too much and then put too much pressure on my waist and leave a mark when I remove the underwear later.  I got the 2X Large size, which was one size larger than suggested for my actual waist size, and it just put the minimum pressure needed to keep them in place, yet leaves no mark after wearing them for hours.  The material is very breathable and after a minute or so you won't even be aware you are wearing them.  Very comfortable.  There was another major brand I tried, but aside from being too tight in the waist, there was some chemical in their elastic waist bands that triggered an allergic reaction and left a itchy rash all around my waist!  As soon as I saw that, they went right in the garbage!One slight problem I encountered, though, with these Fruit of the Loom Boxer briefs.  My 3 pack contained two black and one gray standard length pair and I noticed that they had a bit of a chemical smell to them right out of their pack.  I washed them each by hand twice in hot soapy water followed by rinses in hot fresh water.  I noticed that when wringing out the two black pairs, they initially released a lot of dark dye into the water.  These repeated washing have almost completely removed the chemical odor and they don't seem to be losing as much dye now.  The smell and the dye loss will probably be gone with another few washings.Most importantly, these briefs fit somewhat loosely especially where they surround the thighs.  The pouch gives one's equipment just the right amount of room.  They are very cool and comfortable.  There's no button down fly on them.  Instead they just use the overlapped panel approach which is fine.I can recommend these Fruit of the Loom men's briefs.  But, for maximum comfort, I recommend getting the next larger size than that listed for you actual waist size.  That will assure that the waist band will not leave a mark on your skin after wearing them for hours.  I also recommend hand washing them several times before wearing them for the first time just to make sure you don't absorb any loose dye molecules into your skin and body.

reviewText: I recently added the Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans in size 40 to my wardrobe, and they have quickly become my favorite pair. These jeans are everything I was looking for—comfortable, stylish, and a perfect fit.From the moment I tried them on, I knew these jeans were something special. The size 40 fits like a dream, hugging my waist comfortably without being too tight. The stretch fabric gives them just the right amount of flexibility, making them ideal for everything from a day at the office to a casual night out. They move with me, whether I’m sitting, bending, or just lounging around.The slim fit design is sleek and modern, giving me a sharp, clean look that works with any outfit. The dark wash is versatile, looking great with everything from a simple tee to a button-down shirt. The quality of the denim is top-notch, with sturdy stitching and a durable feel that promises they’ll last for years to come.What really stands out is the comfort. These jeans are soft yet sturdy, providing support without sacrificing comfort. I can wear them all day without any discomfort, and they maintain their shape perfectly, wash after wash. The price is unbeatable for the quality you get, making these jeans a smart investment.I honestly wish I had discovered the Levi's 511 Slim Fit Jeans sooner. They’ve elevated my wardrobe, offering a blend of comfort, style, and durability that’s hard to beat. Whether you’re dressing up or down, these jeans are a versatile addition to any closet.Overall, the Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans in size 40 are a phenomenal buy. reviewText: These are awesome shoes.  They last for a very long time.  They run a bit tight, and pretty stiff.  I use old-school techniques, that I learned in the Army, for new Rockports.  I put them on, and wear them for an hour.  I'm not going to lie, they chew on my feet pretty hard for that hour.  Then I wear them for a couple of hours, on some errands that require walking.  They start out biting pretty hard, but after a couple of hours, they feel like a good pair of gloves, and they're like walking on clouds.  The third time, I wear them to work.  I pack a spare pair of shoes, in case my feet get too sore, but they usually don't.  After that third day, they might be a little hard to put on, but once on, they're super comfortable.  I have a pair that are 5 years old, still look great for office work, and are one of two pairs of shoes that I go to when I know I'm going to be on my feet a lot.  It's a process to break them in, but good leather requires break in.  These shoes are worth it!

reviewText: I purchased various Legendary Whitetails Men's Journeyman Shirt Jackets as Christmas gifts for my husband, my two sons, and my two nephews. The gifts were well received. They were a big hit at our family Christmas party. The only complaint I overheard came from the boys wanting more of them.This particular shirt/jacket is definitely more of a jacket than a shirt. I mentioned that I ordered several different colors and styles of this brand. Fortunately, the son who attends college in Boulder ended up with this one. All of the other Legendary Whitetails Shirt/Jackets I ordered were more on the shirt side of a shirt/jacket. This worked out well for us because we live in Louisiana, my other son is in Pharmacy school in the deep south, and my two nephews live in Texas.This Shirt/Jacket is exceptionally comfortable and is good for colder weather. It's not clothing you would want to keep on while inside.Regarding sizing, my son said it is true to size. He is a true Medium in nearly everything I purchase. He's 20 years old, 5'10 or maybe 5'll, and about 160 pounds. He works out and is fit, but has broad shoulders. I bought a size Medium for my husband as well. He is 170, 5'10. My other son is about the same height and weight.They can easily wear a shirt, sweatshirt, hoodie, or turtleneck beneath the shirt/jacket. I suggest ordering your normal size unless you like your jackets to fit baggy or you are larger in the stomach area. If you live in the north or midwest and plan on layering more than one article of clothing under the shirt/jacket, you may want to consider the bigger size.This shirt/jacket is a remarkable deal for the price. Everyone who received one as a gift from me has worn theirs multiple times. The jackets look better now -- with that worn-in look. It keeps the bitter cold of Michigan from biting and protects from harsh wind. The shirt/Jacket has several interior and exterior pockets.I can tell when someone genuinely likes a gift and this topped our family Christmas bestseller list and has already been added to the repeat performer list for 2022.If you're looking for a heavier shirt/jacket for colder months, one that you can layer or wear over a sweatshirt or hoodie, this is for you. If you are looking for a lighter-weight shirt/jacket that you can leave on indoors then I would try one of Legendary Whitetails many other shirt/jacket options.Overall, this is a fabulous product. It outperforms competitors in value, purpose, and appearance. That’s a winner in my opinion

reviewText: Esta chamarra Calvin Klein blanca me encantó desde el primer momento. El diseño es elegante y atemporal, con un color que combina prácticamente con cualquier outfit, ya sea casual o un poco más formal. Es una prenda muy versátil que se adapta perfectamente a diferentes ocasiones.El material es de excelente calidad, algo que siempre espero de esta marca, pero en este caso superó mis expectativas. Es cómoda, ligera y se siente duradera, ideal para climas frescos sin dejar de ser estilosa.Lo único que debo mencionar es que las tallas parecen ser más amplias de lo normal. Si prefieres un ajuste más entallado, recomendaría elegir una talla menor a la que normalmente usas. Aun así, este detalle no afecta la experiencia general porque el diseño sigue luciendo increíble.Sin duda, es una pieza que ahora considero esencial en mi guardarropa. ¡Felicitaciones a Calvin Klein por crear algo tan sofisticado y funcional! Recomiendo esta chamarra completamente, pero con atención a las tallas.Cuando tenga algunas fotos mías con la chamarra puesta , actualizo mi reseña!

reviewText: The Adidas Women's Kaptir Flow sneakers are designed for casual wear and light activities. Hereâ€™s a review highlighting their pros and cons:Pros:Comfortable Fit: The Cloudfoam midsole provides a soft, cushioned feel, making them comfortable for everyday wear.Stylish Design: Available in various colors, they feature a sleek, modern look that pairs well with casual outfits.Breathable Material: The mesh upper promotes airflow, keeping feet cool during wear.Cons:Limited Support: Not ideal for serious running or high-impact activities due to insufficient cushioning and arch support.Snug Entry: The shoe's opening can be tight, making it difficult to put on initially.Durability Concerns: Some users report issues with the mesh tearing after a few months of use.Overall, the Kaptir Flow is great for casual outings but may not meet the needs of serious athletes.

reviewText: I am often hesitant to buy shoes online, especially on a product that allows you to step in hands free.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that these shoes not only fit well, they lived up to their description of being hands free.  The heel is a little higher than most traditional lace up shoes, but not uncomfortably so.  It is sturdy and supportive, and for me, that adds to the secure fit while walking.  Like all Skechers shoes, the insole is extremely cushiony and a pleasure to wear all day.  I reduced the rating by one star simply for the color offerings in this line, but of course that is a personal thing.  If you have problems with bending over to lace shoes and would like an excellent alternative, I highly recommend these shoes.

reviewText: I've become a big fan of these jeans. I've always had Levis, but decided to try these 18 months ago to see how the classic Wrangler jeans looked with my cowboy boots. At that point I had about a dozen pairs of Levis - now, I'm down to two pairs of Levis and eleven pairs of these Wrangler 936 slim fit jeans. That's how much I like them!There's a lot of reviews here saying these jeans are tight, and they are (they're meant to be), but I think some reviewers are perhaps being a little optimistic with their sizing. I wear a 30" waist in Levis and have found that these Wranglers fit me snugly in a 31" waist size, and very snugly with a 30" waist size, but are still not at all uncomfortable. In fact I have both sizes, depending on the look I'm going for - the 31s fit perfectly through the hips and seat, snug but not tight. The 30s however fit me nice and tight in the same areas, as well as being much tighter through the thighs. Both are comfortable but I can feel the 30s pulling everything in as I zip them up, which should give an idea of how they fit. There is certainly no room for bulky underwear and perhaps that's the mistake some people are making with their designer boxers - I'm not an underwear fashion victim however and my "tighty whitey" briefs work absolutely fine with these jeans. The legs are quite trim but go perfectly over the tops of my cowboy boots, I never tuck them into my boots but they are skinny enough to do so if that's your look. The waist is fairly high and looks good with a tucked-in T-shirt and nice belt - I do think those who have a bit of a belly might feel this makes them feel too tight also, but being in my twenties and still managing to hold onto my flat stomach I can't really comment. I may change my mind in a couple of decades, but as it stands, I would agree with a previous reviewer's slightly blunt suggestion that these are really cut to provide a tight fit for boys rather than larger men - so whilst they fit my small frame very nicely, bigger guys looking for a comfier fit would be better off with the 13MWZ version.Quality and detail is nice, perhaps some of the stitching doesn't appear to be on a par with Levis (especially round the crotch) but I've yet to have a pair show any signs of failure. The various colours are nicely finished and (again, unlike some reviewers) I actually quite like the Wrangler patch on the back. Yes, it's plastic and not leather, but that kind-of goes with the simple and basic nature of these jeans. The seven belt loops even on the 30" size is a plus, although not strictly necessary on my small waist I'm sure it helps on the larger sizes. The two front belt loops are a little closer together than I'd like with some of my chunkier belts but it doesn't look out of place and, again, a larger waist will probably not suffer this issue. Other details like the extra rivets and bold "W"s on the pockets are distinctive. The material has a soft and tactile feel entirely missing from my recent Levis, although I should point out that the "rigid" indigo versions of these are made of a much stiffer material. Not unpleasant, just different. With eleven pairs, I have these in most of the available colours and my favourites are the Rough Stone and Charcoal Grey ones, although the bleach ones are a particularly cool colour too.In summary then, great jeans. I always used to find Wranglers a bit "cheesy" as a Levis-wearing kid, but now I wish I'd discovered these years ago. Far better for less money, what more could you want!

reviewText: I recently purchased the Gildan Men's Heavy Cotton T-Shirt, Style G5000 Multipack from Amazon, and I couldn't be more thrilled with my purchase. These shirts have quickly become a staple in my wardrobe for numerous reasons.First and foremost, the quality of these shirts is outstanding. Made from heavy cotton fabric, they feel incredibly soft and durable against the skin. The thickness of the material ensures longevity, making them perfect for daily wear or even as an underlayer during colder months. I'm impressed by how well they hold up wash after wash, maintaining their shape and color without any noticeable shrinkage or fading.Not only do these shirts excel in terms of quality, but their fit is also fantastic. The sizing guide provided by Gildan was accurate, allowing me to choose the perfect fit. The shirts are designed with a relaxed fit, allowing for comfortable movement without being too loose or too tight. With just the right amount of room in the shoulders and chest, these shirts provide a flattering look for any body type.One of the aspects that I appreciate the most about these multipacks is the incredible value for money. The Gildan Men's Heavy Cotton T-Shirt, Style G5000, comes in a pack of multiple shirts at an affordable price point. This not only saves me money but also ensures I have a variety of colors to choose from, adding versatility to my wardrobe. From classic neutrals to vibrant shades, there's a color to suit every occasion and personal style.Another standout feature of these shirts is their overall versatility. Whether I'm running errands, working out at the gym, or dressing casually for a social event, these shirts have proven to be an excellent choice. They effortlessly transition from a laid-back style with shorts to a more polished look when paired with jeans or chinos. reviewText: I have always had a hard time finding dresses that are comfortable, flattering, and also fashionable. This dress hits all of those (plus, it's also affordable!). I live in Tampa, FL, where it's hot and humid most of the year, so I love how the fabric is lightweight but not too thin. I like how the dress gives you a waistline without clinging to the belly area. I like the slightly longer sleeves (keeps me from getting too cold if I step into the A/C for a while!). I also really like that the wrap neckline is sexy but isn't too deep, making the dress appropriate for family settings.The only two possible gripes I have with this dress is that it falls a bit shorter on me than I personally prefer (about 3 above my knees), which makes it so I have to be mindful if it's windy. The second gripe is that the fabric and stitching feel a little bit cheap. But you get what you pay for!Overall, I am very happy with this dress, and I'm thinking about purchasing another! For reference, I bought a size large, I'm 5'8'', my weight is 170 lbs., and my bust/waist/hip measurements are 38, 33, and 43, respectively.

reviewText: The shirts are really excellent. High quality, light weight, extremely soft, and breathable T shirts. They arrived with each shirt individually wrapped,and for the price and quality I'm very happy with them.  The only disappointing thing was realizing they are made in China, which I didn't know beforehand. Nothing against Chinese people of course, but the Chinese Communist Party in charge there is evil and exploits and abuses their own people, so while these shirts are great, I feel some slight shame to know I'm enjoying a product that was likely made using slave labor, or at the very least exploited labor.  Amazon should put Chinese products as one of the filter out options. That being said, they're excellent quality in my humble opinion. Some of the comments on here have said that the neckhole is too wide, but I disagree.  Do you really want a tight collar on a t-shirt? I am posting a picture that I literally just took (I was already wearing one of the shirts,lol) and I really dont feel like the collar is too wide, however, I'm also not a fan of having a tight or close-fitting collar, so maybe that's why. You can judge for yourselves.  I find them extremely comfortable and a good fit.

reviewText: I really like the way these Skechers Men's Cessnock Food Service Shoes look and they function nicely. These are definitely not slip-in types, you will need to keep ahold of the rear of the shoe to get it over the heel and Achilles or use a shoehorn but they are quite easy to put them on and they are very stable and secure feeling once they are on. They are slip resistant, like a lot of this brand are and I walk through several large kitchens during my rounds of a few buildings without having to worry a lot about an unexpected slip fall. I have worn several of Sketchers shoes and many of them are slip-on type. These shoes in particular run a lot more narrow than the others do. If I am moving around these shoes feel really good but if I am standing in place or seated for extended times they squeeze and cut off circulation a tad. I ordered these in the same size I normally would in a Sketchers Slip On. I don't think a larger size would fit as well lengthwise but if I ever order another pair of them I will try a size up just to get them wider.They look good and function well.

reviewText: This is a great jacket for the price.  Zipper is sturdy and cuffs are snug to keep out the wind.  Calling it heavyweight is fine -- but it's not as bulky and heavy as my 23-year old parka (which is still in decent shape), for example.  So, I'd say it provides a lot of warmth for its weight.The handwarmer pockets are big enough for a heavy glove, and the interior pocket has a velcro closure to secure your phone or wallet.The hood is well shaped: it lays down nicely when not in use, and you can mold around your head -- I don't miss having a draw-cord.  It seems pretty secure in the wind as long as you angle it properly.  The fleece lining keeps my head warm when I'm not wearing a knit cap.Fit: I'm 42 chest, and I bought a medium.  I still have room to wear a heavy sweatshirt or sweater under this coat.  I have to say that in temperatures from the mid-20s to high 30s, I don't really need a heavy layer underneath. reviewText: I'm going nuts trying to find cotton socks lately, everything is polyester, cotton is like a premium fabric now. I never buy name brand socks but thought I'd try these because so many of the no-name socks are such garbage. These socks are EXCELLENT. They are very soft, and appear to be thick enough to last for a while.For the record , the most recent cotton crew socks I bought on here were the UnderArmour cotton crews. They were OK, but they did start to get holes in the sole within 6 months or so, which is quicker than I'd hoped (especially since I rotate my socks, only wear the same pair maybe 2x per month?) Anyway, these Polo socks are DEFINITELY softer and higher-quality cotton than the UAs, the elastic is tighter, and I believe they may be slightly thicker as well. Hopefully, they'll hold up better long-term too. But I'm very satisfied for now (it's been two or three wash cycles so far) and will probably order another set of these, since it's so hard to find good cotton socks.One interesting thing: the Polo logo only appears on one side of each 'tube'. (logo is knitted too, not printed, another quality feature) This may be a clever feature for longevity-- if you always wear the logo facing the 'outside' of your leg for example, then each sock will be permanently assigned to either the left foot or the right foot. Not sure if this makes any difference, but it occurs to me it may lessen the 'stretching' of the fabric over time in different directions, which may happen with double-logo socks (swapping each sock back & forth from left foot to right foot after each wash etc). Just a thought.

reviewText: So glad I purchased this coat which was delivered so quickly. It arrived just in time for a real cold snap. I'm 76 years old and as many older people, I get cold easily. I live in the south where we are not used to very cold weather, at least not extended cold weather. Right after the coat arrived the night temps were in the teens with day time temps below freezing. We have two dogs that need to be walked separately early mornngs. So, I layered up, put on this coat, gloves and knit boggan and stayed warm for both walks. Maybe that doesn't impress you but I'm very impressed with this coat. It's well made and wind proof, to some degree anyway. Mine does not have a sleeve patch but does have the chest patch. I don't see the problem. Men wear t-shirts with advertisements on them all the time. It's not a big deal. Anyway, if you've taken the time to read this overly wordy review, you know I'm very happy with this coat and certainly recommend it.

The Pima cotton material is soft and breathable, making it ideal for all-day wear. Whether I'm out and about or just lounging at home, this tee shirt has proven to be extremely comfortable.In addition to its comfort, the brand itself has always been a favorite of mine. Lacoste is known for their high-quality products and this tee shirt is no exception. The craftsmanship is evident in the sturdy stitching and the durability of the fabric. The Lacoste logo adds a touch of class and recognition to the tee, elevating it from a basic tee to a stylish wardrobe staple.However, while I'm extremely pleased with the quality and comfort of this Lacoste tee, I must express my discontent with the cost. The price point for this tee is quite high compared to other brands offering similar products. Though the quality and comfort are undoubtedly superior, the cost may deter potential buyers, as it did give me pause.In conclusion, the Lacoste Contemporary Collection's Men's Short Sleeve Pima Crewneck Tee Shirt is a fantastic product with exceptional comfort and style, but comes with a hefty price tag. If you're willing to invest in a high-quality, comfortable tee from a reputable brand, and the cost is not a deterrent, then I would certainly recommend this product.

reviewText: The Hanes Men's EcoSmart Fleece Full-Zip Hoodie is a solid, budget-friendly choice for everyday casual wear. With its simple design and eco-conscious fabric blend, it offers comfort and practicality at an affordable price.Key Features;EcoSmart Fabric: Made with a blend of cotton and recycled polyester, it’s an environmentally friendly option.Full-Zip Design: The zipper allows for easy on-and-off and adjustable ventilation.Soft Fleece Interior: Provides warmth without being overly bulky.Drawstring Hood: Adjustable hood for added protection against wind and chill.Kangaroo Pockets: Spacious front pockets for keeping hands warm or carrying small essentials.Comfort and Fit;The hoodie is lightweight yet warm, making it perfect for layering in colder weather or as a standalone piece during mild conditions.The fleece lining is soft and feels comfortable against the skin.Pros;Affordable: Great value for a versatile, everyday hoodie.Eco-Friendly: Incorporates recycled materials, a bonus for environmentally conscious shoppers.Comfortable Fit: Soft fleece interior and roomy design ensure all-day comfort.Versatile: Suitable for lounging, casual outings, or light outdoor activities.Colors: Available in about 15 different colors.  I chose the red one and am pleased with my choice.Unisex: Although it says Men's I got 2, and my wife loves hers.Cons;Limited Warmth: Best for mild to moderately cold weather; not ideal for extreme cold.Overall Impression;The Hanes Men's EcoSmart Fleece Full-Zip Hoodie is a reliable and comfortable choice for casual wear. While it’s not the most durable or feature-rich hoodie on the market, it delivers good value for its price and aligns with eco-conscious values.Ideal for anyone seeking an affordable, no-frills hoodie for everyday use.If you prioritize durability or advanced features, you might want to explore higher-end options.

reviewText: I‚Äôm on low carb and have lost over one hundred pounds.  I wasn‚Äôt sure what size to get, so I took a guess and ordered large.  I am  a smidge under 5‚Äô8‚Äù and currently 160 pounds.  I ordered large figuring that if they didn‚Äôt currently fit, they would in another ten or twenty pounds .  They ft really well. They are loose and extremely comfortable.  I was worried about the wrist band, but no worries there.  The waist band is very stretchy,, and placed higher than I thought.  The only thing that bugged me was the button.  It wasn‚Äôt placed quite right or the  buttonhole was not the right size.  They slid off easily when zipped and buttoned, so they are easy enough to slide on and off without bothering about the button! I love these.  I ordered two pair but only received one, but I have another order coming tomorrow, so hopefully it‚Äôs in there.  If it isn‚Äôt  you know who I‚Äôn going to call, and it isn‚Äôt Ghostbusters!  I seriously love these pants.  They are longish like the picture but they don‚Äôt drag on the floor.  I‚Äôm going to be wearing these all summer, fall, etc.  They are keepers. I‚Äôm probably between sizes now, so when I order again, I will go medium.  Even baggy, these are delightful, and a great  investment, and I can easily have them taken in.  No downside for me; I‚Äôm  definitely buying more after I i get to my goal weight.  These pants make me look  really thin and I‚Äôm not quite there yet.  Low carb  and these pants put me in a happy place.Updated:I continued to lose weight after writing the above review.  If, like me, you are watching your weight, I recommend going down a size, or waiting to buy them.  I ordered these again in a medium, when I got down to 146.  They fit very well, and the elastic waist ensures maximum comfort, and the legs and seat are very comfortable and not tight.  The only difference I noticed was that the legs were not wide leg as the others are, but more of a boot cut.  This may be because of the lymph edema.  I love the green, but the medium purple pair I got, is more brown than purple,  and brown is not a color I like, but they‚Äôre fine and fit great.  I also have the light green and the gray, so you know I like these pants!  They are well made and comfortable.  These don‚Äôt shrink in the wash, and are soft, and very pleasant to wear.  Expect lots of compliments.

reviewText: There is nothing anywhere near as well-made as the Wrangler 13MWZ jeans. You just can't beat 'em with a stick! Copper riveting, 7 loops, high back pockets that are pick-pocket proof (unlike those unstylish low pockets on Levi's), high quality 100% #1 strong cotton. These last for years and years of washings. I still have some I bought in 2013.In my opinion the pre-washed (13WMZPW) are the better choice as one doesn't have to go through multiple washings to get them just right. These pre-washed jeans are made in Nicaragua while the regular 13MWZ are made in Mexico. There is no discernable difference in quality as I have several of both kinds. These are made out of tough, thick cotton and won't wear out fast.

reviewText: If you’re looking to channel your inner cowboy with a modern twist, the Wrangler 13MWZ Cowboy Cut Original Fit Jeans are just the ticket. These jeans are built to last, offering the classic look and rugged durability Wrangler is known for, but with a comfortable fit that won’t make you feel like you’re wearing a pair of bricks. Whether you’re working on the ranch, kicking back at the bar, or heading to a casual outing, these jeans have you covered in both style and function.Pros: 1. Durable Construction: Made from tough denim, these jeans can stand up to the rigors of outdoor work or a long day of wear. They’re tough enough for the job, but comfortable enough for downtime. 2. Classic Cowboy Fit: The 13MWZ cut gives you that authentic cowboy look with a bit of room in the seat and thigh, while still offering a slim, straight fit down the leg. This jean will fit the bill if you’re looking for something both classic and practical. 3. Timeless Style: With Wrangler’s signature five-pocket styling and copper rivets, these jeans have a classic western style that’s never out of place. You’ll be ready to ride, dance, or just look good while standing still. 4. Comfortable Waist: The waistband sits just right, providing a comfortable fit without digging into your sides, making these jeans easy to wear all day. 5. Versatile Tan Color: The tan color works well with almost any outfit. Whether you’re pairing them with a plaid shirt or a t-shirt, they’re easy to dress up or down.Cons: 1. Stiff at First: Like most durable denim jeans, these may feel a bit stiff when you first wear them. You might need to break them in a bit before they start feeling more comfortable, but once you do, they’ll be your go-to jeans. 2. May Require Regular Sizing Adjustments: If you’re in between sizes, you might find that they run slightly large, especially after a few washes. You may need to try on a couple of sizes or plan for a slight shrinkage after washing. 3. Limited Stretch: These jeans are made from 100% cotton, so they lack the stretch you might find in modern jeans. If you’re looking for a more flexible, stretchy material, these might not give you the same comfort.For anyone seeking the classic, hardworking appeal of cowboy jeans without sacrificing style or comfort, the Wrangler 13MWZ Cowboy Cut Original Fit Jeans are an excellent choice. The sturdy construction, iconic fit, and timeless design make them a must-have for any denim lover or aspiring cowboy. Just keep in mind that you might need a little patience when it comes to breaking them in!

reviewText: I recently bought the ACVASEN Men's Bomber Jacket, and it’s quickly become a go-to piece in my wardrobe. Not only does it look great with the stand-up collar and stylish design, but it’s also incredibly comfortable. The ribbed cuffs and hem make for a snug, wind-resistant fit that’s perfect on chilly days, and the warm orange polyester lining adds a surprising pop of color and insulation for fall and winter.One thing I love is the practicality. The jacket has multiple pockets: two zippered pockets in the front that are roomy enough for gloves or a wallet, a pencil pocket on the sleeve that’s a nice touch, and even an inner pocket that keeps my phone secure. It’s versatile enough for casual outings, business trips, or outdoor activities like hiking or cycling. For anyone looking for a mix of warmth, style, and functionality, this bomber jacket is spot on.

reviewText: These jeans fit like the proverbial glove in the waist / glute / thigh area, but I have genetically huge calf muscles (even without working them in the gym,) and the cut of these jeans is fairly tight from the knee downward.  They'll stretch with use of course, so I can still wear them, but if I were going to do a Rev B on these I'd take into account the fact that people who are gym rats will also work their calves. Which means a bit more circumferential span is needed there.They don't need much of a tweak - else you'd end up with lower legs that are relaxed-fit-baggy - but maybe another inch in total circumference at the calf. When I bend down for something and stand back up these ride up my calves and stick there, I've suddenly got the Pee-Wee Herman high-water style and have to pull them back down.Not a big deal though. Again they *will* stretch, they are still an excellent fit, they're inexpensive, they're available in a solid, dark indigo dye. Call me strange but I'm not enthused at the idea of buying jeans that look like they've been pre-worn for six months by a garage mechanic with a serious incontinence problem. If there's some kind of perceived stylishness in jeans that are visibly worn, buying them pre-stressed is as lame as buying a guitar with the paint pre-worn.  Like Oh, dig ME, I've used these so intensely that the paint is worn off.  Except... umm, not really.  No.  Just... no. Best of all these are available in 28 length on 32 waist, which eliminates a big peeve of mine vis-à-vis jeans:Manufacturers sell pants based on waist vs. inseam measurements, and while the waist measurement is a definite thing, the inseam is not.  Tailors typically measure your inseam from the point of direct contact with your groin down to your ankle.  So think about it, or better yet just stand up right now and check this out: When you're standing, whatever pants you're wearing do *not* magically stay snugged right up to your Naughty Bits. Rather, the actual cross-seam where the inseam starts will generally hang at least an inch or two *below* the actual, physical surface of your body from which the inseam usually gets measured.Which means - sur-vey SEZ? - the pants you buy with your tailor-measured inseam will be too long, and you're going to be walking around on top of that last inch of cuff, cursing the fact with every step.  Unless you go to the expense and hassle of having them altered after the fact. So... a selection of inseam dimensions that actually matches people's true pant-leg length!  Amazing!  The only thing Amazon - and the whole of the garment industry - could do better is offer men's jeans with those tailor-assumption-inseam options extending all the way down to 26 or 27.  We're not all bean-poles out here. I would argue that the vast majority of men, at least in N. America, are shorter than the garment industry weirdly assumes.I'm writing this before having done a wash and with only a day's wear, so I can't comment on how durable the dye is.  But at least it's at an intense, deep blue as a starting point - and assuming the dye is of decent quality that's the best you can ask for.[Update 07-27-24: All of the above applies - still a good pair of jeans - but I'm not happy with how the dye is fading. There's a serious fade on both the front and back of the thighs but nowhere else, so the result is that cheesy two-tone thing that screams Dig these bargain jeans I got from K-Mart!  I probably won't be buying more of these until (unless) I start seeing raves about how this problem - and the calf-size problem - have been corrected in a Rev. B.]

reviewText: I bought the Under Armour Men's Tech 2.0 Short-Sleeve T-Shirt for my son, and he absolutely loves it! The fabric is incredibly soft, lightweight, and breathable, making it perfect for everyday wear, sports, or even workouts. The moisture-wicking technology keeps him cool and dry, which is especially great during active days. The fit is comfortable and true to size, with a nice, modern cut that flatters without being too tight. The V-neck style adds a bit of a sporty, stylish touch. The shirt holds up well after several washes, maintaining its shape and softness, and the color stays vibrant. It’s quickly become one of his favorite go-to shirts. I highly recommend this T-shirt for anyone looking for a versatile, high-quality piece for their wardrobe!

reviewText: You can wear them, they are made of fabric. They are moderately comfortable. I do not feel restricted in them, nor do I feel naked. In fact, I feel at least half-clothed when I wear them. They are visually unremarkable, and well suited to conceal some or all of your thighs. People will not really notice you are wearing these shorts, it will be more of an observation like that man has shorts that doesn't really feel like an observation. Sometimes people should wear pants, and when I wear pants, sometimes I wear these shorts. They are shorts and I wear them and half of my legs and all of my tush and crotch are concealed from casual view. Sometimes if I forget, or do not feel like it, I will wear them without underwear. I think this is fun to do sometimes, but not at formal occasions. I would say these are not formal shorts. If I was to wear these at a gala, people might notice me wearing them and think that man is wearing shorts and maybe this would be thought with disapproval, or in shock. Sometimes it is hard to access the pockets, and I think this suboptimal, since if your hands struggle to find or go into the pocket, you cannot get or deposit what you wish. Personally, I wish I had more pockets, and even a pocket on my tummy sometimes, but not a uterus like a kangaroo's, but more of a furry little place I could put things, but I also think this is unrealistic, a big flap of hairy skin would be scary to really live with. People might call you names, or assume that perhaps you are some sort kangaroo-man chimera.

reviewText: I have both and am wearing both; alternatively, I can speak the pros and cons of both.Hoka Bondi 8 is a cushioned shoe; Brooks Max is the equivalent of I; both are comparable in proof. Here are the significant differences:1. Hoka Bondi is heavier and too soft; it makes you feel tired after a long walk, even though it is cushioned well. Still, it also feels that the cushion is high and too thick, which may make you think that sometimes you are not balanced well. I sometimes feel that I am dragging my feet moving forward.2. Brooks have more support and is firmer than Hoka, I like it better.3. Brooks appears to be more durable. As I started wearing Brooks more for my daily walk, I noticed they wear better than Hoka. While Hoka's bottom already shows signs of wear, Brooks does not, even though I wear them more.This review is subjective to my feelings about both shoes. I recognize that running shoes are very personal. I have been a long-time user of Hoka, but after I tried Brooks Max, I liked them better.

reviewText: My expectations were low -- how good could shirts that sell 3 for $30 be?  No one will mistake these for an expensive designer shirt, but I was shocked and pleasantly pleased at how nice these shirts are for the money.  The medium-weight polyester fabric has a touch of shininess that is typical for inexpensive poly fabrics, but is comfortable against the skin and has a little give/stretch.  My size medium was slightly larger than my favorite name-brand polos -- about one-inch bigger in circumference in the body and armholes, so fit was a little looser than I prefer, but not saggy or baggy.  I liked the colors and the striped trim on the sleeves and collar.  Construction was good with even stitching and seems.  The buttonholes are slightly tight, but work OK.  Haven't laundered yet, but will update the review if there's any problem.Bottom line - At $10 each, these are an incredibly good deal for a decent looking polo shirt.

reviewText: Finding the perfect pair of jeans can feel like an endless quest, but with Lee Men's Extreme Motion Regular Straight Jean, the search is over. As someone who values both comfort and style, I've found these jeans to be a game-changer in my wardrobe.The standout feature of the Lee Extreme Motion jeans is their unparalleled comfort. Constructed with innovative stretch denim technology, these jeans offer an exceptional range of motion without sacrificing durability. Whether I'm running errands around town or lounging at home, I never feel restricted or uncomfortable in these jeans. The freedom of movement they provide is truly unmatched.But comfort doesn't come at the expense of style. The Regular Straight fit strikes the perfect balance between modern and classic, with a versatile silhouette that complements any look. Whether dressed up with a button-down shirt or dressed down with a casual tee, these jeans effortlessly elevate my style game.Another highlight of the Lee Extreme Motion jeans is their durability. Made with quality materials and expert craftsmanship, they're built to withstand the rigors of daily wear and tear. From the reinforced stitching to the sturdy hardware, every detail is carefully considered to ensure longevity.Practicality is also a key consideration. The classic five-pocket design offers ample storage for essentials like keys, wallet, and phone, while the zip fly with button closure provides a secure fit. Additionally, these jeans are machine washable, making them easy to care for and maintain.In terms of fit, the Lee Extreme Motion jeans are true to size and offer a comfortable yet tailored look. The Regular Straight leg falls nicely without being too loose or too tight, making them suitable for a wide range of body types.Overall, the Lee Men's Extreme Motion Regular Straight Jean is a must-have addition to any wardrobe. With their unbeatable comfort, timeless style, durability, and practicality, they're the perfect jeans for everyday wear. Whether you're tackling a busy day at the office or kicking back on the weekend, these jeans have you covered in both comfort and style.

These pants are very nice quality, and my adult son was happy to take them off of my hands, Had I done better research, I would have realized that tapered legs are in style. As a 57-year-old man, I am a bit stuck with traditional ideas concerning my wardrobe. The seller very kindly offered a full refund, just based upon my review (which I did not accept), so customer service is also top notch! And my 22-year-old loves the pants.

reviewText: I ordered this hooded flannel shirt for my teenage son for Christmas. Unfortunately, they had sent an XXXL instead of just a regular large. The outside package said Large, but the shirt was definitely a bigger size. No worries. They immediately sent out the correct size. Actually, my son, who is about 5'8 and less than 140 pounds, probably could have gotten away with a medium, but he chose a large. I guess he prefers a looser style. He likes to wear it open with a rock t-shirt underneath. The directions say to hang it up after washing to air dry, so that's what I have been doing, and it has held up nicely. It is thicker than the other hooded flannel shirts that he owns, and it seems to be of quality material. It isn't thick like a flannel jacket, if that's what you are looking for. I didn't expect it to be. My son just wanted a regular flannel shirt, and he seems to love, so I am very pleased with the purchase.

reviewText: These Men's Performance Tech Loose-Fit Shorts have proven to be a reliable choice for my workout needs. As someone who's active and hits the gym regularly, finding comfortable and breathable workout shorts is crucial, and these shorts deliver on those fronts.The fit is on point - not too snug, not too loose - providing the freedom of movement necessary for various exercises. I appreciate the comfort they offer during my workout sessions, ensuring I can focus on pushing myself without any unnecessary distractions.Breathability is another highlight. The fabric allows for ample ventilation, helping to keep me cool and comfortable, even during intense workouts. This is a crucial factor for me, especially in the warmer months.However, I did notice that the material used isn't of the highest quality. While these shorts get the job done, you can tell they might not withstand heavy wear and tear over the long term. It's a minor concern, considering their affordable price point and the fact that they do perform well during workouts.In conclusion, these Men's Performance Tech Loose-Fit Shorts have become a staple in my workout wardrobe. They excel in fit, comfort, and breathability, ticking off the boxes I consider most important. While the material quality isn't top-notch, these shorts still represent great value for their performance. If you're looking for dependable workout shorts without breaking the bank, these are a solid choice.

reviewText: So I’m 510 and 245 ish, I ordered the 2XL and it fits good, XL would’ve “fit” better but this is an outer layer that breaks the wind and keeps water off of you, so with the 2xl I’m able to wear layers under it to keep me warm. Would’ve been better to have an exterior chest pocket for a cell phone imo.On the bottom of the main front zipper, it has 2 zippers? Maybe this serves a legit purpose that I’ve not seen but for me, it’s aggravating sometimes trying to get it unzipped because they have to be perfect for it to come off. reviewText: Hanes ComfortSoft EcoSmart Men's Fleece Sweatpants are basically the official uniform for anyone who’s decided that regular pants are just an unnecessary societal construct. These sweatpants aren’t just clothing—they’re a lifestyle choice, one that says, “I could do real pants, but why?”First Impressions:The moment you slip into these bad boys, it’s like your legs have been given their own personal cloud to lounge on. Seriously, I’m pretty sure these sweatpants are softer than my hopes and dreams. And the fleece? Oh man, it’s like a hug from a really cozy bear who’s also really into saving the environment, because these pants are EcoSmart, after all. That’s right, you’re saving the planet—in sweatpants. Take that, jeans!The Fit:Let’s talk fit. These pants are roomy. Like, “I could fit an extra sandwich in my pocket and you wouldn’t even know” roomy. They’ve got that classic “I’ve completely abandoned all attempts at impressing anyone” vibe, but in a way that’s kind of charming. The waistband is adjustable, so whether you’ve just finished a workout or just finished a pizza (no judgment), these pants will expand or contract to match your life choices. Elastic cuffs? Oh yeah, you bet. They’re keeping things in place, but not too tight—just tight enough to remind you that you’re still a functioning human.Fashion Forward?Fashionable? Well, let’s just say no one’s going to mistake these for runway couture, but who cares? Sweatpants don’t need to be fashionable. They’re timeless. Whether you’re working from home, binge-watching a show, or just staring out the window wondering when it’s acceptable to take a nap, these pants are the perfect companion. Plus, they come in multiple colors, so you can technically have one for each day of the week. That’s basically the same as putting effort into your wardrobe, right?Durability:These things are built to last. I’m pretty sure they’d survive an apocalypse. You could probably wear them every day for a month straight (no judgment if you do), and they’d still hold up. Plus, they’re EcoSmart, which means they’re made with recycled materials. So not only are you avoiding real pants, but you’re also helping save the planet. Talk about multitasking!The Comfy Test:I did a “Comfy Test,” which involves lying on the couch in various positions for hours and seeing if the pants pass. Spoiler: they absolutely do. Sitting, slouching, sprawling—these pants support it all. I’m pretty sure they could double as pajamas if I weren’t already living in them during the day.

reviewText: I recently purchased the 4-pack of 100% polyester polos, and overall, I’m very pleased with my purchase. Here’s a quick breakdown of my experience:**Pros:**- **Comfort:** These polos are lightweight and breathable, which makes them perfect for warmer weather or active days. The fabric feels soft against the skin, and I’ve found them comfortable to wear for extended periods.- **Durability:** After a few washes, the colors have held up well without any noticeable fading. The stitching seems solid, and I haven’t experienced any pilling or fraying so far.- **Fit:** The sizing is true to size. They’re not too tight or too baggy, providing a nice, relaxed fit that’s still presentable for casual or semi-formal occasions.- **Value for Money:** Getting a 4-pack at this price point is a great deal! It’s perfect for work, outings, or even casual golfing.**Cons:**- **Wrinkle Resistance:** While polyester is generally known for being wrinkle-resistant, these polos still tend to wrinkle a bit if left folded or crumpled for too long. It’s not a dealbreaker but something to keep in mind.- **Style:** These polos are fairly basic in terms of design. If you’re looking for something more fashion-forward, these may not be the best choice. But if you need a reliable staple, they work great.**Final Thoughts:**For the price and quality, this 4-pack of 100% polyester polos is a solid purchase. They’re versatile, comfortable, and durable enough to last through regular wear. Just keep in mind that they may require a bit of ironing and aren’t the most stylish option out there. Overall, a great addition to my wardrobe!

reviewText: The photo shows what the shorts looked like as received.  There’s quite a few wrinkles and a 3” length of each crease is double creased.  I find it hard to get the wrinkles out of 100% polyester material so that’s why I rated these 4 stars.  Otherwise these shorts have some high quality features.  The fabric is thick and has a little stretch to it.  All of the sewing is first rate and there are nice mesh pockets.  The shorts have 5 belt loops that are firmly attached.  The front zipper appears to be very well made and it should hold up nicely.  I ordered size 38 and they were slightly large so if you like your shorts to fit snug consider ordering one size smaller than your usual size.

reviewText: As someone who values both comfort and style, I recently purchased a pair of sweatpants that have completely transformed my loungewear game. From the moment I slipped them on, I knew I had found my new favorite go-to for both lounging at home and running errands.These sweatpants are incredibly soft, made from a high-quality fleece material that feels like a gentle hug against the skin. The elastic waistband is perfectly adjustable, ensuring a snug fit without being restrictive. Whether I‚Äôm lounging on the couch or out for a morning jog, I never feel uncomfortable.I was pleasantly surprised by how well they fit. reviewText: Personally I LOVE the Bolter brand t shirts, but since they seem to no longer exist, and Kennedy Todd brand which I got last time when I couldn't find any more Bolter ones, which Kennedy Todd is basically identical to- I broke down and tried these. Growing up in the 80s, quality and fit of the cheap brands was a million times better than it is now. I'm sick of trying to save money by buying the cheap brands, only to have them shrink 6-8 inches in width in 6 months or less, immediately have holes in them, etc. This was the first time buying a designer brand, and well they're thinner and lighter weight than I expected for starters. They get larger after wearing for only 1-2 hours too; the neckline gets much lower, they fit looser and just stretch out a lot. Haven't washed enough to know if they will shrink yet or not. Didn't notice any holes or loose threads at least, which is a good start. Probably by the time I need new shirts again, these won't be an option anymore either, and I'll have to try something else; living in the northeast we don't get any products of any kind that aren't either factory screw ups, or discontinued/recalled/stuff nobody else wanted in the rest of the country for a tenth of what we have to pay for it years later, so not being able to have any brand loyalty is pretty much a given. Overall these seem ok; pricey for no real reason, but decent. Everything costs an arm and a leg up here anyway, so cheap crap is overpriced as all get out too. B grade overall.

reviewText: I bought this brand and another brand to compare. I really like the fabric and design of these pants. They are not flimsy, but rather a nice quality weight fabric. The design is also nice with a dressier look than just your average beach pant. I ordered khaki and the color is exactly as expected. For reference, I wear a 32x32 jean and ordered a size medium. Here's where I ran into some problems. The pants I received fit perfectly in the waist. The length, although wearable, is a little shorter than I like. I didn't wash the pants, but if they ever shrink, then I really won't be able to comfortably wear them at a shorter length. I think the waist would probably be ok. Narrowing the leg of the pant would probably help give a different look to the pants. When I compared the length of these pants to the other brand I bought, there was only about a 1/2 inch difference in length. However, the other brand is more of a tapered leg and looks way longer to the eye despite the very minor difference in length. I'm not sure if the short pant length is relegated to this particular pair, since other reviewers said the pants they received were long? I may try another pair to see if they come longer next time? The overall cut is fuller, so it looks weird to have a short pant leg. Overall, I like the quality of the pants and would recommend them provided you receive a size that fits properly. I was disappointed because I like the large color selection and the quality of these. Hopefully, my next pair will come a little longer?

reviewText: I have two pairs of the Crossroads (in army and anthracite which is bluish-grey) and two of the Lee Extreme Motion Swope shorts (shadow and black). The overall fit of the Swope shorts is the same but it's a heavier material so good for fall and spring. The cargo pockets also have a button instead of velcro that's on the Crossroads. These are the only shorts I'll ever wear now.What I love about the shorts is how lightweight and breathable they are. The fit is snug on the waist but because of the built-in nylon and spandex, it provides great flexibility. They don't feel too tight nor loose and you can wear them without a belt - or a lightweight one. When you're sitting down, the waist and crotch are relaxed so your boys will be free of any pressure. Length hits right just at the knees.I often wear them for bicycle riding, mountain biking, and skateboarding. The material makes them great for sports in general. I'm a professional dog walker so the cargo pockets are handy for storing poop bags. Underneath the right pocket is a hole that's perfect for your phone. I have a Google Pixel 4a and slights right in.Pricing is awesome as well at $30 a pair. Most shorts like this cost $50-$60. They are super affordable so be sure to stock up and buy three or four pairs to last you the next couple of years.Note: if you order the army color, it's not olive green but more like sage green.

reviewText: I’ve been on the hunt for jeans that offer both comfort and durability, and the Lee Extreme Motion Jeans have truly exceeded my expectations. The fit was exactly as advertised, and after multiple washes, these jeans still look and feel great. I’ve bought several pairs, and they all hold up well, proving their worth time and again. reviewText: I recently purchased this six-pack of black undershirts from Amazon, and I must say I am thoroughly impressed with my purchase. The sleeves are just the right length, and the overall length of the shirt ensures it stays neatly tucked in, maintaining a polished look.Durability is crucial when it comes to undershirts, and I'm happy to report that these shirts have held up exceptionally well. After numerous washes, they show no signs of fading, stretching, or losing their shape. The quality of the stitching and fabric speaks to the attention to detail put into their construction.The rich black color hasn't diminished over time, and I appreciate that these undershirts maintain their sleek appearance even after repeated laundering. The color also makes them versatile, seamlessly complementing various outfits.One of the things I value most about this purchase is the affordability. A six-pack at this price point is an excellent deal, especially considering the quality of the product. It's a cost-effective way to build up a collection of reliable undershirts without breaking the bank.In conclusion, I highly recommend these black undershirts from Amazon. They offer a winning combination of comfort, quality, and affordability. Whether you're dressing for a professional setting or casual occasions, these undershirts are a reliable and stylish choice. reviewText: I recently purchased the Amazon Basics workout shirts, and I have been extremely impressed with their quality and performance. They have a flattering and athletic cut that accentuates my physique. The seams are sturdy and well-constructed, ensuring durability over time. The shirts have a tagless design, which eliminates any irritation on the back of the neck.Another great feature of these shirts is their versatility. They can be worn not only for workouts but also as casual everyday wear. I've even worn them for hiking and outdoor activities, and they have held up well.Overall, I highly recommend the Amazon Basics workout shirts. They are high-quality, comfortable, and stylish. reviewText: I bought for the purpose of travel and outdoor use in those times where temps can change drastically from 70F in the morning down to 40F at night.I got this on sale for $20 which was a far cry from $60-120 asking price of other packable down jackets. For the price, it's much warmer than I thought and has well thought out features. So far I've worn this in 42F weather, coldest and just going on a walk I was breaking a bit of a sweat with it half zipped. It has 2 exterior pockets and 2 internal pockets. Personally I wouldn't put too much in these, as I can really feel the thing stretch and drag down. Just gloves, hat, phone etc. should be fine, nothing like a can of soda or something. Water resistance is what you expect for thin nylon stuff, a few drops is fine,  actual rain, get an umbrella or an actual waterproof layer. It's also pretty windproof, took it out in the aftermath of a pseudo hurricane and didn't feel the wind.It packs down pretty well into a 6 inch long 3 inch or so bundle but nothing like the high tech hiking stuff, I just wish there was a shorter loop so I can carabiner it to my pack easier but seems like it was intended to be carried like an umbrella. Also wish it packed into itself rather than have a bag which may get lost one day.  The material imo isn't very durable, I have no rips yet, but I'm not confident and think if I rub on something the wrong way it's going to tear. The stitching seems fine so far, and doesn't seem to be leaking filler yet.Sizing wise, I have a 45 chest and usually wear XL, but this is kinda big even for an XL, maybe because they were antiicpating you layer something like a thick sweater underneath. It is also a bit long for my torso, about 2-3 inches more than I need to sit at my waist. I have 23 sleeves and that fits perfect.I don't expect this to last a long time, but it's useful for the time I'll have it.12/28 edit:So I just used this exactly for what I bought it for because of the huge winter storm that swept across the north and east coast US. Temps went from nearly 60 degrees in daytime all the way down to 23 by late afternooon with extremely high winds that were throwing doors around and knocked some street signs off their mounts, and it was perfect. I just had a t-shirt underneath and on top of this was a gymax waterproof windproof jacket. Again my only complain might be if the material doesn't last and it's a bit long.

reviewText: As someone who values both comfort and longevity in everyday essentials, I recently had the pleasure of experiencing the New Balance 6 Boxer Briefs, and I'm excited to share my thoughts on these exceptional undergarments. Whether I'm running errands, hitting the gym, or going about my daily routine, these boxer briefs stay in place, providing confidence and ease of wear.Durability that Lasts:One of the standout features of the New Balance 6 Boxer Briefs is their exceptional durability. Despite frequent washing and wear, these boxer briefs show minimal signs of wear and tear. The premium stitching and quality materials contribute to their longevity, making them a true investment in comfort that pays off over time.Breathable and Moisture-Wicking:The breathability of these boxer briefs is truly impressive. This is especially valuable during warmer weather or intense workouts, as the boxer briefs effectively manage moisture to prevent discomfort.Versatile and Stylish:Not only do the New Balance 6 Boxer Briefs excel in comfort and functionality, but they also boast a sleek and minimalist design. With their unmatched comfort, perfect length, and remarkable durability, these boxer briefs have become an essential part of my daily routine. Whether you're seeking undergarments for casual wear, workouts, or a combination of both, these boxer briefs offer an unparalleled level of comfort and performance. The investment in quality pays off with boxer briefs that not only stand the test of time but also provide day-long comfort that you can rely on.
