reviewText: I was wanting OD green shirts, but couldn't find them at the local craft store since they only carry select colors.  So Of course if you can't find it locally than Amazon will more than likely have what you are looking for so I looked and found what I wanted!  I ended up buying a 3 pack of large and XLARGE  for more than i would have payed at the craft store, but honestly since these were on sale for a decent price i ordered them. Upon receving them I found that they looked exactly as depicted and I didn't see any discrepancies. To me The fabric felt exactly like the ones of the same brand that I buy at the craft store...nice medium thickness,but soft .  I did wash the XL shirts since my husband planed to wear them as they are and they washed nicely.. I didn't see any issues with shrinkage.  However my husband ended up not liking the shirts , because he said the neck was too small for him (he body builds so some shirts just dosnt fit him like he likes ) and he didn't think the fabric felt the same as the ones he already had . So he apparently wont wear them and I unfortunately cannot return them. Im sure I'll find something else to do with them . Now the Large Is what I bought myself so I can make my own graphic Shirts with heat transfer vinyl so it haven't washed those yet , but I'm sure they will be fine. Overall I'm pleased with my order so far and will more than likely order other colors for myself.

reviewText: Rather than my husband always wearing sneakers with chinos or jeans I came across these Bruno Marc’s.The appearance, reviews and number of buyers is what persuaded me to buy the them over the other brands.He tried them on today but hasn’t worn them so this review is a first impression. I may come back in late September to let you know if there were any negatives about the wear.The shoe out of the box is impressive. Lightweight casual dress. The material of the upper shoe has some type of elastacine (sp) that gives it some stretch/give when you walk. They are breathable which is important to him.I’m not sure if they will stretch overtime but if they do, a tightening of the shoe strings should provide more support.The inner soul is removable for anyone who wears orthotics. My husband does, but after trying them on with and without, he said the foot bed is comfortable enough he may not need the orthopedics for times that he won’t be doing much walking.The shoe laces are a tightly woven fabric over elastic and they hold firmly when tied. The shoe soul is rubberized material, is lightweight and provides for a comfortable sneaker like feel.He buys sizes 8 but his true size is 7.5. He said his toes still have about 1/2” to the end of the shoe and the toe box is very roomy. He likes that because some shoes squeeze his forefoot. No pain in these.We purchased the navy and the color is beautiful.I tried them on and I would be very comfortable wearing them.At this point, we have to give them a 5 star rating. Even though we can’t speak to the performance at this time, we believe they are a good value for the price and construction . This is a good looking shoe.

reviewText: Ariat jeans are a game-changer for tall men who have struggled to find well-fitting denim. I have learned that Ariat jeans are the go-to choice for men who are tall and lean or have a lanky build.What sets Ariat jeans apart is their attention to detail and quality craftsmanship. The jeans are made from durable, high-quality materials that are designed to last for years, and they feature reinforced seams and heavy-duty hardware. The result is a pair of jeans that can stand up to whatever you throw at them, whether you're working on the ranch, out on the town, or simply running errands.But what really sets Ariat jeans apart is their sizing. Unlike other brands that offer limited sizing options, Ariat jeans are available in a wide range of sizes, including very tall men's sizes. This means that men who are six feet or taller can finally find a pair of jeans that fits well and looks great.What's more, Ariat jeans are designed with comfort in mind. They have a classic, straight-leg fit that provides plenty of room to move, and they're made from stretch denim that moves with you. This means that you can wear them all day without feeling restricted or uncomfortable.Overall, if you're a tall man who has struggled to find jeans that fit well, Ariat jeans are an excellent choice. They're well-made, comfortable, and available in a wide range of sizes, so you can finally find a pair of jeans that looks and feels great.

reviewText: Lee jeans have fit me best since I was a kid. Now the skinny jeans are too tight for a grandmother, but I still wear the bootcut in my seventies! And still giggling when I remember my Mormon Mama declaring jeans were inappropriate for girls. I am a Country girl raised in a logging community. Retired in AZ I garden in my Lee jeans and really do not care how my LDS relatives dress. I do know it was miserable wearing short skirts in the  rain forest. I have had leg aches my entire life. Wear compression leggings now underneath and hope the country schools start letting girls dress for comfort instead of appearances. We couldn’t wear maxi dresses either. So we went mini? They insisted we dress in skirts. We would have been more comfortable in jeans! And I still am!

reviewText: 01/24: Chilly Festival Friendly! Wanted something to keep me warm in 40-50 degree weather, but that I could also compress into a hydration back pack ! This was perfect! .... love the ability to easily roll it into the included compact bag; I just wear with the bag attached as it arrived... u don't feel it...and you'll never lose it....it  looks good on... fits great.... & was warm enough - it really does retain body heat....  all that plus its lightweight w/no added bulk! Ive had no issue with the zipper...but remember its  only like a 30-40 dollar jacket...so just be patient &  careful with it is all and don't expect to wear it snug and not have an issue with the zipper eventually  ... Will also be taking it snowboarding soon. Very happy with this affordable purchase. Great value. (Size M, Black)UPDATE: 02/24.... purchased a 2nd jacket in Size: L:  .... worked perfect for me as a snowboarding mid layer! ... as a 1st timer to snow, this made it easy for me paired with just  a balaclava hoodie, a set of thermals, a bib pant, snowboarding socks & gloves I was comfortably warm as it was snowing with temps in the 20s described as a part cloudy, part sunny day with 2inches of snowfall expected (after 11inches the day prior) .... . I didn't need my top layer jacket... I stayed warm ... I remained dry .... I ended up purchasing the Sz: L to allow for layering & for more movement. reviewText: I recently purchased a shirt that has quickly become one of my favorites, and I just had to share my thoughts on it. The fit is fantastic; it hugs my body in all the right places while still allowing enough room for comfort. Whether I’m dressing it down for a casual outing or dressing it up for a night out, it adapts beautifully to whatever style I’m going for.What I love most about this shirt is its versatility. On a casual day, I can pair it with jeans and sneakers for a laid-back look, and it feels effortlessly chic. On the flip side, when I want to elevate my outfit for a more dressy occasion, I can easily tuck it into a skirt or dress pants, and it instantly transforms into a polished ensemble. This adaptability makes it a staple in my wardrobe, and I can already see it becoming my go-to top for various occasions.In conclusion, this shirt is a delightful blend of style, quality, and versatility. With its fun sleeves, comfortable fit, and lightweight feel, it’s perfect for anyone looking to add a little flair to their outfits. Whether you’re aiming for casual or dressy, this shirt delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended!

reviewText: For me the sizing of 12.5 was correct.  Shoe feels very comfortable and sole is flexible but not overly which allows for a comfortable walk especially for those having toe joint issues. The color I choice is very light and I know it will show dirt pretty easy .  It is not machine washable.  Only spot leaning by hand so keep that in mind especially if you are looking at very light colors.  The fabric material is very soft and breathable so certainly not water resistant.  I question if it will show surface abrasion wear in a short time.  The only thing I do not care for is the tongue of the shoe is only sewed at the very bottom which leaves the entire sides not attached.  This can leave the tongue moving to the side more than desired while it is being put on and the increased opportunity for foreign items such needle grass to enter the shoe. Just an observation.  Overall I am pleased with the shoe. A good value for the money.  Made in China

reviewText: For reference my husband is 6’2, 205 pounds with broad shoulders, long arms, long legs, and a short torso. He wears a 44L in men’s suits and 36W/34L (pants). His neck is 17.5”. So WTS, here’s how it fit:The jacket is a perfect fit particularly across the back of his shoulders. He can button the top button closest to his neck without feeling chocked/restricted. The arms fall right at the break of his wrists. However, there’s too much room around the waist area but that’s because he’s more narrow at the bottom. The problem is that it causes the slits on the back of the jacket to gap open which looks kinda funky so I’ll have to have it altered for a more tailored look. I will add that the fabric is very nice, not too heavy and the jacket is lined.As for the pants, they are paper thin (see through) and soft. The wooden button is a little difficult to use, as he got tired of trying to dislodge it so he ended up carefully pulling the pants off with them buttoned. The pants fall slightly above his ankles, and the fit is definitely snug around the waist, butt and thighs. My husband also has runner’s thighs and is not comfortable wearing tight or fitted clothing but this is how they’re supposed to fit. So yeah, it’ll take him a minute to get used to it but he only has to wear this for a few hours so he’ll be fine. So IMO the pants are fine but be forewarned that if your (or his) waist is 38+ the pants could potentially be a problem.The colors are like a sherbet coral, creamy white and soft blue. The quality is good and it was delivered in 2 days. Thus far, I have no regrets about this purchase. I hope this helps as there weren’t a lot of reviews at the time of my purchase.

reviewText: I bought this to take on a trip through the UK, France, and Italy. The jacket I purchased is yellow. I wanted something that would be adequately warm on a cool spring day so I wouldn’t have to bring another sweatshirt or have to pack long sleeve shirts. I also wanted something that folded up very small as I was only taking a backpack for 10 days. This jacket fit the bill perfectly. It comes with a bag which will compress the jacket down to about the size of a smaller shoe, but the way I found best to pack it was to fold it into quarters, flat, and put it on top of my clothes in my backpack. The jacket would compress almost completely flat, adding almost no bulk to my bag. It was like a magic trick how small it became. When I wanted to have it handy, but did not want to carry it, I would stick it through the handle of my backpack, pulling it halfway through, and it would stay there securely when I put my bag into overhead luggage storage on the Italo and Eurostar, making to easy to grab if I became cold.  There were some cold and very windy evenings and nights when we were in London and Paris (50 degrees F, with a strong breeze coming off the Thames and Seine) and this jacket kept me warm with just a t-shirt on underneath. I encountered a brief rain shower on the Path of the Gods and stayed dry and the jacket dried pretty quickly. I can’t speak to how well it would perform in a heavy downpour as that was the only rain I experienced during my trip. Overall, this jacket was perfect for me and at the price point, I was not going to be upset if it got lost, stolen, or ruined. After being stuffed in my bag over and over and shoved into overhead storage, the jacket still looks brand new. Not to mention it looked stylish in all of the photos my wife and I took! I am 6’6” and weigh about 190lbs and I bought a large. It fit well without a lot of extra bulk and the sleeves were long enough for my wingspan. 10/10, would recommend!

reviewText: If you’re reading this, size up a half size when purchasing! These run SMALLER than previous glycerin models!I have always been a size 6.5 WIDE in Brooks and have had several previous “Glycerin” models, so I was very surprised when 6.5 wide was not only too small but too NARROW. I sized up to a 7, and it fits much better.That being said, Brooks is stepping up their game in terms of the style and colors of their shoes. In my opinion, the Glycerin 21 is the most attractive shoe I’ve owned from brooks and the first that doesn’t somewhat resemble “old people shoes”. Looks aside, I will say that I like the fit of the previous model — Glycerin 20 — a bit better. The bottom of the shoes are very padded and heavier like Hokas, which is great for walking but not the best for running.Overall, Brooks is still the best option out there in terms of comfort and traction. I wear brooks every day for my job (on my feet and walking ALL day as a fitness professional), and my feet and back always feel great — unlike with other brands! Great shoe. Just make sure to size UP, especially if you have wide feet!

reviewText: These traditional Jeans by Levi Strauss are really perfect in every respect. Excellent fabric, smooth and skin friendly. There can be no doubt that there are other denims out there, other companies that make excellent Jeans, but Levi Strauss has the brand and the product that leads the pack. It is a tough competitive field but if there is an improvement or inventive idea in how to make a product more comfortable or to last longer Levi Strauss will be putting those improvements into their garments. So true of those traditional patented button rivets that have made their pants last longer since their inception.Let me remind you that Levi Strauss uses very traditional sizing. There is no about to the ABOUT.If you are a size 38 about the waist that is what you will get..and you will have a fine fitting pair of pants.The Jeans were very well packaged and delivered with personal care by the P service.I could not wait to try them on since it had been quite a spell since I had come to need a pair of Levi Strauss Jeans...a few years since my last purchase. This was more or less a test to see if the product was still good quality. It is, so I will be buying more. Levis are always my choice in dressy casuals and you just cant beat the fit and the soft overall comfort that I experienced the moment I put them on.It is really difficult to review something that is so decidedly different in so many respects.I am well satisfied and would speculate with more than a modicum of surety that the Levi Strauss brand will continue in the biz for a good long stretch to come.I give these Traditional britches by Levi Strauss a full five star rating for quality and value.I am wearing them as I write this review. No bind no pinched feeling anywhere.In my opinion that quality and fair pricing is responsible for the popularity of this dry goods store product since the mid 19th century.Get out that cloth tailors tape....measure your waist and inseam and order the size to suit.

reviewText: as a slender, tall woman who is also a senior, I prefer fleece sweatpants for warmth on cold winter days.  Most sweatpants for women, that are in style today, have a cuff, which do not sit at my ankle, so I go to a man's pant for that length and just size down to a small.  I also prefer no cuff for the ease of slipping pants on and off without removing sneakers. Now I have warm pants that hug my legs and are long enough to be stylish.  However, the men's styling  do not conform to the female curves until their worn a few times and stretch a bit in the hip and rear areas.  But they still remain comfortable enough to wear out and not just to the gym.  Hopefully this fabric will not pill easily, but at the price point paid, they can easily be replaced with new pairs.

reviewText: My grandson picked this coat out for this year's season.  I like the looks, the specs looked good and they were on sale for a decent price so I bought one for myself as well.I am very happy with them.  Its heavy but not so heavy to uncomfortable.  We have not hit extreme cold yet but we have had some very cold days and have hit some cold days with some high winds putting the wind chill in the teens even flirting with single digit wind chills and this coat was great.  I was really impressed with how well this coat handles the wind.  It does not have a hood, but I did not really want one.  I am confident with this coat going deeper into harsher parts of a mid-west winter.  Its just big enough for me that if I need to layer a little bit in an Artic blast it will still be comfortable.  It does not have a hood which I did not want one.  I use an insulated gator and a good with hat and when it's really bad one of my layers will have a hood that I can pull over those for a little extra wind protection.  Just don't turn the heat up too high in the car or you will be pulling over to take it off LOL.  Only negative I have is that it says not to tumble dry on any level when you wash it and you can't dry clean it.  So, if you wash it be sure you are not going to need it for at least 2 days.

reviewText: I recently purchased the 5 Pack Men's Dry Fit T-Shirts for my workout routine, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. These shirts are a game-changer when it comes to comfort and performance during athletic activities.The first thing that caught my attention was the incredible softness of the material. The fabric feels gentle against the skin, making these shirts exceptionally comfortable to wear, even during intense workouts. It's a testament to the quality of the materials used.Fit is crucial when it comes to workout gear, and these shirts hit the mark perfectly. The sizing is accurate, providing a snug yet non-restrictive fit. I appreciate how they contour to the body without feeling too tight, allowing for a full range of motion during any exercise.One of the standout features for me is the breathability of these shirts. Whether I'm running, lifting weights, or doing yoga, the moisture-wicking technology keeps me cool and dry throughout my entire workout. It's a great feeling to stay comfortable and focused without being weighed down by sweat-soaked clothing.The 5-pack is a fantastic value, giving me a variety of colors to choose from. This not only adds a bit of style to my workout wardrobe but also means I can rotate them without worrying about constantly doing laundry.In conclusion, these Dry Fit T-Shirts for men are a must-have for anyone serious about their workouts. The combination of softness, perfect fit, and excellent breathability sets them apart from other athletic shirts on the market. I highly recommend these shirts to anyone looking to elevate their gym or running experience.

reviewText: I've purchased multiple packs of these pants 12 pairs of pants in total and I wear them daily as day and night cloths I have bad cold urticaria so I need to always wear warm clothing I've had them for about a year now and every pair is still going strong I purchased these because of the zipper pockets and I love them I don't have to worry about my phone or anything else falling out of my pockets anymore and none of them have broke after daily/nightly use the pockets are decently sized they're not super deep but they seem bigger then average pockets the material is soft and comfortable and you can't really feel the zippers even if you're sleeping in them but some of the pairs I wear more often aren't as soft anymore and the pants does have pills/lint balls on them but it doesn't bother me but I know that could be a problem for others the pants are warm but not to hot I wouldn't recommend wearing them in extreme cold or heat as I still get rashes when it's really cold and I'm outside for a while and you will get hot if you wear them outside in the summer for long periods of time the sizes of the pants are mostly accurate some of them seem to be a little bit more snug while others are a tad bit looser the colors are great but the navy blue a recived is a little dull and looks a little grey sometimes but overall I love these pants and I would definitely purchase more in the future!

reviewText: Ok, so I’m a fabric snob. I grew up in my mom’s dressmaking shop and from an early age was exposed to and taught about the difference in quality between various fabrics. So I pay close attention to weave, hand-feel, texture and durability of fabrics. Knits can be especially tricky when buying online, because you don’t get any of that tactile insight from a picture. And I’ve “kissed a lot of frogs” when buying knit pieces online. Sometimes the picture looks great, but when the piece arrives, it feels cheap and tacky and plastic-like. Not these sweats!!So…I bought 2 pairs of these sweatpants for my son, and they’re awesome. The fabric on these is super-premium and they look like something I spent $120 on:The deets:-The weave on this fabric is incredibly dense and tight so the hand feel is smooth, and the fabric is weightier than you’re going to get with most other sweatpant brands.-These don’t pill!-The “wrong side” or interior side of the fabric that touches the skin is almost velour-like: it’s soft and super snuggly-I would say these run on the slim side, which is a bonus for us. My son is tall and slender and these have a trim fit to them so they look more polished than most sweatpants (he’s 14, about 5’7” and approximately 122lbs and I bought him a men’s size small)I bought these in black and navy, and I’m going to buy, on repeat, as my son grows. Teenager approved: he loves them and they’re an amazing value for the money.

reviewText: This review is for those of you trying to decide between the Hanes vs. Fruit of the Loom undershirts.Overall, I have to go with Hanes because the neck hole feels more appropriate. Fruit of the Loom is just too large. At the end of the day, the hole will stretch out and show chest hair popping up in the front, and back hair from the back.If the goal is to wear an undershirt for work with a business casual dress shirt (top button open / no tie) I don't want my chest cleavage showing; otherwise I'd get a V-neck.The Hanes shirt is thinner and cooler. BUT, it's also a bit more rough / scratchy. Not in a bad way, but Fruit of the Loom feels super soft in comparison.I'll also mention that after one wear I started noticing threads coming out of the arm seams on the Hanes, whereas Fruit of the Loom have gone through multiple washes and are still as durable as the day I got them. The Hanes haven't fallen apart by any means, but it's something to point out.Both a 2X Hanes and 2XL Fruit of the Loom seem to be the same length.  I have a big gut, so I was worried not having the [L]ong affix for a size option for Hanes meant they would be too short and hard to tuck into my pants, but they tuck great even after washing.Both are great options tbh.  In summary -Hanes for:- Smaller neck- Cooler / lighter fitFruit of the Loom for:- Softer / warmer fit- More durability

Even though I can find these at the big box stores I prefer to buy mine on Amazon because they carry the 29 inch inseam. The waist does seem to run a tad small, so if you're in between sizes I would recommend sizing up. Follow the care tag instructions and wash them inside out, and then line dry them or dry them on a drying rack to prolong their longevity and to prevent any shrinkage. Other than that no complaints. Thank you.

reviewText: I was excited to try out the Maamgic Men's 5 Gym Running Shorts, and overall, they didn’t disappoint. The fabric is high-quality, lightweight, and the quick-dry feature really does its job during intense workouts or runs. The design is stylish, and I found the shorts to be comfortable with good breathability, making them great for gym sessions or outdoor runs.What I Loved:Fabric & Quality: The material feels premium and durable. It’s soft against the skin and holds up well after multiple washes.Quick-Dry & Lightweight: These shorts are perfect for hot days or high-intensity workouts, as they dry quickly and don’t feel heavy, even when you’re sweating.Fit & Look: The 5” inseam gives a modern, athletic look, and the fit is spot-on for those who like a slightly shorter style without being too revealing.My Concern:The inner liner was my only issue. While it provides extra support, I found that it wasn’t as snug as I would’ve liked. This led to some discomfort and potential chafing during longer runs, which was a deal-breaker for me. Unfortunately, I decided to return them because of this, as I prefer a more fitted liner for optimal support during my workouts.Overall, these are well-made and stylish workout shorts. If the liner fit works for you, they could be a perfect addition to your fitness wardrobe!

reviewText: I really like these jeans, and having worked in the denim industry for many years this is now my go to jeans. I do have some critique though. The size 12 fits me well except that the waist is a bit big, this is perplexing since I am an apple shape with skinny legs and a larger waist than my natural body size should have. (Did I mention I worked in the denim industry as a pattern maker, so I’m an expert on fit and standard body sizes.) but this problem is wide spread through The industry these days, not just this product.The second issue I have on these jeans is the chain stitched waist band, it is itchy and I usually have to tuck in my shirt to keep it from bothering me (this also helps the pants stay up) the chain stitch is also stretchy so the loose waist gets worse the longer I wear them. If they went to a lock stitch waist band I think it would be more comfortable and help with the stretching out issue.That said, I’m overall very happy with these jeans for the price and being off the rack. I can always alter them.

reviewText: I recently purchased the MAGCOMSEN Men's Polo Shirt and I am absolutely thrilled with its performance and quality. As an active individual, I was seeking a polo shirt that would keep me cool, dry, and comfortable during various activities, and this shirt exceeded my expectations in every way.First and foremost, the moisture-wicking properties of this polo shirt are outstanding. Whether I'm playing sports, working out, or simply enjoying outdoor activities, the shirt effectively pulls sweat away from my body, keeping me feeling fresh and dry. Even during intense workouts, I can confidently rely on this shirt to keep moisture at bay. It's a true game-changer for anyone seeking reliable moisture management.Fit is always a crucial factor, and the MAGCOMSEN Polo Shirt delivers in this aspect as well. The shirt fits perfectly, thanks to its thoughtful design and quality craftsmanship. The tailored cut provides a flattering silhouette without feeling too tight or restrictive. The short sleeves offer a full range of motion, allowing me to move freely without any discomfort. This shirt truly strikes the perfect balance between style and functionality.While breathability is not the primary focus of this shirt, it still performs admirably. The fabric allows for adequate airflow, ensuring I stay cool even during hot summer days. I appreciate how the shirt remains lightweight and breathable, preventing any feeling of stickiness or clamminess. Whether you're hitting the gym, engaging in sports, or simply running errands, this shirt will keep you looking and feeling your best. Highly recommended!

reviewText: I recently purchased the COOFANDY Men's Sport Coat, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. In fact, I loved it so much that I decided to buy another one in a different color. This blazer jacket has quickly become a staple in my wardrobe, thanks to its exceptional fit, stylish design, and overall quality.First and foremost, the fit of this sport coat is simply outstanding. It hugs my body in all the right places, giving me a slim and tailored look. The slim fit design enhances my silhouette without feeling restrictive, allowing for comfortable movement throughout the day. It truly feels like it was custom-made just for me.The lightweight construction of the jacket is another standout feature. It is perfect for those warmer days when I want to dress up without feeling overheated or uncomfortable. The fabric is breathable and allows for adequate airflow, ensuring that I stay cool and confident even during extended wear.One of the things that impressed me the most about this sport coat is the attention to detail in its design. The one-button closure adds a touch of sophistication, while the notch lapel and classic blazer style give it a timeless appeal. I appreciate the versatility of this jacket, as it effortlessly transitions from casual to more formal occasions.The overall quality of the COOFANDY Men's Sport Coat is exceptional. The stitching is impeccable, and the fabric feels durable and long-lasting. It has held up well even after multiple wears and remains in excellent condition. The craftsmanship is evident, and it gives me confidence that this jacket will continue to look great for years to come.I must also mention the range of color options available for this sport coat. The fact that I ended up purchasing it in another color speaks volumes about how much I love this jacket. Whether you're looking for a classic navy, a versatile gray, or a bolder shade, there's a color to suit every personal style and occasion.In conclusion, I highly recommend the COOFANDY Men's Sport Coat. It combines style, comfort, and quality in a way that exceeded my expectations. The impeccable fit, lightweight construction, and attention to detail make it a standout choice for any fashion-conscious individual. I have received numerous compliments when wearing this sport coat, and I am confident that you will love it as much as I do.If you're in search of a well-fitting and stylish sport coat that will elevate your wardrobe, look no further than the COOFANDY Men's Sport Coat. It's a true gem that will make you feel confident and stylish on any occasion.

reviewText: I ordered the polo in the fruit green/navy stripe variety, and while I get that computer monitors aren't always the perfect judge of color, mine usually is pretty close to reality. So, I have to report that the green striping on the actual shirt is far less subtle than it appears to be in the product page -- enough so that I doubt I'll wear this anywhere other than on a golf course, where my fashion standards (and everyone else's!) seem to be lower. The medium I ordered is true to size, the fabric has a nice feel to it, and it hangs well. I can see wearing it tucked or untucked. The stitchery looks pretty good, although I'm no expert. The product page shows a shirt with a crisp crease and a stand-up collar, but makes no claim to a reinforced collar. The actual collar isn't reinforced, and so I don't expect it'll be crisp and well creased for long. Care instructions and an extra button are sewn into the shirt. It says you can put it in a dryer, which not all wicking shirts claim. I'll still probably dry it on a line, but if I slip up and tumble dry it now and then, it's nice to know the manufacturer would have no objection. At just under thirty-three dollars, I'd say the price is about right. So, all in all, I'm happy to have it, and expect to walk many golf holes with it!

reviewText: This jacket is one of my best purchases ever. I got recommended to it by my friend’s dad who had the same jacket (J-130) for over 25 years. I can tell why it held up for so long. This jacket is perfect for work in the cold or just for styling your outfits (I know you kind of people exist). The fabric this is made of is absolutely astounding and the stitching matches that as well. Along with that, there’s so many features that aren’t advertised on here like the inside zipper pockets and pen holder built into the right side hand pocket. The design of the cuffs allow for a perfect fit with any winter style/skiing glove. The part that absolutely sold me on this jacket was the zipper though. Typically Carhartt kind of misses on their zippers in my experience (especially with their backpacks and lunchboxes) but this one is very high quality. The one downside I can think of this jacket is the plastic aglets (the things on the end of the hood drawstring). Other than that, this jacket is perfect and 100% worth the $130 price tag.

reviewText: I am 62, weigh 225 pounds, and have a 34 waist and am very muscular, with muscular legs. These are the best fitting pants I own! The length is spectacular! They lay on top of my casual shoes and elegant sandals. They have terrific length! I am going to be having them dry cleaned, though they can be hand washed and hung dry, and ironed. I don't want to put the time and effort into this. I already have shirts that are dry cleaned, so I will add these to the mix. I bought 2 pair, brown and white, in order to test them out. I am now purchasing Black, Green, Navy Blue, and Dark Grey. The brown and white look terrific, with the colors natural, appearing as they should, and my wife really loves them as well, which is the most important test :) I purchased the large and I couldn't be more pleased with the fit! They don't ride up, when bending over, or sitting. They lay so nice on my hips, butt, and thighs, and are so cool and breezy, when it is warm. The look is very casual, but with a nice shirt will also pass as elegant for a nice night out! They are very well made, and the draw string is very functional. I highly recommend these pants in every way possible!

reviewText: I absolutely love these shorts. It did, however, take me a few tries to get the right size. I have a 42 waist, so I first bought a size 42, because a lot of reviewers reported that these shorts are true to size. That was not my experience. So I ordered a size 40, and they were still falling off me. I tried one more time, ordering a size 38, and this is the size that fits my 42 waist. Go figure.They are great for the summer. The fabric is not too thick to be comfortable, and not too thin to be durable. The pockets are what really sold me on these, though, especially the phone pocket. It provides perfect access to my phone at all times, while keeping it out of the way during most activities.The front pockets are large, and deep, certainly large enough for any wallet you don't want to put in a back pocket or cargo pocket, as long as you don't mind the bulge it would make. The cargo pockets are great for wallets, as long as you don't need to access it much, because it takes two hands to open the Velcro opening and keep it from closing while you retrieve your wallet. Or at least it does, for me. A bit of a hassle.TL:DR - These are great shorts once you figure out their sizes relative to your measurements. They fit well after that, seem sturdy, and the pockets are great. Go for it, but be prepared to return for wrong size, or buy a few sizes and return what doesn't work.

reviewText: The Gaglg Men's 5 Running Shorts 2 Pack offers comfort, functionality, and style for individuals leading active lifestyles. Designed with quick-dry fabric and featuring zipper pockets, these shorts are perfect for workouts, running, gym sessions, and other athletic activities.One of the standout features of these shorts is their quick-dry fabric, which wicks away moisture and sweat, keeping you cool and comfortable throughout your workout. The lightweight material allows for maximum breathability, ensuring that you stay dry and focused on your performance, even during intense exercise sessions.The 5 inseam provides optimal coverage without restricting movement, allowing for a full range of motion during workouts. Whether you're running, lifting weights, or doing yoga, these shorts offer the perfect balance of comfort and performance.The inclusion of zipper pockets adds a functional element to these shorts, allowing you to securely store your essentials such as keys, cards, or a phone while you exercise. The zippered pockets ensure that your belongings stay safe and secure, giving you peace of mind to focus on your workout without worrying about losing or misplacing your valuables.These shorts come in a convenient 2-pack, providing you with multiple options for your active wardrobe. With a variety of colors to choose from, you can mix and match to create different looks for your workouts or daily activities.Overall, the Gaglg Men's 5 Running Shorts 2 Pack are a versatile and practical choice for individuals who prioritize comfort and functionality in their activewear. Whether you're hitting the gym, going for a run, or just running errands, these shorts offer the perfect combination of style, comfort, and performance. Highly recommended for anyone looking for quality athletic shorts at an affordable price.

reviewText: First off, these pants are exactly what I'd envisioned.  Very light but seem to be well built.  Seams seem good, no holes, I think they'll be as durable as you can expect a super light pair of dungarees to be.Sizing just for context:  I'm 6'4, about 220. I have a 35 inch inseam--can get by with 34--and 39 inch waist, I can usually use either 38 or 40 in normal men's sizes since there's no 39.  I bought the 2X and they fit almost perfectly, maybe just a smidge loose around the waist and hips but not bad at all, and I'd say about a 34 inch inseam.  They're fine although I could use them another inch longer, but they don't look like flood pants, just brush the top of my shoes enough to create a gentle break in the pant let above the shoe.However, I'm concerned about shrinkage when they're washed.  What I'm going to do is buy a pair of 3X, wash and dry them, and see what the end result is and I'll post those results.  But what I'd say is out of the package these have about a 40 inch waist and 34 inch inseam.

reviewText: I don't really ride a ton of reviews but I just had to put it out there this shirt fits very well has a nice bit of stretchiness and in my opinion is a very flattering shirt. It's lightweight and very comfortable and I can tell from personal experience that this shirt will not stain easily LOL as I spilled some coffee on it earlier. I like the fit of this shirt so much that I ordered two more in different colors. The almost perfect rating that I'm giving it is only to say that the sleeves could be slightly shorter however they're perfect for the average person but I'm ultimately looking for a shirt that will showcase my arms a little bit better but this does an excellent job. It's really just a nitpick the shirt sits well above my elbow but if you're looking for a very tailored look this is almost perfect. I'm about 5'10 and  around 180 lbs and I ordered Medium so if you're around my height and weight this is going to be the perfect size for you. Amazon recommended that I get a large however I'm very glad I did not as this shirt fits perfect for my body type. Like I said just a slight nit pic that the sleeves could be shorter for maybe my arms as I don't have the longest arms out there by any means but if you have longer arms this shirt is really going to look nicely on you if you're fit. Now if your bit out of shape or whatever this shirt might show that off so it may not be the best idea for you however I imagine if you're buying under armor then you already know that you're looking for a shirt that's going to fit you as a fit person. I do have to mention that I got this on a 50% off sale but for $20 you're not going to find a better polo!

reviewText: I was reading the Fruit (of the Loom) reviews and a reviewer mentioned that Gildan might be a better option. I bought the 6 pack of Fruit pocket T-Shirts assorted colors and a 2 pack of Gildan pocket T-Shirts navy blue. Both orders came in the same box. Fruit was in a factory labeled bag like you would buy in a store. Gildan was in an unlabeled plastic bag. Both sets XXL.Many reviewers noted that the Fruit colors were not exactly colorful. I received a light gray, charcoal gray, two dark blue and two black. Fine with me.I prefer a loose fitting T-Shirt. I don't like snug. I compared the sizes by placing a Gildan atop a Fruit. I noted that the Gildan was narrower around the middle than the Fruit. I also noted that the sleeves of the Fruit were shorter than the sleeves of the Gildan.I tried on each shirt. The Gildan was too snug for my liking. The Fruit had a looser fit and was more comfortable. Remember, both are XXL. This may not be an issue for you if you are not as big around the middle as I am.As to the weight of the T-Shirts I couldn't tell the difference, although they were a lighter weight than my old Russell T-Shirts.I took one Fruit and one Gildan and put them in the wash to test for shrinkage, figuring if they were going to shrink, best to get it over with. Setting for the wash was warm, setting for the dry was medium.Both shirts shrunk, but only vertically by about a half inch. They did not shrink around the middle. Fruit was still a loose fit, Gildan snug.After the wash, the Gildan fabric felt a little rough to the touch. That was disturbing. The Fruit's fabric felt soft - very nice.The 6 pack of Fruit cost $19.98 ($3.38 each). The 2 pack of Gildan cost $13.99 ($6.995 each). Neither breaks the bank but, hey, one's gotta love a bargain.I'm not taking points off for the shrinkage. Apparently, all T-Shirts shrink in the wash, unless you can find pre-shrunk T-Shirts that don't. One can only hope they don't keep shrinking after many washings.Fruit gets 5 stars. Gildan gets 4 because of the fit and the rough feel of the fabric post-wash. I'm returning the Gildan and ordering another pack of the Fruit.

reviewText: I work at least 40 hours a week entirely on my feet in a restaurant and I've had these about 2 weeks now and I'm impressed.  Fit is perfect and they're very comfortable even for double shifts on my feet all day.  I prefer this kind of support which is more flat versus running shoe type support.  This feels more natural to me and I'm better balanced.  Definitely waterproof and not bad looking.The real test will come after nightly exposure to the harsh floor cleaning chemicals we use that always ate up my previous work shoes and separated the soles from the tops.  I will try to update this review in a couple of months after I see how they hold up.  But so far, so good.  Definitely a great value for high quality work shoes.

reviewText: As someone who has worn Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans in both regular and big & tall sizes, I can confidently say that these pants are the perfect combination of style, comfort, and versatility. They're like the Swiss Army Knife of pants – you can wear them to work, to a fancy dinner, or even to a punk rock concert.Let's start with the fit. The 511s are slim, but not too skinny. They hug your legs in all the right places without making you look like you're trying too hard. And because they come in both regular and big & tall sizes, there's a pair for every body type. No more squeezing into pants that are too tight or drowning in pants that are too loose!But it's not just the fit that makes these jeans so great. It's the little details, like the iconic Levi's logo on the back pocket and the sturdy denim material that holds up to wear and tear. And let's not forget about the button fly – it's like a fun little puzzle every time you put them on!Of course, the best part about these jeans is how versatile they are. I've worn them to a fancy dinner with a blazer and dress shoes, and I've also worn them to a punk rock concert with a t-shirt and Converse sneakers. They're like a chameleon – they can adapt to any situation!Now, I know what you're thinking – But are they comfortable? The answer is a resounding yes! The denim is soft and breathable, so you don't feel like you're suffocating in your pants. And because they're slim, you don't have to worry about excess fabric bunching up and causing discomfort.In conclusion, if you're looking for a pair of pants that are stylish, comfortable, and versatile, look no further than Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans. They're the Swiss Army Knife of pants, and they'll quickly become your go-to for any occasion. And let's be real – who doesn't want to be a little bit like a Swiss Army Knife? I give them 4 out of 5 stars only because they could be a bit pricier than some other options out there, but they are well worth it.Let's compare them with the Calvin Klein Men's Skinny Fit Jeans.1. Fit: Both Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans and Calvin Klein Men's Skinny Fit Jeans are designed to fit slim and tapered through the leg. However, the Levi's 511 Slim Fit Jeans have a slightly more relaxed fit around the thighs and calves, while the Calvin Klein Skinny Fit Jeans have a tighter, more streamlined fit throughout the leg.2. Material: The Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans are made from a blend of cotton and elastane, giving them a soft and comfortable feel with a bit of stretch for added mobility. The Calvin Klein Men's Skinny Fit Jeans are made from 98% cotton and 2% elastane, providing a similar level of comfort and stretch.3. Style: The Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans have a classic five-pocket design and come in a range of washes, from dark indigo to light blue. They also feature Levi's signature arcuate stitching on the back pockets. The Calvin Klein Men's Skinny Fit Jeans have a similar five-pocket design but with a more minimalist look, with no visible branding or stitching.4. Price: The Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans typically cost around $70 to $80, while the Calvin Klein Men's Skinny Fit Jeans usually range from $50 to $70, making them a more affordable option.5. Overall, both jeans are great options for anyone looking for a slim and tapered fit. The Levi's Men's 511 Slim Fit Jeans offer a slightly more relaxed fit, while the Calvin Klein Men's Skinny Fit Jeans provide a more streamlined look. It really comes down to personal preference and budget, but you can't go wrong with either brand.

reviewText: Excellent quality as always.One beef:  How can two pair of Carhartt pants, both with the same waist size, have two very different lengths/circumferences?  After wearing the same size canvas work pants from Carhartt, I ordered these jeans in the same size, only to discover that the jeans had a waist that was almost 2 inches larger than the canvas pants.  And no, it's not due to washing/shrinking.  New canvas, old canvas were the same, but the jeans were much larger.The reason we have standard units of measure is so that we can all agree on things like length, weight, volume, etc.  Two pairs of pants from the same manufacturer, in the same size, should NOT be so very different.Otherwise, Carhartt is one of the finest clothiers I've ever patronized.

reviewText: I have bought several of these over the past few years and as with anything there is the good, the bad and the ugly. The Good - These are probably the most comfortable pants you will ever wear. The material is light and soft. They look very good as well I wear with Polo shirts and T shirts. THE BAD - While I love draw stings I don't love these drawstrings. What they do is take a length of string and bring the ends together in the back of the pants and sew the ends down. The problem is sometimes they don't get them sewed down very good at all. Some will come loose in the back and when it does it is almost impossible to get the string threaded back through the waist band. THE UGLY - While these are the most comfortable pants you will ever wear they are not durable. Granted the will NOT ball up but if you have to do anything where you are actually working they will wear, snag easily. These pants are very delicate and as long as you are doing no work they will be fine as long as the drawstrings stay sewed.

reviewText: I first bought the green pair that is in the different hues of green and I absolutely fell in love with these shoes. The comfort, fit, and the styles are out of this world. And what REALLY sold me on this company even more was that my pink pair  of shoes were running pretty late, so I contacted the company, and Green told me how sorry they were and offered for me to keep the shoes when they arrived and offered a full refund too. After I thought about it, I contacted them again, and asked them to please not refund me and to please keep THEIR money because they are a small business who makes a great quality item which I love, and I would feel badly to keep the shoes when they arrived and their money. They thanked me, and then told me they would send me a gift of some of their new designs. I gave them my address, but honestly did not expect anything. And wouldn't you know it, after I had forgotten all about it, they DID, in fact  send me 3 new pairs of their brand new color/designs. I was beyond touched. I am a total shoe nut and even a sneakerhead, so I had to buy a new hanging shoe closet JUST for THEIR shoes, and it still doesn't hold them all. I will forever continue to buy from this company and recieving a review like this is hard to come by from me, so you can trust it. reviewText: These jeans were not bad overall but not the quality I have come to expect in Lees.Would I buy them again?..I think so and here’s why. First they are comfortable and the waist/length size is true. They are extremely lightweight so if you are in a hot climate (like TX) then these pants can be worn longer into the warm season than regular full denim. On the opposite side of the coin if you live in a very cold climate steer away from these.Two things that bothered me a little bit. One is the color- these are NOT traditional solid “blue” jean. There’s hundreds of different lighter shaded blue strands woven throughout giving the pants an almost striped look. Second I find them to be very baggy along the rear calf from butt to back of knee. It makes them, as mentioned, comfortable but not real stylish. Now the pants might shrink a bit after washing but as I haven’t done that yet I don’t know if that’s going to happen.For the cost it can be considered an acceptable purchase.

reviewText: ### Product Review: Under Armour Men's Tech 2.0 Short-Sleeve T-ShirtThe **Under Armour Men’s Tech 2.0 Short-Sleeve T-Shirt** is a lightweight, performance-focused shirt that’s designed to keep you comfortable during a wide range of athletic activities. Known for its premium fabrics and modern designs, Under Armour continues to impress with this simple yet high-performance piece of workout gear. Below is a detailed review of the shirt's features and performance:---#### Design and MaterialThe **Tech 2.0 T-shirt** is made from Under Armour’s signature **UA Tech fabric**, which is incredibly lightweight, soft to the touch, and built to wick away sweat. The shirt has a **loose, comfortable fit**, making it suitable for both intense workouts and casual wear. Whether you're lifting at the gym, going for a run, or just lounging, this T-shirt provides all-day comfort.The shirt features **flatlock stitching**, which reduces chafing and improves durability, ensuring it stands up well against frequent use. The shirt comes in a wide variety of colors, allowing you to choose the one that suits your style best, and is typically branded with the iconic **Under Armour logo** on the front, giving it a clean and athletic look.---#### Performance and ComfortThe **UA Tech fabric** is one of the key highlights of this T-shirt. The fabric’s **moisture-wicking properties** pull sweat away from the body, helping to keep you dry and comfortable during workouts. The **quick-dry capability** also means the shirt doesn’t get bogged down with moisture, which is great for those long training sessions or intense outdoor activities.**Breathability** is another major benefit of the Tech 2.0 T-shirt. The fabric allows air to circulate easily, keeping you cool even during sweaty and strenuous exercises. The relaxed fit doesn’t restrict movement, making it perfect for dynamic sports or activities that require full range of motion.---#### DurabilityUnder Armour’s reputation for durability holds up with the **Tech 2.0 T-shirt**. Despite being incredibly soft, the shirt feels sturdy and holds up well against frequent washing. Even after regular workouts and wash cycles, the shirt retains its shape and texture without pilling or fading.---#### Fit and SizingThe **Tech 2.0** offers a **loose fit** which is ideal for athletes who prefer a little more room or anyone who wants a casual, non-restrictive feel. The sizing is consistent with other Under Armour products, so most customers report that it fits true to size. It is available in a variety of sizes, from Small to XXL, to accommodate a wide range of body types.---#### Pros:- **Lightweight, breathable fabric** keeps you cool and comfortable.- **Moisture-wicking and quick-drying** to keep you dry during intense workouts.- **Soft, durable material** that resists wear and tear.- Comfortable **loose fit** for unrestricted movement.- Available in a range of stylish colors with the Under Armour brand logo.- Ideal for **athletic or casual wear**, offering versatility in its use.#### Cons:- The **loose fit** may not suit those looking for a more form-fitting or slim fit look.- Fabric can feel slightly thinner than expected, though this adds to the breathability.---#### Final VerdictThe **Under Armour Men’s Tech 2.0 Short-Sleeve T-Shirt** is a solid choice for anyone looking for a **comfortable, functional, and stylish shirt** for physical activities. It performs well during workouts, providing moisture control and breathability, while its versatile fit makes it wearable for more casual occasions. Durable, lightweight, and available in multiple colors, the Tech 2.0 offers excellent value, making it a great addition to any athletic wardrobe.**Rating: 4.7/5**

reviewText: I usually just take the loss on things like this and move on, but I felt compelled to write a review of these boxers since I just purchased 2 packs and already they are ripping on me. Now, I am not a big guy. I wear a 32 waist size, which would put me at the smaller end of this size boxer (size indicated 32-34). That being said, when I tried these on upon opening them (before any wash cycles) they were way too snug against my body, everywhere except the waistband. They are so snug in fact, that the fly is stretched wide open exposing my privates. And forget about spreading my legs comfortably. Oh well I'll just bite the bullet and wear them until they inevitably tear, I thought. I knew not to wash them in warm water or put them in the dryer. Instead I let them hang dry. When I went to wear them again, they were even tighter, and I found them tearing after only a single wash/wear. And I'm not doing the splits or any high kicking. And thank God they are worn underneath pants, because otherwise it would be pretty embarrassing. With any moderate activity, they almost rip right in half. Crotch, backside, it's a roll of the dice. I hope this review will help prevent anyone else buying these totally garbage boxers. I just wish I hadn't purchased two. Even my older Hanes with the exposed elastic band are WAY more comfortable, AND the right fit. 0/10 these suck I wish I could get a refund.

reviewText: This item does not fit like what is pictures, which seems to be a common trend when it comes to these Asian branded clothes. Yes, of course I'm not oblivious and realize most clothing does come from china/vietnam etc, what I'm talking about is specifically Asian Branded and imported clothing not subsided asian made with a GAP tag on it. These typically are cheaper, the same quality as your Mall Brands, sometimes even better. I have had hit or miss success with the clothing and this one was unfortunately a miss. As far as look, it was pretty much spot on, color and style wise. But the fit was way off.I'm 5'10, 180lb with an athletic / bodybuilder body type, so I typically need something that fits snug / comfortable but with the length for a longer torso. I bought a small in this, thinking hopefully it fit the upper body the way I want with the length as to not become a mid-drift / short fit. This hit the mark on length for the most part, but the fit was baggy. It's not slim fit or athletic fit at all, very baggy with a weird excess in fabric on the back where it almost tented out. Depending on what kind of look or fit your going for, maybe this will work if you tend to be on the bigger side or don't mind your clothes fitting pretty loose.Like I said, the material seemed decent and the look was great, but the fit was just not what I expected when you look on how they modeled / pictured it.

reviewText: I've been buying Polo socks since the '80s. I've tried numerous other brands and frankly, only Polo -- at least for casual wear -- works for me. I have pairs that I have had for 2 decades. They have shrunk and nowhere near as comfortable as they once were, but they aren't worn and are still wearable. As with anything else Polo, if you can avoid the shrinkage, you've got a good product to wear almost indefinitely. They either stay with the same factories that produce their goods or they keep good controls over the factories they use, unlike other brands. The only real issue with Polo can be price and or value, but these socks were well worth it.I also have a set of black socks that are essentially the same. I wear them with my dress pants and shoes. They are a little thick but are very comfortable. I have all but quit wearing anything higher than quarter socks. My pants do not ride up on my leg so quarter socks do not show and take less time to put on (not a huge deal but if I'm running late...).The one thing I must caution everyone with respect to ANY quality clothing, but ESPECIALLY RL Polo: wash on COLD on Delicate (with a light detergent like Woolite) and then dry on VERY low heat (delicate setting if you have it). If they aren't quite dry, finish the cycle on air dry if you have that setting. Never run these clothes on any hot water or anything but the lowest heat setting in your dryer for as short a period of time as possible. Trust me on this. I have clothing from 20+ years ago that I still wear that has been washed and dried at home. I dry clean some things and a lot of people get their laundry done but it is unlikely you'll do that to these socks. If you throw them in the washer on hot and high heat in the dryer, you'll be lucky to get 6 months out of them. I see 15+ years for mine.

reviewText: Grew up wearing real Levis, then had to quit when they got so danged expensive around the '80s or so.  I'd still spring for a pair now and again but not in at least the last 20 years.  Decided to try again and found these!  I love the 505s, a pair that was at least 20 years old all of a sudden fit again and they felt wonderful!  So, I shopped these and am I glad I did.  I live a rugged life-style and Levi's have always held up the best.  I have no butt and bird legs, but I still like pants to not sag on me, even though they may be my size.  These are just a tad loose but they still feel great and the length is spot on.  The price was not too bad, either.  One thing I noticed was that, depending on the selection, the prices do fluctuate so be sure to do a little exploring if you decide to buy these.  I caught on by changing the colors but some smaller sizes were less expensive as well.  Mix and match and find the right price.  I hope these last me 10 years - that's why I spring for Levis.

reviewText: This is a cute shoe, the quality is there, this the 4 stars, but it is stiff and small sizing; this, not 5 stars.Having read reviews prior to ordering, I ordered half-size larger especially since I wanted to wear socks with them when it's cold. That won't happenen.They are snug without socks. Sadface. My fit tends to be wide and that is true with this fit, they are sized correctly for B width, but I was hoping this half- size larger might accommodate that too. It does not. For me, they are tight in the width. And the extra half-size results in making them a bit too long in the length.All that said,  now I know how Tom's fit me... so that is a good thing. The stiffness could have been lived with while wearing socks thinking that as they broke in perhaps they would loosen up. reviewText: I use these treadmill and lifting weights.  I use my Asics for squats and these for upper body workouts.  Theses are like my Nike Cortez's except they have a leather tongue instead of Nike's stupid nylon one.  The leather tongue is very luxurious and puts Nike to shame which makes me sad because I like Nike.  I wear these with Puma shirts as to match and so far okay but they need dark navy Puma logos instead of off blues and sissy girl colors like candy or windows 8 start menu.I used to like Puma Suede's but last pair hurt my feet after walking on sidewalks for long amounts of time.  I am not sure why that happened.  Seemed weird like they used to be more comfortable.  Maybe I got a bad pair.Had/have a pair of Puma Dallas I never wear because they are too loose in the width and about 1/2 or more too long.  They slip off the heel when running no matter how tight I lace them (which makes them look long and too skinny and just funny) and they wiggle when I squat which is dangerous and annoying.  The low heel is nice but who cares if it wiggles, how can I lift confidently with wiggle?Puma whirlwind had stupid nubby outsole which looked like dumb golf cleats and worse hurt my feet when I was walking to the mall and in the mall.  On hard surfaces the nubs make a funny noise and people stared at me obviously amused by my choice of footwear.  They click clacked on the hard tile so not good choice for out and about activities.  Maybe sprinting on clay track or grass turf.  Stay off concrete/asphalt/indoor surfaces.The G. Villas seem nice tennis shoe comparable to my Kswiss Classics so I might try them but I do not need tennis shoes right now.  If I did I would rather G Unit Reebox's.The speed cats piqued my interest some time ago but I was not sure if the sleek styling was suitable for casual wear, too European.  I could definitely see the value as sports trainers am I really liked when the outsole was good year rubber tire inspired.  Kind of like racing car slicker tires i.e. less tread more traction.  Now I am into working out more so these would be more appropriate for me as long as I did not combine the with no show socks as is a current trend.  I need coverage on my Achilles plus like wearing Nike quarter crews so you can SEE the logo.  No show's have logo on bottom of sock wear you can not see it, how stupid is that.All in all these are probably the best puma I have had not to low like the speed cats which would have to be purely sports trainers.  I can wear these with jeans and look cool like they are Adidas superstars or something.  Low shoes look bad with jeans unless you are bisexual and wear tight jeans or something.  I wear looser jeans so low shoes tend to be paired training shorts.  I can bench press with loose jeans and look normal.So these worked for the money , look good for casual, knocked off the Asics Corsair's/Nike Cortez but as least incorporated a leather tongue which should be almost mandatory, and are okay for sports and training.  Not hardcore running or atg squats but bench pressing, leg pressing, light track work etc.Update 8/9/2019:I just received a white with black stripe. They are not as good as the originals. They are lighter and cheap naugahyde. They had a scratch on one and the other was crushed. They are comfortable but not the quality I expect from a german brand. Very cheap chinese feel.

reviewText: Let’s start with what I love….the color is beautiful and it fits true to size. I’m 5’4, 38B cup & 140 pounds.  I have a lot of saggy fat in my stomach. Tbh, I could pass as a pregnant woman. This is probably the 20th dress I’ve ordered this month looking for different options to wear to a wedding, shower and rehearsal. Most of the dresses with the leg slit are more immodest than what I like, so those have all gone back.  This slit hits my calf, even when I sit in doesn’t ride up and show off the lady parts. It’s not so sheer that a slip is required and it hides my gut so well I won’t have to wear any slimming tank or body suit underneath. The only negative, the snap is just not placed well. I wear a Warner bra from Kohls. It’s the only brand bra I can wear that doesn’t push my under arm fat up uncomfortably. It smooths the back fat. I have a few, with and without underwire and Extra padding. But with a 38 B cup most dresses, even when paired with a bra with no padding or underwire, typically is tight in the bust. This dress gives plenty of bust room but again; the snap hits in the wrong area. It causes a gape in the material that looks awkward and ill fitting. Thankfully my mother in law was able to remove the snap easily and just do a bit of hand sewing to tack the dress In a more flattering spot right above the bra line. My video shows the snap undone with a pin tacking it together where she will sew it shut. If you have a 38B cup and don’t have anyone that can alter this dress it may not work for you. If your really small busted than I’d say go for it, as the spot the snap sits would be fine for you. If your really large busted I’d also say the snap would work since your filling this entire area with boob and there won’t be a gape in the dress like it did for me. I will definitely be ordering another color, most likely the yellow flor, because the quality of this dress is great. This coming from someone who has tried on over 30 dresses from Amazon in the last 2 weeks and knows what’s crap vs. quality. I love this dress!

reviewText: I got these shoes because I needed more support and stability than the running shoes I've been buying/wearing for years, and they're great for that.  They feel durable and should last a long time.  Unfortunately though the insoles are ok but not great and after just a week I already had to adjust the insole shape with athletic tape because the shoe inside wasn't perfectly flat.  A high quality insole might be required to make these shoes fit as they should, simply because the foot bed isn't totally flat.  I usually wear normal width shoes too, but the fore-foot for the normal width was much too narrow so I had to go to the wide size.  The wide size is fine in the forefoot but a bit too wide in the heel, so again I'm having to adjust the shoe to get it to feel right.  They're better for walking than most other shoes I've tried recently though, so it's worth it to keep working on the insole to get a better fit.

reviewText: I’ve been playing basketball for a long time, and finding the right pair of shorts that are comfortable and functional can be a bit of a challenge. After hearing some good things about these basketball shorts, I decided to give them a try. Here’s what I’ve found after wearing them for a few days.Comfort and Fit:The first thing I noticed when I put these shorts on was how lightweight they are. They don’t feel bulky at all, which is really important when you’re running up and down the court. The material feels breathable, and it’s great for wicking away sweat. Even after a really intense game, I didn’t feel like I was carrying around a bunch of soaked fabric.As for the fit, they run true to size. I’m 6'0 and I went with a large, and they fit perfectly. Not too tight around the waist or thighs, but not baggy either. The waistband has a nice elastic feel that keeps them in place without feeling constricting. I’ve worn them through a few pick-up games, and I didn’t have to keep adjusting them, which is always a plus.Performance on the Court:When I’m playing, I need something that won’t restrict my movement, and these shorts do a great job. Whether I’m driving to the basket, playing defense, or just shooting around, the shorts don’t ride up or get in the way. The length is perfect, hitting just above the knee, which gives me plenty of mobility without feeling like I’m showing too much leg. The side slits at the bottom help with flexibility, allowing for more freedom when I’m making quick moves or pivots.They also do a good job of keeping me cool. I’m someone who sweats a lot when I play, and I was happy to find that the material breathes really well, helping to keep me comfortable during longer sessions. I didn’t notice any chafing or discomfort around the thighs, even after a few hours of wear.Durability:After using them regularly for a few weeks, I’m happy to say they’ve held up really well. I’ve washed them several times, and they’ve kept their shape, with no signs of wear or fraying. The stitching is solid, and the fabric hasn’t pilled or lost its stretch. I’m usually pretty rough on my basketball gear, so the fact that these shorts still look and feel brand new is a big plus.Aesthetics:These shorts have a simple, clean design. I got the black pair, which has a subtle logo on the side. I like the minimalist look; it’s not too flashy but still looks good. They come in a variety of colors, so you can easily find something that matches your style or team colors. The overall design is modern, and they fit the aesthetic I like when I’m on the court.The Downsides:One minor downside is that while the shorts are very comfortable, they could use a little more storage. There are no pockets, which is fine for playing, but it would be nice to have a small, hidden pocket for things like keys or a phone if you’re wearing them outside of practice. It’s not a huge issue for me because I mainly wear them just to play, but if you like having a pocket option, these shorts don’t offer that.Also, the fabric is super breathable, which is great for playing, but I noticed that in colder weather, they don’t offer much warmth. If you’re playing outside in cooler temperatures, you might need to layer up underneath or wear something else on top. But, for hot weather or indoor games, these shorts are perfect.Conclusion:Overall, I’m really happy with these basketball shorts. They’re comfortable, breathable, and perform well on the court. The fit is spot on, and they’re durable enough to handle regular use. If you’re looking for a pair of shorts to wear during your basketball games or practices, I’d definitely recommend these. However, if you need pockets or play in colder conditions, this might not be your best bet.Would I recommend them? Absolutely! They’re a solid choice for anyone who needs a functional, lightweight pair of basketball shorts.

reviewText: It's harder than you think to find socks with actual COTTON that aren't the premium brands $$. My two boys now wear adult size shoes & socks. Polyester/rayon socks have always grossed me out.. they seem to get stinker faster and don't absorb moisture as well, in my opinion. It seems that is almost all they offer nowadays for the socks you find in the store, and most of what I've seen online in a decent price range. I have to comb through item after item of the bulk packs of basic socks just to find some with any cotton at all. These actually were labeled as 90% cotton which is surprising.I purchased the black ankle socks - cushion ankle double tough durability (not the x-temp as shown in some of the review photos). The fabric details on the package are different than what is listed ... my bag says 90% cotton, 19% polyester and 1% spandex. I'm not sure I entirely believe it, but that's what it says. These socks aren't thick, super stretchy, or premium feeling but they were on sale and it's a big bag of socks on for two active boys that should last us awhile.

reviewText: These shoes are being promoted as anti-plantar fasciitis but they don't work as advertised because they need better insoles. I used them as they came and the results were not that good but as soon as I paired them with good insoles, the results were outstanding. Don't get me wrong, the shoes are great for the money and the features work well. I work in a bar and the anti-slip and waterproof features are similar to more expensive brands. They are not too light or heavy, and they fit as expected. I got a wide variety and they are roomy and comfortable.The construction is strong but the anti-slip sole seems to be glued together to the bottom of the shoe, and in my experience, they tend to come unglued after some use. Only time will tell if they last in place or not.

reviewText: Excellent! There is a reason why the Samba is a classic for this many years. Originally only a true athletic gear, today a well respected piece of fashion item in your closet. Many, myself included have seen its durability and versatility with time. Honestly it is surprising how reasonably price it still is. Now, let's talk about its downsides - the insole is not durable and is quite thin, definitely not great if you have low arches and need support. This can be remedied by removing the insole it came with and replace it with an arch support insole. The tongue is stiff and even painful on the ankle, so it does require a breaking in period to soften. Honestly, Sambas are fantastic at this price point, a combination of fashion meets function.

reviewText: Overall I love these joggers. They’re very comfy and warm, but not too warm and the stretch in the fabric is amazing, plus they don’t feel particularly heavy. The only issue I have with these is the pockets that are sewn in by the zipper. In theory, zipper pockets are great, but after a while the thread holding the pocket to the pant begins to loosen and now I’ve got a hole on the top part of the pockets on both sides. I’ve had these for about 7 months now, and three months in I stopped using the pocket zippers because I noticed it was getting loose. Even after I stopped using the zipper, when you pull your pants up or if you put your phone in there, it pulls on the thread and I ended up getting a hole along the pocket lining. Luckily I can just sew them back on, but not everyone has the capacity or ability to do that. I would still recommend getting these because they are super comfy and relatively light-weight especially if you’re just wearing them around the house. Just be mindful of the pockets.

reviewText: I was a bit hesitant about purchasing this dress online, especially when it comes to sizing. I’m 5 feet tall, 160 pounds with a bit of a gut, and I really didn’t want to end up looking like a round blob or have my boobs spilling out. I also wanted to find something that would cover my arms and stomach because I’m not a fan of showing those areas. This dress turned out to be exactly what I was hoping for! It fit perfectly and had the flowy sleeves I was looking for, offering great coverage without feeling bulky.The length was perfect for my height—just grazing the top of my feet when I wore wedges. If it’s a little long for you with wedges, the waist is constructed in a way that you can pull it up slightly to shorten the dress a tad more. The dress is a beautiful pink color, and I received lots of compliments throughout the day, which made me feel so pretty.One thing I wasn’t thrilled about was that the bottom was a bit sheer, with a slit that exposed more than I was comfortable with, especially since I have spider veins and prefer to keep my legs covered. I had no trouble taking it to my local seamstress, and for just $7, she sealed up the slit for me, which was an easy fix.The dress does come with a built-in slip, but I added a shorter slip underneath to avoid a Princess Di moment—especially since it was an outdoor wedding...just in case. Overall, this dress was the perfect choice for me. I felt confident, comfortable, and, most importantly, pretty!

They’re comfortable, functional, and stylish, making them a perfect addition to any man’s wardrobe. Whether you're hitting the gym, running errands, or just relaxing at home, these joggers are sure to meet your needs.
