reviewText: At a certain point in life, a man reaches a deeper understanding.  A viewpoint that permanently alters his worldview, and makes him question all that came before.  This can happen slowly, as experience and knowledge grows, and ultimately crystalizes around a kernel of this new perspective.  Or it can happen suddenly, in an epiphany of recognition that forces a foundational frame of reference adjustment.  Yesterday I experienced the latter, and I wanted to share it in case any of you have yet to reach a similar point.  As enter the fall of life, I feel compelled to offer this new personal world order in the hope that you may benefit longer than I will likely enjoy.While this change thunder-struck me suddenly yesterday, some background will help put the revelation in proper context.  It all started with the bankruptcy of Sears.  Sears engaged in a foolhardy acquisition strategy during the 1980's of retail and non-retail businesses that would be completely undercut by the digital revolution of the 1990's.  The debt accumulated from these various acquisitions would drag on company financial statements for decades as revenues slowly eroded to online shopping alternatives.  Finally, in the face of an unmanageable October 2018 debt payment of $134 million, Sears declared Chapter 11.  Eddie Lampert made several attempts to secure funding for a reorganization strategy, but they would all ultimately fail.  None of this impacted me until the end of 2019 when the last Sears in Jacksonville closed.At that point I had a shoe problem.  For decades I had purchased brown four-hole lace-up suede loafers from Sears.  They were a store brand that sold for $30 or $40.  I had probably purchased a dozen or more pair of these.  I would often buy two or three pair at a time so I wouldn't need to return to the store so often as they wore out.  But now Sears and my default shoe choice were gone!  Panic ensued.  I started searching the internet for the manufacturer of this shoe which I had enjoyed for so many years.  The hope was that another distribution channel would emerge, or that a transition to online sales could be found.  No luck.  So at the dawn of COVID-19, I was facing an existential shoe crisis.It was about March 2020 when my last trusty Sears loafers were at end-of-life.  Most real world retail was shuttered, and supply chain disruption was in full force.  There were no shoes to buy.  Finally, a local Rack Room reopened and I scoured the shelves for a suitable replacement.  I eventually settled for a deck style shoe that was only mildly stylistically objectionable, but seemed acceptably comfortable as one of the very few models offered in wide width.  For nearly two and a half years this daily worn (weekday) pair of shoes sustained me.  Last week I was forced back to the retail experience for a hopefully improved selection of casual shoe options.Did I find an improved post-COVID selection?  Hell no, I did not!  It was WAY worse.  There were no wide offerings at all!  Three shoe store visits left me cursing the pathetic state of IRL retail, and the stupid business people who were essentially forcing me to shop online.  So home to Amazon I went, with the name of an untried shoe brand and model seen in a store.  It was a pleasing looking set of footwear that I was going to gamble might be suitable.  And the size variety available on Amazon was breathtaking.  All the sizes I was familiar with, that were completely missing from any store, were available with a click.  I don't know when stores decided that they couldn't offer size selection.  They certainly did in the 1970's!  How did they lose that ability?  Anyway, shoes selected and ordered online with delivery anticipated in a couple days.  Fine.Ladies and gentleman, this is it.  These Rockport Oxford Eureka Walking Shoes are THE most comfortable shoes I have ever owned...bar none.  I am gobsmacked by how comfortable these shoes are.  Eureka is right!  I think back to pre-Rockport me and shake my head in sorrow.  Poor fella.  Stuck in a rut of frugally driven brick-and-mortar retail based consumption resulting in the bare minimum of utility.  Not even guessing about the possibility that such a paradigm shift could be out there.  Who knows what might have been if that version of me had found these shoes earlier?  Years of an improved outlook on life is the most obvious missed opportunity.  Perhaps he would have turned to philanthropy?  Trying to engineer life improvements for those around him in an effort to induce similar outlook-altering reactions in society's less fortunate?  I literally skipped around the house yesterday sharing the good news with my family.  I haven't skipped since a 1973 visit to Cedar Point with my Aunt Fran.  Eureka my friends.  Eureka indeed.  If you're in need, I beg you to give these shoes a try.  If I can convince just one of you, then this lunchtime prose will have been worth it.Edit: Two year update on durability - These spectacular shoes have been part of my workday fit for two years now.  No major durability issues to report.  The highest wear was on the insole.  The soles still have quite a bit of life, and are still well attached to the uppers.  One black pair I bought has fully thrown their insoles, and the brown pair have significantly worn insoles.  I still feel that this wear pattern is above average compared to my past shoe purchases.  So much so, I just ordered another pair of both black and brown Rockport Oxford Eureka Walking Shoes.  Love 'em, and looking forward to the fresh kicks!

reviewText: Title: The Ultimate Comfort and Style: Wrangler Authentics Men's Big & Tall Classic Relaxed Fit Jeans ReviewRating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)Hey there! I'm thrilled to share my review of the Wrangler Authentics Men's Big & Tall Classic Relaxed Fit Jeans. These jeans have truly exceeded my expectations when it comes to both comfort and style. Let me break it down for you:Comfort:These jeans are designed with the utmost comfort in mind. The relaxed fit allows for ample room in the seat and thighs, providing unrestricted movement throughout the day. The soft and durable denim fabric feels great against the skin, ensuring maximum comfort even during extended wear. Whether you're running errands or simply lounging around, these jeans keep you feeling cozy and at ease.Fit and Style:The Wrangler Authentics Classic Relaxed Fit Jeans are a perfect blend of timeless style and modern trends. The classic five-pocket design adds a touch of sophistication, while the medium wash finish gives them a trendy and versatile look. The straight-leg cut provides a flattering silhouette for men of all sizes, making these jeans suitable for various occasions, from casual outings to semi-formal events.Durability:One aspect that truly impressed me is the durability of these jeans. The high-quality denim fabric, combined with the expert craftsmanship of Wrangler, ensures that these jeans stand the test of time. They maintain their shape and color even after multiple washes, making them a reliable wardrobe staple. The reinforced stitching adds an extra layer of durability, ensuring that these jeans can handle whatever challenges you throw at them.Size Range:The Big & Tall size range offered by Wrangler Authentics is a game-changer. It provides a perfect fit for those with larger frames, without compromising on style. The extended sizes are thoughtfully tailored to cater to the specific needs of big and tall individuals, ensuring a comfortable and flattering fit for all.In conclusion, the Wrangler Authentics Men's Big & Tall Classic Relaxed Fit Jeans are an excellent investment. With their unbeatable comfort, stylish design, and exceptional durability, these jeans offer everything you could want in a pair of denim. So, go ahead and upgrade your wardrobe with these fantastic jeans – you won't be disappointed!I hope this review helps you in making an informed decision. reviewText: These shirts are light weight polyester.  Take them out of the washer and just hang them up...no wrinkles!  My size depends on the actual item.  Large or XLarge is my situation.  My choice is to go bigger than something too tight.  Before I would buy these types of shirts at the mall.  Would be able to try on.....I got the XL...and it fits perfect.  I am very careful about using the dryer on my clothes.....do not want any shrinkage.....so I dry for a 5-10 minutes...especially for jeans.....few minutes for shirts...and hang them up to dry.  These shirts I washed like anything brand new.  Even right out of the washer no wrinkles....and hung them up on hangers to dry.  Perfect!  The colors are nice...and the shirts are comfortable.  I will only buy polyester...not a mix with cotton....the material mixed with cotton does not come out wrinkle free and does not feel as good ....just my personal taste.  My suggestions is to buy a size larger...out of the washer on to hangers...and let the sun or warm house do the drying...and do not bake them in a dryer....not just these shirts but any synthetic fabrics....

And as said, the shoes fit great, feel great!.  That perfect pristine packaging was clearly an indication of what was inside.It's just too bad that the drivers can't seem to realize that leaving a delivery on the front of the porch is going to get wet with rain coming down. reviewText: So, since childhood, it's been the classic tighty whities, rocking the Walter White style, but I've long heard the rumors of boxer bliss.  Tried full on boxers, and couldn't stand them, it felt like wearing shorts under my pants, too much bulk and bunching up and just not pleasant.  But, the boxer brief is said to be the best of all worlds, more freedom than briefs, but not as much chaos as boxers.  Well into my adult life, I figured it's still good to try new things, and didn't want to miss out on a chance at more comfy under gear.I opted for this brand because I like Gildan t-shirts.  I came across the brand originally, noting that, at race and car events I attend, t-shirts being sold by vendors are often the Gildan brand, and they fit and wear well.  I've since bought just plain Gildan t-shirts that I've found here, and been very happy.  So, it seemed a trusted brand, and the price is certainly right, so, if I hated this new under the pants idea, I wouldn't have lost much, was my logic.Ordered up my first set of 5, and, whaddya know, I LOVE boxer briefs!  These are a soft knit, like a t-shirt but heavier weight, so, super comfortable, keeps everything where it should be, and doesn't ride up on the legs -- fits at the thighs perfectly, not too tight, but not too loose.As a bonus, as the weather has turned cold, they are pleasantly warm to wear, but not hot or bothersome, so I'm feeling they will work in summer as well.  I promptly ordered another 5 pair set, and likely will order a third set soon, for those times when laundry is piling up and the underwear drawer reserves are running low.Love the waistband on these, fully covered elastic and, again, perfect balance of being snug, so not moving around, but not at all uncomfortable in terms of tightness.  Works great with tucked in dress shirts and slacks, works with jeans, shorts, anything and everything.All of the ones I received were very well made, no quality control issues, have held up well in the wash, colors didn't bleed on anything, and I have a feeling they may even last longer than the briefs of old, which, no matter what brand I've tried in the past years, have seemed to decline in quality in terms of holding up through wash cycles (elastic at the waist frequently starts to ripple and become a bit useless).So, look at me go!  Never too late to try something new and my underwear wearing has become quite a joy.  They seem far more stylish than plain old briefs, and are much more comfortable, so I'm now a boxer brief convert, and will retire the old briefs habit, in favor of my new cool undergarments.Definitely recommend these.  I see other brands are far pricier, so it seems this is one of the best buys.Hope this helps your shopping.  Thanks for reading!  :)

reviewText: Cheap in price but not in quality.  I've purchased inexpensive shirts and pull over sweaters on Amazon and the fit has been poor, usually weird in the shoulders, and binding in odd places when I move, as if someone cut out two dimensional paper doll clothes and stitched them together.  That is not the case with these shirts.  They fit well and are comfortable in motion.  The design is minimalist, in a good way.  I love the tagless tags that are printed into the fabric so they don't chafe the back of my neck although the white printing on the heather gray shirt is difficult to see so it takes a few seconds to ensure I don't put the shirt on backwards.  These shirts breathe well and have a quality silky feel because of the tightly woven synthetic material, but are durable even though they're fairly thin.  These are great sunscreen without any greasy smelly mess.  I bought a similar name brand long polyester sleeve shirt in the mid 1980's for sunscreen when rock climbing, and paid almost as much (much more after accounting for inflation) as I paid for these six shirts, and honestly, I like these shirts better.Note that the black shirts are a dark navy blue.

reviewText: My teenage son is an athlete and wears these pants constantly to work out in & for daily wear. I've bought multiple 3 packs of these pants in different colors & in both the small and medium sizes. They are very comfortable for everyday wear and also for the most part decent quality. We've only encountered a couple pair that have loose threads (out of about 15 pair 2 or 3 of them have had small holes or gaps in between the legs that of course turned into larger holes fairly quickly). The camo colored ones have discolored areas that wear thin in the leg/knee and thigh area and look like they don't hold up after a couple of washes.Overall, these pants are a good buy. I'd recommend the striped dark colored ones the most. They seem to hold up the best after machine washing.

reviewText: As a taller guy (6’4”, 215lbs), finding workout shorts that fit well can be a challenge, but these actually worked out great for me. I went with a large based on the size chart, and they fit just right—not too tight, not too loose. The length is spot on, hitting just above the knee, and the relaxed fit gives me plenty of room to move during squats, lunges, and runs. The fabric is super lightweight and breathable, which is a lifesaver during intense workouts, and the quick-dry feature really does help keep things comfortable even when I’m sweating a lot. The waistband is snug but not restrictive, and the drawcord is a nice touch for keeping everything in place. I also appreciate the zippered pockets—they’re deep enough to hold my phone and keys without them bouncing around. That said, the mesh panels are great for airflow but I’d recommend wearing them with compression shorts if that bothers you. After a few washes, I did not notice a fade and the stitching and fabric still feel durable. Overall, these are a solid choice for taller guys like me who need reliable workout shorts. I’d definitely recommend them if you’re in a similar size range.

reviewText: The men’s casual Henley shirt is a fantastic addition to any wardrobe. The fabric is soft and breathable, making it comfortable to wear throughout the day. The fit is true to size and provides a relaxed, yet flattering silhouette. The three-button placket adds a touch of classic style, and the shirt can be dressed up or down depending on the occasion.The quality of the material is impressive—it's durable and maintains its shape and color even after multiple washes. The shirt also has a nice drape that doesn’t feel too heavy or too light. The variety of colors available makes it easy to find one that suits your personal style.One small consideration is that the shirt might require a bit of ironing to maintain a crisp appearance, but this is a minor issue compared to its overall comfort and style.Overall, this Henley shirt is a versatile, stylish, and comfortable choice for casual wear. It offers great value and is highly recommended for anyone looking to enhance their everyday wardrobe.

reviewText: I picked these up for my travels. They’re super lightweight, which really helps reduce the weight of my luggage. Plus, they’re compact, taking up hardly any space compared to regular underwear, which can be bulky even when rolled tightly.I also don’t have to stress about packing used underwear or hunting for a laundromat while I’m overseas.They’re soft, comfy, and sturdy enough for one-time use. I wore them dry during long day trips and wet when swimming, and they held up perfectly.Made from 100% cotton, they’re breathable, and since they’re disposable, it’s great that cotton is biodegradable, so they won’t harm the environment. This aspect was really important to me, as I’m hesitant to use anything disposable that could linger in nature.All in all, this is a fantastic set of lightweight and convenient underwear that’s ideal for travel packing.

reviewText: I bought this jacket first five years ago and ordered a large, which was my standard size at the time. What I got back then was a quality jacket but one that could be a bit uncomfortable to wear given that the arms were insulated with a weird material and it also ran quite small. Still, I rather liked it and thought it looked really nice, so I wore it until I put on some weight and outgrew it.Eventually ordered a new one in XXL, which is what I order in jackets now because I like them to be a little loose and baggy when I'm at work, my t-shirt size is XL. New version of the jacket is of even higher quality. The material it's made of still feels strong but is very very smooth almost like suede, and the arm insultation is vastly better. The XXL feels like it ran a little big this time, as it's quite loose on me now, moreso than other jackets I order in that size, but for me this is fine. I could easily wear a big sweater or hoodie with it in cold weather and still fit comfortably. If you're unsure, I would say you would likely be safe ordering this in your usual size even if you like things to hang a little looser. I bought the brown/'tobacco' color and it is an extremely attractive jacket I feel like I could wear a lot of places from my messy custodial job to mountain hiking to dinner at like a sit down sushi place. It's of a quality and appearance that I feel you could wear this on a date or a night out and you would look quite nice. The buttons look quite nice and are kind of a weathered brass look. Previous jacket had a problem with the wrist buttons coming undone constantly, seems to be fixed in this one. The flannel insulation is not thick and I would consider this more of a spring/fall jacket, but I could easily layer it if the temperatures dropped.

reviewText: I lost weight, so ordered these, a size (2 inches) smaller than my last pair. Now I will say that Dickies pants run small. My waist was about 42 when I ordered the 44's. Now my waist is about 39 or 40, and these 42's fit fine. The only reason I'm not giving these pants five stars is that one of my last pair, having only been worn a few times, lost the zipper pull when unzipping them. I mean it came right off in my hand and now I can't find it of course and don't know how to fix it, or if it can even be fixed, or if it's worth what it would cost to have someone fix it. It's the first time this has happened. It did NOT happen with this particular blue pair, yet. Hopefully it will not. I love these pants in general for many reasons, not the least of which is the fact that they are kind of stain proof and even slightly water resistant. I did notice that these seemed too short, however, while the 44/32's I ordered in the past were too long. There is no option in between so next time I will order the 32 length as I can cuff them up, that is fine with me. UPDATE: I lost a lot more weight, and ordered a pair of 34/32's recently, which were called "khaki" as pictured above, and on some seller's sites that same color pictured was called "desert sand". The pair I received was not the light color pictured, it was a greenish tinged tan color, almost grey looking "tan" color. On some seller's sites they picture the color I received, calling it "maple" or "washed maple". In other photos "maple" is a more yellowish warm light brown. My point is, do NOT trust the photos on ANY of the sellers pages selling Dickie's work pants, at least when it comes to the tan/khaki colors. Black is black..(or is it?? haha). I kept them anyway, they are for work and it didn't matter but if you want a particular color of khaki, you better go buy it at an actual store.

reviewText: Exactly what I wanted.  Been wearing these pants in one form or another for over 20 years.  They’re very comfortable.  These ones I got, are the softer material.  It’s not the plasticy nylon type material that wooshes between your thighs when you walk.  It’s the nice and soft variety.  I have had two thicknesses of these pants, these are the thinner material.  If you daily these like I do, then you will probably appreciate this review clearing up exactly what you can expect.On this occasion I got the XL Tall size.  The price was right, so I ordered several pairs in differing colors.  I’ve never tried the tall size.  As far as I can tell they’re roughly the same as standard XL, maybe a little tighter around the thighs.  The pairs I own I’ve had for awhile and maybe they’re stretched out, so maybe it’s the same, but these are definitely tighter around the thigh than the pairs I’ve had for years.  I have large thighs, if you don’t have large thighs, it won’t bother you.  It doesn’t bother me actually, but I can tell they’re a little tighter than normal.  Which is fine, it’s good to have a bit of variety and they’ll probably stretch the older they get.  I just hope they don’t shrink in the wash.  One thing unique about these pants is they typically do not shrink in the dryer.  So the tall aspect of the size, yes they are 2 inches, I believe, longer than your standard XL.  I already dragged the pant cuffs around on the carpet, it’s just a little more noticeable.I think you should be able to see in the pic I attached to my review the fabric of these pants to help aid you in determining what it is you’ll get.I hope that helped out one of my fellow ADIDAS track pants lovers out there.

reviewText: Excellent Calvin Klein Sherpa lined jacket for cold winters in the NYC area. The jacket warmth rating is 7°F (or -14°C) and it's definitely usable up to 15°F (or -9°C).The size is on point, at least for me. I usually wear a large size and this is perfect (195, 5'11). It's water proof and made 100% using polyester. Overall a great value for money jacket for cold days. The few negatives are, the zip for the side pocket is very flimsy and hoodie can't be removed. But for the price it's a good warm, lightweight jacket.

reviewText: I read the critical reviews, and still ordered it.  Amazon even warns that this particular item has a more-than-usual return rate.  I am keeping mine.  First is the material.  Polyester/Spandex could mean almost any thing; it is not Italian wool and I did not expect it to look like it was.  I have no idea how the material will hold up.  The size and styling is called slim fit which means it is not made for most American men.  I take a size 2 -- I am too short, too fat, too old.  Nothing off the rack is gonna fit me.  For pants I need a 40 inch waist and a 24 inch inseam.  I have a small chest with a big pot belly. I buy dress shirts at Macy's and expect to double the price when I add in the tailoring needed. This jacket was priced at about the same as a good weight pair of 501 jeans.  I was not expecting bespoke fit or construction.  The next up is the design.  It is called 'a blazer' .  For me that means patch pockets and contrasting metal buttons.  This jacket has neither.  The three sleeve buttons had sparse button hole stitching.  It was so fake that when I had the sleeves shortened, I had similar decorative stitching added to continue the joke.  It does not have the typical fake stitched button hole on the lapel that is convenient for wearing decorative or identifying pins. The pockets are slit with flaps.  It may not be clear from the pictures, but there are two inner pockets and the jacket is fully lined.  Yes it is very light weight.  But now, even in the heart of winter, I rarely will be wanting to wear my real bespoke Shetland Wool tweed sport coat.  Everywhere is heated much warmer now.  Also, it has center vent, not mentioned.  That is important for me because the usual side vents show off my big butt.I wanted a light weight jacket that looked better than a zippered hoody, for casual wear -- unbuttoned -- year round.  I think this will do me just fine.

reviewText: I think Amazon recommended size XL, perhaps not. I normally wear a size XL or L. However, I don't think this shirt fits as intended in this size XL on me. I looked at the measurements on the size chart, and I should have sized down at least one size. The shoulder seams were way past the edge of my shoulders, and it was large and loose overall. The neck opening was especially large, and the sleeves were almost all the way down to my wrists.This shirt may not be long enough for some longer torso ladies, depending on preferences. It is not tunic length, I am 5'2 with a short torso and it hit me a little past mid hip. This shirt looks like it is pricier than it was. The material is very soft, and a good light to medium weight, without being see through, at least in the black color. It is a very fine and stretchy t-shirt material, almost like a spring sweater.Unfortunately, due to sizing, I have to return. It is a very nice shirt, though. I am leaning toward an apple shape and am 5'2 with a short torso. My chest circumference is about 41 and I have sloped shoulders and a mom pooch with some pudge.Update: I re-ordered in size M, and the pics are the way it fits. I also like the RBG vibe of this black and white version.

reviewText: The short answer to if you should go down from your typical size or not: yes, you probably should; that is, if you only plan on wearing this shirt jacket without layering.  However, if you plan on wearing this with a bulker hoodie or something similar underneath OR you have a larger stomach, then probably not.  If you are interested in more specifics, please continue reading. . .I wanted a heavier shirt jacket that I could wear over a light to medium-weight hoodie for the upcoming colder months.  I normally take an XL or a L depending on the brand, and if I plan on layering or not.  I have an athletic build (larger shoulders and chest and smaller waist), and, usually, when I plan on layering with a hoodie, I need an XL; but being that many said this runs large, I opted for a L.  Glad I did. . .The large fits well over my medium-weight hoodie, had just enough room for movement where I didn't feel like it was too tight and restricting.  It also fit well enough without the hoodie, not too loose and baggy.  If I would have gotten an XL as I normally would, then the fit would have been a little too loose for my liking, especially while wearing the jacket without layering.  Personally, I prefer a little a snugger fit since it holds in body heat better when working in below freezing temps; but my preference for a slightly snugger fit may not be pleasurable for you.  For reference, I am between 5'11 and 6 feet tall, weigh 200 lbs., have 53.5 inch shoulders, 47 inch chest and 33 inch waist (shoulders, chest and waist measured in circumference).If you are someone who likes a much looser fit and/or has a larger midsection, I would recommend getting your usual size -- at least.  This shirt jacket is more streamlined in the body than what many other shirt jackets are, so if you have a larger belly and went a size down, this shirt jacket will most likely be a bit too tight for you.  This I know:After I purchasing mine and wearing it a bit, I bought another one for my stepfather.  Unlike me, he has smaller shoulders. . .and a fairly large midsection.  He normally takes a L for his jackets, but since this shirt jacket runs a little large, I opted for a M.  It didn't fit.  It was OK for him in the shoulders, but the jacket wouldn't button over his larger belly.  I returned it and got a large for him, which then did fit over his larger midsection, but barely.This shirt jacket does have side pockets and one pocket inside up by the chest area for a smart phone, wallet or whatever.  One thing I should say about the side pockets is that they are awkwardly placed.  The manufacturer put the side pockets right on the seams where the front and back parts of the shirt jacket are sewn together, and so the pockets are a bit farther back from where typical side pockets would be -- from my experience anyway.  If you want to use them to warm your hands, you better have flexible shoulders.Also about the pockets. . .not the side ones, but the inside pocket up by the chest: Some people have commented that the Velcro is overly strong and thus there are some concerns of tearing the inner liner when pulling open the pocket.  Yes, it is strong, like most new Velcro is, but. . .if you grab each part of the Velcro with your hands and close and open it a couple of hundred times (this may sound like a lot work, but I did so in only a couple of minutes), the Velcro will loosen up. . .and considerably.The thing that I am the most disappointed with is the snap buttons: They are very weak.  The snap buttons are metal and look nice and sturdy, but several of them would not stay snapped together very well.  They would pop open with minimal effort, like bending over, for example. Thankfully, though, not all of them are so exceptionally wimpy -- just a few of them.  So for most part, the shirt jacket stayed partially buttoned.In all, this is a very nice looking, feeling and sturdy shirt jacket which is quite warm when worn with a hoodie.  It does a good job keeping out the wind and it appears to shed some water as well.  It also goes on and off very easily because of the inner nylon-lined sleeves. But because of the weakness of some of the snap buttons and the extreme side placement of the side pockets, I cannot give this more than four stars.*Update*I've been wearing this shirt jacket for approximately 18 months now, during Fall and Winter mostly, and it has held up well.  It has endured a lot of abuse during that time, and it still looks good -- no tears, no scratches and no coming undone at the seams.  But. . .as I stated before, those darn snap buttons sure could be a lot stronger.  Many times while I was out doing something strenuous, like cutting brush or shoveling a lot of snow, I looked down and saw the bottom half of the jacket unbuttoned.  I don't know if I got a bad batch of buttons, or if the rest of these shirt jackets are this way.  It is a minor complaint, but it does get a little annoying when working hard and then constantly having to rebutton the jacket.And as for how warm it is during winter. . .I'm impressed.  With the configuration of clothing I have shown in my photos (tee-shirt, long sleeve denim shirt, medium weight hoodie and this jacket) , I've been good in -25 to -30 temperatures (and that is not including the wind chill), that is, as long as I stay active.  My face and hands were another matter, though. . .I would like to be able upgrade my rating for this jacket, for the overall quality of this shirt jacket is high and it is also very warm.  But the weakness of the snap buttons prevents me from rating it better than what I originally did.**Second update**Been two and a half years of wearing this jacket. . .and it is still in excellent shape.  Even though I've put this shirt jacket though a lot of abuse (cutting, hauling and piling firewood, cutting multitudes of brush and many other outside jobs where I was crawling around in the dirt), the shell is still intact -- no tears or rips or seams coming undone.  The inside is fully intact as well.  Unfortunately, the metal snap buttons have weakened a bit more.  I recently took a photo of myself after I was done cutting down some balsam trees on my property.  You can get a better look at how the jacket looks in an outside environment.  And as testament to what I have been saying about the snap buttons, you can see that the lower half of the jacket is unbuttoned.  It is such a shame that these buttons are so weak, for it degrades the overall quality and appeal of this otherwise outstanding jacket.

reviewText: Having worn and washed this Champion T-shirt regularly over the past 2 months, I can confidently say it lives up to the brand's reputation for quality basics.Fit & Comfort:• True to size with a classic, relaxed fit that's neither too loose nor too tight• Shoulder seams sit perfectly at the edge of shoulders• Sleeve length hits mid-bicep comfortably• Shirt length is perfect – stays tucked when necessary but looks good untucked• No obtrusive tags – printed label, nice touchMaterial Quality:• 100% cotton; feels thick but not heavy• Breathable material, good for everyday wear• No transparency issues even with lighter colors• Keeps shape even after many washes• Gets softer with every wash without losing structureDurability:• Post 8+ washes: no shrinkage apparent• Colours are still vibrant• Collar stays in shape without stretching• Double-stitched seams show no signs of fraying• No pilling even with constant wearVersatility:• Can be worn as an undershirt or on its own• Casual wear, gym, or lounging around the house• Professional enough for the office on casual Friday• Multiple colours to fit any event• Layerable underneath sweaters or jacketsSize Range:• Inclusive size range: S to 6XL• Big & Tall options fit true to size• Consistent sizing across different colorsValue Rating: Not the cheapest basic tee out there, but very good value for money considering the quality. It pays for itself through its longevity and continued performance through repeated washing.Pros:• Extremely comfortable• Consistent sizing• Durable construction• Versatile styling options• Quality cotton material• Excellent color retentionCons:• Slightly more expensive than a basic alternative• Some color choices only available in Big & Tall sizes• Runs slightly smaller; may shrink a bit if dried on high heatCare Instructions:Washes and wears best when machine washed cold and tumble dried on low. This has helped me retain the shape and quality of the shirt.Bottom Line:This Champion T-shirt is a perfect combination of comfort, durability, and style. Great for anybody in need of a good, everyday T-shirt that will hold up well over time, be it for casual wear, working out, or as a layering piece.Highly recommended for those who value quality and longevity in their basic wardrobe pieces. The slightly higher price point is justified by the superior construction and lasting comfort.Note: This review is based on regular wear and multiple wash cycles over a two-month period.

reviewText: I recently purchased the Men Polo Shirt from Amazon, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed with the product's quality, style, and overall value for money. As an avid fan of polo shirts, I can confidently state that this shirt has exceeded my expectations in every aspect.Firstly, the fabric used in this polo shirt is of exceptional quality. The cotton blend used ensures breathability, which is essential during hot summer months or when engaging in physical activities. Additionally, the material is durable and has shown no signs of wear and tear even after multiple washes.The fit of this polo shirt is simply perfect. The sizing chart provided by the seller was accurate, helping me choose the right size. It hugs the body nicely without feeling tight or restrictive, giving a polished and sophisticated look. Whether you prefer bold shades or subtle tones, this polo shirt offers a variety of choices to suit your personal style.Finally, the price point of this polo shirt is incredibly reasonable considering the quality it offers. Compared to other brands of similar quality, this shirt is a steal. The seller also provides excellent customer service, promptly addressing any queries or concerns.In conclusion, the Men Polo Shirt from Amazon is a fantastic product that I highly recommend to all men out there. I am extremely satisfied with my purchase and will definitely be buying more in different colors. Well done, Amazon!

reviewText: I bought both Nike shoes to replace my gym shoes.  Since I didn't really know what style I wanted, I ordered two different styles.  I have an old pair of Nike court shoes that I have worn in the gym and to play pickleball and they sadly have worn out.  I wore them so much that I rubbed a hole in the insole on the inside of the shoe.  Since I loved them so much, I was disappointed when I couldn't find them on the Nike website.But that's when I found a shoe that looks awfully similar to them...the Nike Men's Flex Control TR3 Sneaker.  Now, since I have received these I only wear them to workout and teach in the gym or if we are playing pickleball.  The amount of traction and comfort that I have in these shoes is amazing.I am considering buying another pair just to have b/c they fit so perfectly and are great for pickleball.

reviewText: Newborn onesies aren't cheap.  Well most aren't, but these aren't too bad.  I purchased these strictly for the price when compared to other sets.  I'm not too picky on what my daughter wears, but I prefer simply patterns and colors, not flashy patterns and definitely no characters or words.  These were actually cuter than I expected them to be.  The material is soft, the patterns and colors are cute, and the cut fits my daughter just right.IMPORTANT FITTING DETAILS:These run small, meaning that these were the FIRST newborn items that my daughter outgrew.  I liked this, because I had a small daughter at birth (7lb4oz) and I liked having clothes that almost fit her during those first few weeks (these were a tad big, but much less big than most of the newborn stuff I purchased).  However, they received the least amount of use.The buttons that snap at the bottom are higher up than most other onesies.  Looking at the stock picture, you can see that they are more on the front of the onesie than directly in the middle as most onesies are.  This isn't a problem by any means.  It just means that once your child starts outgrowing them and there is stretching at the buttons, it will be more noticable if your child is only wearing the onesie (no pants).  I prefer the look of buttons that are a bit lower, but I prefer this functionally during diaper changes.Bottom line:Cheap, cute onesies that fit a bit smaller and a bit differently than most other competitors.

reviewText: Wrangler Cowboy Cut Slim Fit 936. 32 x 36I normally wear a 32x32 in most of my jeans. And that length is great when wearing loafers or other types of low cut shoes.  I wanted something that would look better with my western boots, and that wouldn't become high waters when I sat down. I had purchased the same jeans in a 32 x 34 a few weeks ago. Those fit well. However,  I wasn't sure about if the length would shrink after washing. I do not plan to wash these often, of course when I get them dirty, these are more for use when I go out with my boots on.The 34 inch length just gave a slight stacking look, which will be nice. I have ironed a center crease in the 34's and they look sharp with a sport coat on. Not too much stacking.The 36's have a little more stack to them of course, but they sit right on the top of my heels of my boots. It's a great fit. The extra length assures me that I would have some decent amount of stacking after a wash.I gave them 4 stars, mainly because the front pockets are not very deep. I get how and why the back pockets are made that way, but another inch or so in the fronts would be mighty nice. This will not stop me from buying more, as I really do like the fit, and I get that they are patterned after the originals, and that's how they are made.The Amazon posting shows  stretch, but both pairs of mine are not stretchy at all, so i,m not sure about that feature.The waist size is spot on for me. They are snug, just like my other 32 waist jeans, just not restricting.Overall, great fit with my boots, and I do like them. I'm 5'10, 160lbs.

reviewText: I've worn a variety of button-up shirts over the years, from Prada to Carhartt, for different occasions – from operas to blue-collar work. Let me tell you this right now: this shirt can work for just about any occasion.What I love about it: the fit, feel, and durability. I lost a good amount of weight and needed to size down, I tried a few Amazon brands, and one black shirt really stood out. It's this model. I've had it for about a year, machine-washed and dried it regularly, and it still looks as good as new. I bought another one a couple months later.  It's 100% cotton, which I love for its breathability, but it does wrinkle a bit. Usually it's a trade off in shirts, but again; AMAZING FEEL. It's fairly light so definitely layer up if it's cold; I wore a merino wool base layer underneath and holy guacamole was I comfortable! Although it is long sleeve, it might not keep you the warmest alone, but if you use it in the spring/summer, you're going to love it. When I used it for working on my dad's farm, I honestly didn't care about the wrinkles, but it was never terrible wrinkling. In fact, I got the sleeves hemmed and noticed the wringling on the sleeves is minimal compared to how it was prior, so be prepared to stop by the tailor if you're on the shorter side for that perfect fit (def worth it though). If you ever want to use it for an interview or something, this might not be ideal, but definitely can pass if you hang it in the shower to steam and can impress if you take the time to iron and starche it. I'm on the shorter side, so I usually rolled up the sleeves to avoid wrinkling prior to getting them altered.I'm 5'6, and am just got the sleeves hemmed. I love this shirt so much I bought multiple. So it'll be nice having more colors in my wardrobe that are good quality and fit well. I'm a fan of the pocket too, even though I don't use it much.Now, here's the thing I don't like, and it's not what you'd expect. Have you ever heard of an expression, something along the lines of if you're not paying for it, someone else is in regards to fast fashion like Shein and such...It's the ethical aspect – I don't know who made this shirt or the conditions they worked in. I'm hoping the quality speaks for itself as this is far from the fast fashion quality you see in modern clothes nowadays. The price isn't terribly cheap...but still, it could be made by kids in the same environment as those old Nike documentaries. I've shifted to buying from countries where I know workers aren't exploited (such as in the USA or Japan). As one working man trying to build a better life for himself, I don't want to shop at the expense of someone else. I had a difficult time finding information, but I'm kind of in a tricky spot as I lost some weight and need something in my closet. But if you're looking for quality that lasts and looks good, this shirt delivers. Try one or two first, and if it feels great, go for it.I'm graduating university soon and hope to make more money where I can buy stuff 100% ethically, so don't think I'll be buying this again unless they make it very transparent where it's coming from. But for interviews or hardworking days when you need something sturdy, I highly recommend this; nothing comes close to bang for buck. If I find out it's ethically made, this will be my first choice for life indefinitely. This is the type of standard quality clothes that were originally held to decades ago.[update: all of my shirts say they're made in Vietnam. I feel it's a step above China and Bangladesh, and the fact that Amazon is putting its name on it, I'm hoping it's at least following stricter labor standards, as there are some good trends in Vietnam humanity speaking. reviewText: **Title: A Game Changer for Foot Support and Comfort!**I recently purchased the Brooks Adrenaline GTS 24 shoes, and I can't express enough how impressed I am with their performance. As someone who has struggled with plantar fasciitis and shin splints, finding the right pair of shoes has been a challenge. However, the GTS 24 has been a true game changer.First and foremost, the support these shoes provide is exceptional. The cushioning is perfectly balanced, allowing for a soft landing while still offering the stability needed for my arches. I noticed a significant reduction in foot pain during and after my walks, which has made a world of difference.Comfort is another highlight. The moment I slipped them on, I could feel how well they hugged my feet without being restrictive. The breathable material keeps my feet cool, and the overall fit is just right. I can wear them for long periods without any discomfort, which is a huge plus.Considering the price, I believe the Brooks Adrenaline GTS 24 is worth every penny. The quality and performance far exceed what I've experienced with other brands at a similar price point. If you're dealing with foot issues like plantar fasciitis or shin splints, I highly recommend giving these shoes a try.Overall, I would rate these shoes a solid 5 stars! Thank you, Brooks, for delivering such a fantastic product!

reviewText: I've been wearing these shoes for years. The first time I've tried them, i got hooked by how comfortable they are. i have no issue wearing them all day. They are great. They generally last for a little over 6 months. But these are very hard months. I work in a heavy duty diesel repair shop, and these guys take a lot of abuse. I've been through about 4 pairs of these shoes.The soles are strong. Generally i don't replace my shoes because the soles are worn, except for one pair at around the year mark. that's not bad.The inside cushion is awesome. This tends to wear out about 6months in. Either the top layer comes off, or the foam is not longer returning to original shape.The ankle cushion also wears at about the 6 month mark. This is generally what causes me to replace my shoes. The shaper for the ankle cushion, in the back is hard, and once the cushion wears, it does dig into the back of my foot a little bit.When you get them on sale for 40+ bucks, that's the best. i try not to buy them at their regular price of over $60. reviewText: The ‚ÄúDickies Men's Heavyweight Crew Neck Short Sleeve Tees‚Äù arrived promptly and were better than described online. reviewText: I'm 5'11, 185 lbs give or take. My last few pairs of jeans I purchased from a western style boot store and paid considerably more for them than I paid for these. I've been wearing them a couple years now and one of the pairs, although still fit good, are getting too short so I decided to try these as a replacement. When this pair arrived I tried them on and first thought was to return them because they seemed a bit too long (I go from one extreme to the other). I decided to try them with my roper boots, which is what I'd mostly be wearing them for, and they actually didn't look too bad at all. I threw them in the wash and tried them again and they were better. Honestly, I believe they're designed that way on purpose hence boot cut. Lol the back of the pants by the heal ride lower than I've been accustomed to but in no way touch the ground; the front drape over as they should. I'm confident as they go through more washes they won't be too short. I don't envision wearing these with any other shoes aside from my roper boots but tried them with my low cut converse and they're certainly doable. They seem like better jeans material than the pairs from the western store and, like I said, cost considerably less. Waist, etc. fit great. A great boot jean for a great price. I dig them. The pockets are deeper/better than the the high priced jeans, as well. I could never figure out why the pockets in those jeans seemed so shallow. If my cell phone wasn't a flip phone it'd barely fit. Now I'm thinking those high priced boot cut jeans fell short.......pun intended.

reviewText: I really like the fit and feel of this coat. It is very cozy and allows for good movement and layered clothing under it. I’m 5-10”, 215 lbs, somewhat broad shoulders and dad-bod belly. I ordered an XXL and I’m glad I did. I would much rather have a slightly large coat than one which binds in any way. The sleeves are about 1.5” too long without adjustment, but again, better than too short. I like the length as well, how it falls lower on hips at about the length of an untucked shirt. This coat (I selected black) is very stylish as well as warm, without having to be puffy. I like that it does not have a hood also. I’m not sure if it would be the best outdoor work jacket in frigid temps, but that’s probably not what most guys would expect in this one. It simply feels great on my body and looks dressy enough for date nights, etc. I don’t mind that it has snap buttons instead of a zipper. This detail kind of makes it a sharper looking coat, in fact. I usually leave coats open in front anyway, unless it’s exceptionally  cold out.A couple of things could improve this garment. The inside pocket (with Velcro closure) should be deeper to accommodate a cell phone better. Come on, everyone carries a phone and this detail would go a long way. Secondly, who thought the “Fashion Sport” patch on the sleeve would appeal to anyone? The leather-look patch itself looks okay, but put a duck or something generic on it. At least it’s not so glaring as to be a deal breaker. I can live with it.In closing, I’ll just say if you are a husky guy with a bit of a ponch belly, about 220-260 lbs, don’t have very short arms, and like freedom of movement, I believe you’ll like the XXL size. $70 seems fair for this nice coat.

reviewText: I was initially skeptical about Coofandy due to the extensive publicity and the use of top models who make everything look amazing. Additionally, the mixed reviews about product quality made me hesitant. Having never purchased a shirt from them before, I was unsure about the sizing, especially since the models, who appeared more muscular than me, often wore size M, while I typically wear size L.With an upcoming vacation and a desire for stylish beachwear, I decided to take a chance on Coofandy’shirts that I could wear with a Panama hat. So I decided to order this light green linen shirt size L (I am 168 cm, 5 ft 6 inches tall, 87 kg/191.8 pounds, with a chest measurement of 43 and shoulders 19.5). To my pleasant surprise, the experience was fantastic. The size was true to my measurements, despite the somewhat misleading size chart and the significant margin of error they mention (up to 3 cm!).The quality of the shirt is superior, trendy, and fits me perfectly. The fabric is light, not hot and it's going to feels nice while at the hot beach weather. The color is not so green as in the photos on the website, but still is pleasant. I am thoroughly satisfied with Coofandy and highly recommend their products. However, I do suggest that the company provide more detailed information about the models’ measurements to better guide customers in their choices. Thank you, Coofandy! It’s clear that your efforts are not just about publicity but genuinely about “making style simple,” as your slogan says.

reviewText: I bought these Hanes boxer briefs for my teenage son, and they have been a great choice! The fit is perfect—not too tight, not too loose—just the right amount of stretch for all-day comfort. He’s very active, and these stay in place without riding up or feeling restrictive, which is a huge plus.The fabric is soft, breathable, and moisture-wicking, making them perfect for everyday wear, sports, or lounging around. Even after multiple washes, they hold their shape well and don’t shrink, which is something I always look for in quality underwear. The waistband is comfortable and doesn’t dig in, and there are no annoying tags to deal with, so my son loves wearing them.Another thing I appreciate is the durability—the stitching is strong, and there’s no fading or pilling even after frequent washing. The pack comes with multiple pairs, making them an affordable and practical option for stocking up.If you’re looking for comfortable, long-lasting, and well-fitting boxer briefs for your son, I highly recommend Hanes. They’re high-quality, reliable, and worth every penny. I’ll definitely be purchasing more!

reviewText: So I saw some reviews saying they were heavy for running shorts. Quite frankly, I’m not a huge runner, so I couldn’t care less or know even how to compare them to running shorts properly but I would say if you are a serious runner these may not be for you if the weight matters because yes they feel heavy when I hold them. But I have taken them for runs and if you are just in it for the exercise you wouldn’t notice anything from that side.They are actually way more comfortable than I had expected so I have bought another. They are quickly becoming my favorite lounging shorts.My only real issue, which stopped me from giving this a 5 star, is that while they fit nicely, they do lack on the waist support. To explain, I am wearing a XXL and while it does have a drawstring, it isn’t super long which for me makes it tough to get them good a snug around my waist. Admittedly, at a XXL I don’t exactly have a runners physique which could explain why they don’t fit me perfectly. But still, I have run with them and haven’t had any accidental flashing in public so should be great for most casual athletes or people just looking for a comfy pair of shorts.

Staticky ?  I’m not a fan of in any way.  Wore the shirt to work, it was soft and comfortable.  No static detected.  Winter coat and sweatshirt on and off was the real test. I’m no preppy dresser, so this is nice and comfortable.  I would recommend the buy to others, it’s a pleasant surprise.  I might pick up another 5 shirts different colors  So I have the rainbow covered.  lol.  We will see.Great company.  Fast shipping.  Very pleased. reviewText: In my household, we spend a LOT of time in a volleyball gym. My wife coaches and I sometimes assist and my 3 daughters all play very high level. If you spend anytime in a volleyball gym, at night, in the winter, you know that you might as well be playing outside. Same goes for tournament venues on those super nice Saturday pre-dawn mornings in the low desert. Long story short, I was sick and tired of freezing every time I attended a tournament, so I bought these PURE CHAMP jogger sweatpants and boy am I glad I did.Fist of all, they are warm. Like if the temps exceed 72, be ready to sweat. (Full Star)Second, they are comfortable. Soft and dare I say plush. I also really enjoy the zippered pockets to help secure small items like Air Pods. (2 stars)Third, they are well made. The seams are string, and the previously mentioned zippers are solid, I have no doubt these will last long enough to be worth their cost. (2 stars)LASTLY!!!!!  WATCH THE SIZING. In pants like this, I normally wear a large (36 waist, 32 inseam) and T, without looking at the sizing chart, ordered a set in my size. They fit great upon arrival, even after the first few washes if I tumble dried or air dried them. After 1 heated dry cycle....the pants are...more form fitting than desired. Yes, they have a high cotton content, yes it was my error, but they feel as if they have shrunk a full size and a half to two sizes.Anyways, I recommend sizing up from your norm and dry away. For this, I was going to deduct a star, but it was my ignorance that caused the pants to shrink and my inpatients that prevented me from reviewing the manufacturers sizing chart, so the product itself still gets all the stars.

reviewText: I recently picked up the OYGSieg 5 Pack Men's Polo Shirts, and I'm genuinely impressed with the value and performance they offer. If you're looking for comfortable, quick-drying polos that can handle everything from a round of golf to a casual day out, these are worth considering.Pros:Excellent Value: Getting five polo shirts for the price is fantastic. It's an economical way to build a versatile wardrobe.Quick-Drying and Performance Fabric: The material is lightweight and breathable, making it ideal for warm weather or active pursuits. The quick-dry feature is a major plus, keeping you comfortable even when you sweat.Comfortable Fit: The shirts fit true to size and offer a relaxed yet stylish look. They don't feel restrictive, allowing for a full range of motion.Versatile Style: These polos can easily transition from the golf course to casual outings. They look neat and presentable, making them suitable for various occasions.Tactical/Sporty Look: The shirts have a modern, slightly sporty aesthetic that many will find appealing.Color Variety: The 5 pack offers a nice variety of colors, allowing you to mix and match with different outfits.Easy Care: They wash well and maintain their shape and color after multiple washes.Cons:Material Feel: While the performance fabric is functional, some might find it slightly less luxurious than traditional cotton polos. It has a more synthetic/heavier feel.Thinness of Fabric: While good for quick drying, the fabric is on the heavier side. This might be a concern for those who prefer a more minimal polo.Potential for Wrinkling: While they are fairly wrinkle resistant, if left in the dryer for too long, some wrinkles may occur. It is best to remove them promptly.Simple Collar: The collar is functional, but it is a fairly basic collar, and not a reinforced or overly structured collar.Overall:The OYGSieg 5 Pack Men's Polo Shirts are a great buy for anyone who prioritizes comfort, performance, and value. They are perfect for active individuals, golfers, or anyone who wants a reliable and affordable set of polo shirts. While the material might not have the same luxurious feel as higher-end polos, the functionality and price point make them a worthwhile investment. If you need a good collection of shirts that you do not have to baby, these are a great option.

reviewText: So I've gone through a couple of different mens peacoat brands and style, having returned each because of inaccurate size or quality of material not being worth the money spent. However, I took a chance on this brand and ONLY after doing careful research by reading customer reviews and seeing how the coat looked on each individual... I took my last gamble and it paid off big time! So I'm 5'10 and have a slim/muscular frame and after trying it on... It fit perfectly. It's not baggy nor is it too tight where I can't button it up. Granted... I won't wear sweaters or bulky shirts because that's where it'll become constricted. The lining is thin, too, so it's good for Autumn or warm winter conditions. One of the best parts I like is that this coat runs in length like a quarter trench coat so it hangs by my mid thigh.. Let's just say I've been looking for a quarter trench peacoat and I happened to win big with this selection, yet again! As far as quality, it definitely is wool blend with a softer side to the wool so it's not itchy or coarse to the touch. If your looking for a fashionable coat that'll make you look made... I'd definitely recommend this coat.

reviewText: The situation:My son's school requires their sweaters to match the uniform shirts and each grade has a specific color. 5th grade's white, 8th grade's navy. Easy peasy!But 7th grade? Baby Blue. Not the worst but also not as easy as the other two. Throw in my neurodivergent kid (ADHD) that's fussy over certain fabrics, it's a bit more difficult. ðŸ¥´The overall:For us, this was a bit baggy but he likes it that way. He's a skinny, shorter 13yo (we're Southeast Asian). The pocket is big enough to hold a smartphone but not quite snug enough to keep it from falling out. There are NO DRAWSTRINGS on the hood but he doesn't use them anyhow. And they always get lost in this family. Oh and it came a little bit snagged at the wrist. Pic included.The material is thin enough for him to wear on sunny autumn days but thick enough to protect him from a drizzle. It can be layered easily because it isn't too thick, which is useful for him since he always needs a winter coat.It's quite soft out of the package, so it might wear out quicker than one that's thicker and a bit more factory fresh, but that's okay with us. It's only a school year. We can stow it away til our younger son can fit them.TL:DR - perfect casual hoodie for layering on my ADHD kid that's picky about clothes.Bonus: Not bad quality for someone who prints their own sweater designs. Will update after a few months!

reviewText: I bought this dress in navy a couple years ago and love it.  I always get complements when I wear it. I ordered the green one recently in the same size, but the length is an inch or two shorter. The bodice is a bit shorter so the waist sits higher. It does not hang with quite the same elegance. The differences might not be noticeable to the average observer, but it feels more casual to wear. The navy dress comes out of the washer and dryer wrinkle free, but after washing the green one, it looks the same as when it arrived, wrinkled from the packaging and will need to be ironed before wear.  I am 6' tall and 175 lbs, typically a size 12. I like both dresses, but I really wish the green one was cut more like the navy.  I don't know if it is shoddy workmanship or if something changed in manufacturing during the past 2-1/2 years.

reviewText: The pictures after after quite a few shifts so they aren’t “brand new” and are a little dirty. I am a Brooks believer. Haha okay no but these really are nice shoes. I like Brooks shoes but not all of them feel comfortable to me. I wear a size 8 in most shoes and these are no different size-wise. At first I put them on and it felt like there was too much foam around my achilles tendon area and my foot was too high inside the shoes but it quickly softened and felt nice, snug and supportive. I have a wide foot and high arch. I will say there isn’t a high arch in this shoe but it still feels like I have good arch support. I have a tendency to walk on the outer parts of my feet and these keep me well supported. They are thick soled so I do not feel the ground through the pads of my feet as I walk. Not clunky nor heavy. I can’t distinctly hear myself walking around. I feel comfortable on my feet for 12hr shift.

reviewText: It's stylish, warm, soft (especially the liner), and it's highly functional...meaning that unlike a lot of jackets with a bunch of apparent buttons and pockets, every single button can be unbuttoned and every pocket is an actual pocket.  Nothing is just for show, EXCEPT.......these dorky patches.  Outdoor.  Challenge.  Lol...OK.  Been meaning to swing this jacket by a tailor sometime to make sure they can remove the patches without damaging the jacket.  It's not a huge deal so I haven't done that yet, but if I can get these patches off then it's definitely one of my top two or three jackets I've owned.Seriously everything else about the jacket feels premium and I'm surprised it wasn't double the price for the quality.Also because it's so big/soft/warm, it's a great jacket to pull out when you're hanging out with the girlfriend who inevitably gets cold and asks for a jacket.  Maybe the jacket is half the price because they know she's gonna steal this one and you'll need two.

reviewText: Extremely happy with my purchase. The coat looks great and looks of decent quality for the price. It's nice to be able to stay outside the $200-$400 higher side coat price range and get something that looks good and fashionable. I rotate clothes a lot, so having several winter coat options at more reasonable prices fits the bill perfectly, just as this coat does. And, at the price, if can get 1 or 1.5 seasons wear, I'm happy.As for coat fit, I'm 6'3, 34x34 pant, 15 1/2 neck, 36 sleeve, 40 chest, 175 lbs, more triangular build. The large fits a bit loose at top, but that's my issue as I prefer a bit tighter fitting clothing. So, not a manufacturer problem in my opinion as some online clothes can be. More so, I wouldn't downsize due to the sleeve length which was absolutely perfect. And, above all, the extra size accommodation at top, of course, is likely given to accommodate a suit/sport coat underneath. And, while peoples suit/sport coats length can vary, if my suit/sport coat is buttoned, this coat covers such an undercoat just fine. If the suit/sport coat is unbuttoned, that coat hangs a bit out from underneath from this coat. Not an issue. Just FYI. And, with my preference for likely wearing with just a sweater, this size will be great and as tailored to one as one can expect from ordering online.I ordered the coffee 01 color, and no disappointment there. What I saw in the pictures, is what I got. I was worried the blend might look a bit cheesy. But, no. Very refined looking and just the color I wanted.Some people said they didn't like the buttons, that they are maybe a bit flashy, i.e., not just solid color or standard brown/black. If you are way conservative in dressing, or need that, perhaps so. I get it. But, I think they are a nice accent. I worried a bit about that too. But, when I got the coat. Not a problem at all. Looks great and if a real concern I think the coat is worth it to have a tailor put on the buttons you want.Last, there seems to be a bit of confusion on the reviews as to whether its too short or that its more of a waist coat. Yes, this version is. For me, it fits more to my upper thigh, or right at mid-point on pants pockets. HOWEVER!!!, within the color options, different lengths are presented, so beware! And that is perhaps what people are noting. One color you like, might be a different coat style/length than another color you like. So, carefully read the description and look at the sleeve bottom to coat bottom ratio in the pictures for length approximation or read the size charts, which I think pretty accurately depict the difference.I picked up on this difference and decided to also order a longer length coat in another color by this manufacturer, in case the first didn't seem to fit as I wanted. I am keeping both! as these are really decent wardrobe additions and each of the lengths I thought I was picking is exactly what I got. One other point on some of the comments, this coat did come with a scarf. The other coat under this manufacturer that I got with the listing shown to come with a scarf, did not. So people have noted this. Perhaps true. But, in seeing that possibility ahead of time before ordering, I knew scarf or no scarf was not going to be a deal breaker at this price. Also, I believe some folk contacted the manufacturer and got the scarf separately. Again, not a deal breaker for my purpose.Anyhow, long review....but I was really impressed with the coat(s) from this brand/manufacturer. In buying 2 at still a fraction of a $400 single coat price, I can rotate and likely get better dress options and similar wear, and I will look for this seller's clothing in the future.

reviewText: 5'11, 210lbs, 45 chest, 22 shoulders - purchased the XL and it has plenty of room for layering.If you're of a similar build and want more of a form fit, the L might work.I was looking for a relatively inexpensive insulating layer to keep in the truck for those just in case occasions.However, now, out of all the $200+ jackets I own, this has become my all-around go to.Very light (13.3 oz.). reviewText: These athletic shorts are great for running, working out, or playing sports. They are very breathable, comfortable, and look great. However, I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5 because of the side pockets. I find the pockets to be a little too far back on the shorts, which makes them difficult to access quickly. The side pockets are located on the exact middle side seams of the shorts, and the openings are a straight line down. Now, this is an issue because it means I have to move my arm back more to access them, and the straighter opening is not as easy to access as a diagonal opening. The other athletic shorts I own have pockets closer to the front and have a diagonal opening, so you can easily use them, whereas these shorts do not. Now, I am unsure if that made sense, but if it did and they improve the pockets later on, then these shorts would be a 5/5. Overall, the shorts are made from a great material, they are comfortable, breathable, and look great. I just wish the pockets were easier to access and the pocket opening was at an angle, but besides that, these shorts are excellent!

reviewText: Husband Review.OK all really starting to really like COOFANDY. Have other products (shirts) of theirs so I'm not new to the brand.  Just got these pants in the dark tan, perfect fit and length! (as usual) Deep front and back pockets and imagine, back pockets with buttons! Defiantly a good thing for out and about dancing whatever on a beach resort in Mexico, maybe even out in town. Further, the elastic is solid. Has a good draw string, and wow, look at that belt loops! These pants are far superior to other brands as I have discovered thus far. And guess what? They don't shrink three inches in cold water and air dried! Now HERE IS THE DEAL....these aren't linen! Like a lot of people seem to thing, but have the look and feel of quality linen, but without the shrinkage. Cons...meah, slightly more tapered at the leg, but then its resort wear so casual is what's the haps. I might argue for one more inch at the hem, but it still clear the ankle. Pros...Fit/Size perfect. I am a 36w X 32L and that's exactly what I got with room to spare or shrink, preferably shrink a bit. Multiple colors, not just tan, white, blue. Looks great rolled up or with deck shoes. To conclude, this is a good solid buy. And much more economical that other linen brands. Looking forwards to seeing how well they wear and last. I'm kind of a clothes snob, but like putting together outfits that are cheap but look amazing. So giving this a 5 star rating for looks, fitting, versatility, and most defiantly cost.

reviewText: These shoes arrived today. Was worried as my first order was placed with a 3rd party vendor and was afraid they would arrived used. Cancelled that order before they shipped. Made sure to order from Amazon and they are new in box!!  Now about the shoes, brand new in box. I took several advices to order 1 full size bigger and they are a perfect fit. New shoe smell is a bit odd but they will be fine once aired out. This pair will be my first pair of walking, jogging, running shoes intended for running and I am 45 yrs old. My first pair of Pumas!! I put them on and man ready to start running!!! I am worried about the mesh uppers as so many different shoes create holes so easily! I will keep doing reviews after use.  These shoes have a special spot in my rotation as they will only be indoor shoes to be used daily on my new treadmill that is arriving this week!! Awesome buy and will buy again depending on longevity!!

reviewText: As a fan of both style and functionality, I recently invested in the adidas Men's Essentials Warm-up Open Hem 3-stripes Tracksuit Pants, and I couldn't be more impressed. Here's why these pants have become an essential part of my wardrobe:Superb Comfort: From the moment I slipped into these tracksuit pants, I was enveloped in comfort. The fabric is soft and breathable, making them perfect for both lounging at home and hitting the gym. Whether I'm running errands or relaxing on the couch, these pants provide the ultimate comfort experience.Effortless Style: The iconic adidas 3-stripes design adds a touch of timeless style to these tracksuit pants. Whether I'm pairing them with a casual tee or a sporty jacket, they effortlessly elevate my look. The classic design ensures that I always look and feel my best, no matter the occasion.Versatile Wearability: These tracksuit pants are incredibly versatile, making them suitable for a wide range of activities. Whether I'm going for a jog, hitting the weights at the gym, or simply running errands around town, these pants keep up with my active lifestyle. The open hem design provides a relaxed fit that allows for unrestricted movement, while the elastic waist ensures a secure and comfortable fit.Durable Construction: Adidas is known for its commitment to quality, and these tracksuit pants are no exception. The durable construction means that they can withstand the rigors of daily wear and tear, maintaining their shape and color wash after wash. They're built to last, making them a smart investment for any wardrobe.Functional Design: The pockets are a practical addition, providing convenient storage for essentials like keys and phone during workouts or outings. The drawstring waist allows for a customized fit, ensuring that the pants stay in place no matter how active I am.Wide Range of Sizes: Adidas offers a wide range of sizes, ensuring that there's a perfect fit for everyone. Whether you're tall or short, slim or muscular, you can find a pair of tracksuit pants that fit you just right.In conclusion, the adidas Men's Essentials Warm-up Open Hem 3-stripes Tracksuit Pants are a must-have for anyone looking to combine comfort, style, and functionality. With their superb comfort, effortless style, versatile wearability, durable construction, functional design, and wide range of sizes, these pants exceed expectations on every level. I highly recommend them to anyone in search of the perfect pair of tracksuit pants to elevate their wardrobe.

reviewText: I bought these shorts after reading reviews about their comfort in hot humid climates. I wanted something comfortable but not lightweight. After three weeks in the tropics I can attest that these shorts are the right shorts for the climate. They dry outside in a couple of hours should you need to hand wash and while the cloth is thicker than lightweight fabric, it does not cling to the body. Pockets are generously sized for wallet and phone. The fit is about half size too loose but not an issue as I prefer my clothes baggy. One comment my wife made was that these do not look like the typical old man bulky cargo shorts. This means I can order more.These shorts are perfect for wearing around the city, the beach, light hikes, or inside a non-air conditioned bus. I'm not sure I would use these on any adventurous activity that has the potential to tear fabric. Your experience may be different but based on my experiences, this grade of fabric isn't for adventure.Because of my experience, I definitely would buy these again.

reviewText: I’ve bought about 10 pairs of these type of Lee jeans. All different cuts. They are all made perfect and without issue. I wear them daily to work and have done so for about two plus years. I also wear them around my property while working on things. I’m not easy on clothes. I don’t separate work clothes from going out clothes. If I’m wearing it and something needs done, oh well. I’ve read some of the people complaining about them ripping and not holding up. In my experience, they hold up fine. I’ve got a couple holes in a few pairs, all my fault. Not a one has ripped or gotten bigger. reviewText: ntroduction:When it comes to denim, Levi Strauss is a name synonymous with quality and timeless style. The Signature Jeans by Levi Strauss maintain the brand's reputation for excellence while offering a more affordable option. In this review, we will explore how Signature Jeans deliver a great fit, garner compliments, and showcase their commitment to quality materials.Perfect Fit:One of the standout features of Signature Jeans by Levi Strauss is their exceptional fit. Levi Strauss is known for their expertise in crafting jeans that flatter various body types, and the Signature line is no exception. With a range of sizes and styles to choose from, these jeans cater to different body shapes and personal preferences. The thoughtful design ensures a comfortable fit throughout the day, whether you're running errands, attending a social gathering, or simply relaxing at home. The jeans hug the curves in all the right places, providing a flattering silhouette that boosts confidence and makes you feel great.Stylish Appeal and Compliments:Signature Jeans not only deliver on fit but also boast a stylish appeal that garners compliments. Levi Strauss has mastered the art of creating denim that effortlessly combines classic aesthetics with contemporary trends. The jeans are available in various washes and finishes, ensuring there's a style to suit everyone's taste. From timeless dark washes to trendy distressed options, you can find the perfect pair to elevate your everyday looks. The attention to detail in the stitching and finishes adds a touch of sophistication, making these jeans a versatile and fashionable choice. When you wear Signature Jeans, be prepared to receive compliments on your stylish appearance.Quality Material:Levi Strauss has built a reputation for using high-quality materials in their denim products, and Signature Jeans live up to this legacy. The jeans are made from durable denim fabric that withstands regular wear and tear, ensuring longevity. The material maintains its shape even after multiple washes, preserving the integrity of the fit. Additionally, the fabric is comfortable against the skin, allowing for ease of movement without compromising on style. The attention to detail in the construction and choice of materials sets Signature Jeans apart, making them a reliable investment that will last for years to come.Affordability:One of the appealing aspects of Signature Jeans is their affordability without sacrificing quality. While maintaining the Levi Strauss standard, this line offers a more budget-friendly option for those seeking the iconic brand's style and fit. The competitive pricing makes Signature Jeans accessible to a wider range of consumers, allowing more people to enjoy the superior craftsmanship and timeless appeal that Levi Strauss is known for.Versatility:Signature Jeans are incredibly versatile, making them a wardrobe staple for any occasion. Whether you're dressing up for a night out or going for a casual look, these jeans can easily be dressed up or down. Pair them with a crisp shirt and blazer for a polished ensemble, or style them with a casual tee and sneakers for a laid-back vibe. The versatility of Signature Jeans ensures that they become a reliable go-to option for various settings and events.Conclusion:Signature Jeans by Levi Strauss offer a winning combination of great fit, stylish appeal, and quality materials. With their flattering silhouettes and versatile designs, these jeans not only make you look good but also feel confident. Levi Strauss's commitment to providing affordable options without compromising on quality ensures that Signature Jeans are accessible to a wider audience. When you wear Signature Jeans, you can expect a perfect fit, compliments on your style, and the durability to withstand regular wear. Embrace the timeless appeal and exceptional craftsmanship of Signature Jeans and elevate your denim game with this affordable yet premium option.
