reviewText: I am wearing the Hanes Cool Dri polo shirt right now. It has a ribbed collar and flat-seamed sleeves.WHAT I LIKE:The fit is exactly the same as every other Hanes polo I have worn — just order your usual American size. It’s a standard, traditional fit — it isn’t elastic, form-fitting, or clinging. The polyester fabric is very light and cool with a finish that is smooth, not meshy or lumpy. The finish is a little slippery, but that’s not a problem for me. I ordered black, which is very dark and opaque (not see-through). The price was very reasonable.I wash the Hanes Cool Dri polo shirt in biodegradable detergent on regular cycle with tap-cold water and maximum spin, and the shirt comes out wrinkle-free. Then I hang it on a plastic hanger on the shower rod and it is dry in a few hours. So that’s minimal care in my book.If you want to travel with the Hanes shirt, it packs light and hasn’t wrinkled, yet. If you want a shirt you can rinse out and hang up to dry overnight, this is it.WHAT I DON’T LIKE SO WELL:The only thing I don’t like is that the short sleeves are a little long, reaching to the middle of my elbows. I was going to send it back over the sleeves, but trusted advisors tell me that it looks fine. So, if it looks fine, it’s OK with me.DURABILITY:I have been testing my Hanes Cool Dri polo shirt by wearing all the time by itself and under a sweater or jacket for warmth. So far, my shirt has not shrunk, wrinkled, snagged, or pilled — the seams are still sewn tight. I wish I had longer term durability data for you, but then you couldn’t be reading my review now.ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES:Hanes Cool Dri polo shirts are made of synthetic polyester with no elastic fibers (like Lycra or Elastane). Polyester fabric is strong, clean, slightly absorbent, slightly shrinkable, and can be recycled. Lots of polyester is recycled from plastic water bottles, so that’s a good thing. Unfortunately, polyester is not very biodegradable (land fill estimate=100 years), although some bacteria and lichen have been found that degrade them. My Hanes Cool Dri polo shirt was made in El Salvador.RECOMMENDATIONS:Right now, I’m recommending Hanes Cool Dri polo shirts if you want a super light, inexpensive shirt and don’t mind the sleeves a little long. If I change my mind or my Hanes polyester polo develops problems, I’ll publish an UPDATE on my Amazon profile page (just click my name).You’re welcome to read more of my reviews, check for UPDATES, & follow my profile — click my name, above.I hope this review has saved you time and has been really helpful. Enjoy!

reviewText: I recently purchased the Fullfamous Baby Girl's 3pc Rib Frill Long Sleeve Romper and Pant Set for my little one, and it's been a delightful addition to her wardrobe.Design & Comfort:The outfit is not only cute but also very comfortable for my baby girl. The ribbed fabric is soft against her skin, and the frill detailing adds a lovely touch without being too fussy. The long sleeves provide extra warmth, which is perfect for cooler days.Quality:I'm impressed with the quality of the materials and the construction of this set. The stitching is well-done, and the fabric feels durable yet gentle enough for a baby's delicate skin. It's held up well through several washes, which is important for baby clothes.Style:The design of the romper and pants is charming and stylish. The color is vibrant and hasn't faded after washing, and the fit is just right. My baby looks adorable in it, and I've received compliments whenever she wears it out.Kid-Friendly:Most importantly, my baby loves wearing this outfit. It's comfortable enough for her to move around freely in, and she seems happy and content when she's dressed in it. As a parent, seeing her smile and play comfortably in her clothes is a big plus.Conclusion:Overall, I'm very happy with the Fullfamous Baby Girl's 3pc Rib Frill Long Sleeve Romper and Pant Set. It's a great combination of style, comfort, and quality that both my baby and I appreciate. If you're looking for a cute and practical outfit for your little girl, I would definitely recommend this set.

reviewText: Warning, when ordering, order one size up as these do run small. Read my whole review!!I just got this today and I must say, this is not a bad flannel coat. I say coat because it fits and wears more or less like a coat instead of a jacket.It's very comfortable to wearcas I've just been wearing it around the house to get a feel for this. I love wearing plaid/flannel shirts and coats/jacket so I'm very accustomed to wearing these.Ok so here are the pros:Very comfortable, love the color and choices of colors, materials seem very good although maybe not too rugged, good to wear out in the cold I suppose if wearing another layer of undershirt, wouldn't wear in place of a winter parka.Cons:Although I think a Large fits me good, I went ahead and just ordered an XL to see the size difference as another reviewer stated these run small. Although I do agree to a degree, the length is a bit short for my liking but isn't a deal breaker.I'm 5'7 with just a tad bit of a stomach (stuck on a temporary desk job) and I think the girth of this coat is just a tiny bit tight but again, not a deal breaker because of my poor choice of eating habit...lol. The breast pocket buttons are not very well stitched in and may fall off at some point in time as the stitching really is weak and not strong. So I suppose the longevity of these buttons will depend on the wearer.The sleeves length are spot on for what I like and am pleased with that. In the pictures I posted, you can see the inside of my hand and outside showing the length is a good fit. Also I was able to take a rear picture showing the length of this coat from behind.The very last thing I was a bit disappointed in...the color. In the listing, the pictures show a crisp sharp image. Not so when you get it. The coat literally has a little bit of a blurry look to it and not that crisp sharp look to the color like you see in the listing. Those familiar with wearing plaids and flannels know what I'm talking about.So, all in all this is not a bad coat, I just think maybe I will order a XL and compare the sizes. I like my flannels and plaids a little big because I carry concealed and those are deciding factors for me in these types of clothing. But if I were to grade this on a 5-Star grading, I'd probably give it a 4.5 just because I was disappointed with the coloring being blurred but that isn't a deal breaker.After wearing this just around the house, I think maybe this probably would fall under a jacket as I am discovering this jacket is a bit thin. But it really is comfortable to wear.Hope this helps...Update: November 13, 2023...Ok so I finally got around to ordering the XL size and I got to admit, this fits waaaay better then the size Large which I did return. Again, this is probably not the kind of jacket/coat to wear out in the freezing cold.This is more or less the kind of jacket to wear during those chilly evenings or day. I am talking maybe early winter before it gets too cold. I'm from Northern Idaho and I am familiar with the harsh winters and some winters are worse then others.If you plan on just wearing this to the store, fine go for it but bring something else too just in case. If you're in the Southern California areas, this is perfect for those winters in that area of the country.I honestly will give this a 5 star as the XL fits me much better. I'm 5'7 at about 189-193lbs with a slight stomach but average build. It's not so tight in the shoulders like the Large was and the sleeves aren't too lose, perfect for me to wear along sleeve thermal Under Armor type wicken shirt which I do wear quite often. Plan to order in other colors. I would place this right up there with Legendary Whitetail brand of these types of jacket/coats which I have quite a few of too...Pictures are of the Large size and not the XL size.Hope this helps...

reviewText: Overall, I am happy with my purchase. The biggest selling point for me with these shorts, is that they do not have a brief liner. I have my own athletic, supportive underwear that I use underneath of these shorts, so a liner would be unnecessary. With that in mind, if you are somebody who was looking for running shorts with built-in support, you may want to consider other options, or wear an athletic jock, or supportive pouch style underwear with these.  I think compared to other running short brands, these shorts are probably about the middle of the road quality. I purchased these on sale, so I think it was a good deal for the money. It’s got the perfect blend of synthetic fabric to be non-binding with other clothing and can even be worn as underwear. They are quick-drying , very light, and very comfortable. Overall, I would recommend the shorts for the price, and there are a lot of options of different colors

reviewText: TL;DR - insanely comfortable pants well-suited to wear around the house and outdoors as long as it isn’t too cold; they are extremely thin and won’t offer much warmth but I cannot say anything negative about this purchase; worth buying a backup pair for when I wear the . . .  pants . . .off of these pants!One evening last month I put on a pair of warmup pants — THE warmup pants, I had no other — and realized they weren’t all that new when Pope JPII was alive, and the elasticity was gone completely, and there was too much pant material for my frame, and maybe I should retire these.They were fairly heavy, but I live in a sub-tropical climate and hardly ever need anything so heavy.So I bought these because they were rated well and inexpensive compared to other known brands and I was not going to be hassled by the thousands of off-brand options, all of which I regard as a gamble at best and a hassle at worstI am very pleased with my purchase. For context, I am 6’0”, between 160 and 165 lbs depending on the day, and could reasonably be described as long-legged but not drastically so.Size: I bought medium, and they fit me perfectly. Take my height and weight into account in deciding your size. They even might run a hair long, but that could be due to how they sit at my waist.Style: I wear these in and around the house, and need only impress my dog, so these were simple and basic enough that I didn't much care how they look, but the photos are accurate.Comfort: I have achieved maximum comfort permitted by natural pants law, and wear these at all times until I go out during the day, and from after I get home and dress down.Material: The material is very thin and lightweight. reviewText: Very comfortable, medium-weight, and surprisingly breathable. I wear them around the house, in the yard, and for working out.Kind of the optimal design: cool enough for hot weather, heavy enough to not be revealing, long enough that they don't look like running shorts, short enough they don't look like basketball shorts. Not clingy-tight but not a lot excess fabric either on an average-athletic build.They're much more breathable than I would expect for fabric this weight. Unlike some synthetics, the fabric doesn't seem to pick up / hold sweat smells.The mesh-lined pockets are deep enough to hold a large phone or normal men's wallet, but heavier items will swing around if you're moving-- the pockets aren't structured since these are gym shorts.True to size-- not tight-clingy like a lot of UA gear can be.I picked up a pair of these because of the price, not expecting much, but I wear them so much that I've ordered a 2nd pair. I have some Vuoris I like better, but those are literally 5x the price. These are my shorts that get the most use during hot weather.Highly Recommended.

reviewText: I recently purchased a pair of Levi Strauss Signature Gold Men's Slim Fit Jeans from Amazon.com, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed with this product. As a long-time admirer of Levi Strauss, I am grateful to the company for continuing to offer high-quality products at reasonable prices. The legendary quality of Levi Strauss is evident in these Signature jeans, proving that the brand’s commitment to excellence remains unwavering.Legendary QualityOne of the most striking aspects of the Levi Strauss Signature Gold Men's Slim Fit Jeans is the remarkable quality. From the moment I unpacked them, I could feel the superior craftsmanship in the fabric and construction. These jeans are made of durable denim that promises longevity while maintaining comfort. The stitching is impeccable, ensuring that the jeans can withstand regular wear and tear without losing their integrity.Perfect FitAnother significant advantage of the Signature series is the accurate sizing. The size chart provided on the Amazon product page is precise and reliable. I ordered my usual size, and the jeans fit perfectly. This reliability in sizing eliminates the common concern of ordering clothing online and receiving an ill-fitting product. With Levi Strauss Signature Gold Jeans, you can confidently select your size, knowing that the fit will be just right.Value for MoneyLevi Strauss has managed to offer these high-quality jeans at a price point that is accessible to many consumers. The Signature Gold Men's Slim Fit Jeans are an excellent example of this balance between quality and affordability. It is rare to find such well-made jeans at this price, making them a terrific value for money.Stylish DesignThe slim fit design of these jeans is both modern and stylish. They have a classic look that can be dressed up or down, making them versatile for various occasions. Whether paired with a casual t-shirt or a dressier shirt, these jeans enhance any outfit. The sleek design and comfortable fit ensure that I look good and feel great whenever I wear them.ConclusionIn conclusion, the Levi Strauss Signature Gold Men's Slim Fit Jeans are a fantastic product that combines legendary quality with reasonable pricing. The accurate sizing chart provided online makes it easy to order the right size, and the jeans themselves do not disappoint in terms of comfort, durability, and style. I highly recommend these jeans to anyone looking for a reliable and stylish addition to their wardrobe. Levi Strauss has once again proven that their commitment to quality and customer satisfaction is unmatched. These jeans offer legendary quality with sensible savings.

reviewText: It would not be fair to judge this the way you would a top name brand jacket that you paid 5 times the price for. However, if you're looking for a coat that will keep you warm and isn't embarrassing to be seen in, but without a pricey logo this should be more than adequate.  The size is a little wonky and I had to return the Large (which I usually wear)because it fit me like a bedspread.  A drawstring to sinch up the waistline and slightly narrowed arms would have made it appear more stylish fit better.  I returned the 'L'  for a 'M', which was just subtly smaller, but a better fit for my 5'9 170 lb frame. The zippers are pretty plain and probably very cheaply made but I can't really attest to their durability in the short time I've had this.  The pull is on the normal right side for a men's jacket.  It was a blustery 12 degree day the first time I wore this and it easily kept me warm and dry and didn't make me sweat. I'm gladly keeping this.

reviewText: I recently purchased the Clarks Men's Oxford shoes, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed. These shoes effortlessly blend classic elegance with unmatched comfort, making them a perfect addition to any wardrobe.The first thing that caught my attention was the timeless design. The Oxfords feature a sleek silhouette and high-quality leather craftsmanship that exude sophistication. Whether paired with formal attire or dressed down for a more casual look, these shoes consistently elevate my style.Beyond their aesthetics, the comfort level is exceptional. The cushioned insole provides excellent support throughout the day, making them ideal for long hours on my feet. Additionally, the outsole offers a confident grip, ensuring stability on various surfaces.I also appreciate the attention to detail in the stitching and overall construction. It's evident that Clarks prioritizes durability, and I believe these shoes will stand the test of time.One minor aspect worth mentioning is the initial break-in period. Like most high-quality leather shoes, they required a few wears to conform to my feet perfectly. However, once they molded, the fit became incredibly comfortable.In conclusion, the Clarks Men's Oxford shoes offer a winning combination of style, comfort, and durability. Whether for formal events or daily wear, they consistently deliver a polished and refined look. I highly recommend these Oxfords to anyone seeking a timeless and reliable footwear option.

reviewText: I’ve been on the lookout for a pair of **comfortable, durable cargo pants** that I can wear both on casual days and for more active pursuits, and the **Wrangler Authentics Men's Relaxed Fit Stretch Cargo Pant** has definitely exceeded my expectations.First, the **fit**—these pants are labeled as **relaxed fit**, and I can tell right away that they’re designed to give you plenty of **room to move** without feeling baggy or oversized. The **stretch fabric** is a standout feature, allowing for easy movement, whether you’re out running errands, hiking, or just lounging around. It’s the kind of flexibility you want in a pant that can handle a bit of everything, and these cargo pants deliver just that.The material feels sturdy but **soft to the touch**, which means I don’t feel stiff or restricted even after wearing them for hours. I also appreciate the **reinforced stitching**, which makes them look and feel like a pant that can last through rough and everyday wear. Whether I’m working in the yard, on a weekend trip, or just out with friends, these cargo pants hold up well to all kinds of activities without showing signs of wear or tear.Speaking of durability, the **pockets** on these pants are excellent. There are **two front pockets**, **two back pockets**, and **two large cargo pockets** on the thighs—plenty of room to store tools, keys, phone, or anything else you need on hand. I love that the cargo pockets are big enough to hold items securely without feeling bulky or getting in the way. The added bonus is the **flap closures** on the cargo pockets, which keep everything in place.In terms of **style**, these pants have a clean, **casual look** that pairs easily with just about anything. I can dress them up with a button-up shirt for a laid-back look or wear them with a t-shirt for a more relaxed vibe. The **classic colors** (I opted for the khaki shade) are versatile and can easily be mixed and matched with my existing wardrobe.I also want to mention the **elastic waistband**—it adds a bit of extra comfort and allows for a better, more flexible fit around the waist, so I’m not constantly adjusting throughout the day.Overall, the **Wrangler Authentics Men's Relaxed Fit Stretch Cargo Pant** is a fantastic blend of comfort, durability, and style. If you’re looking for a pair of cargo pants that can keep up with your active lifestyle while still offering a relaxed, casual fit, these are definitely worth checking out.

reviewText: I recently snagged the COOFANDY Men’s 2 Pack Gym Workout Shorts, and let me tell you, they’re like a personal trainer for your legs—minus the shouting and the protein shakes. These shorts are so comfy and stylish, I’m half convinced they have superpowers.First off, the quick-dry feature is a game changer. I’ve sweat through more gym sessions than I care to admit, and these shorts somehow manage to dry faster than my ego after a failed attempt at a pull-up. It's like magic—sweat disappears before it even has a chance to settle in.The 7-inch length is the perfect compromise between I’m not here to show off my quads and I still want to look like I know what I’m doing. It’s also long enough to hide my inevitable post-workout leg jiggle but short enough to keep my cool factor high. I’m pretty sure these shorts could make even the most uncoordinated person look like a professional athlete.And let’s not forget the design. I’ve never been complimented on my gym attire until I started wearing these. I’ve had more “Nice shorts!” comments than I ever thought possible. It’s like these shorts have a built-in charm offensive.The only downside? Now I’m convinced I need to go to the gym more often just to justify owning these shorts. I might need an intervention because I’ve started showing up at the gym in full gear, even when I’m just there for the smoothie bar.In summary, if you want to look good while pretending you’re lifting heavy things, the COOFANDY Men’s Gym Workout Shorts are your ticket to gym fashion greatness. They’re comfortable, stylish, and they dry faster than you can say personal best.

reviewText: My biggest concern about these pants (or ANY of the dozens of linen pants choices here on Amazon) was the length.  Having them all sized as S, M, L, XL, XXL instead of with an actual inseam measurement was a little too vague for a tall guy like me.  I'm 6'3, 190 lbs. and usually wear 34 x 34 pants.  Based on another review, I took a chance on these XXL and they're perfect.  The color - khaki - is just what I wanted, and the material seems like good quality.  The elastic waistband fits comfortably snug on my 34/35-inch waist, but the drawstring helps if you want a tighter fit.  And it even has belt loops if you want a belted look.  I also like that they have back pockets that button if I'm carrying a wallet.  They're obviously quite a bit baggier than I would normally wear, but that's what I was going for with these: casual, lightweight, comfy for a beach wedding vow renewal.  They just arrived, so I've only tried them on for size.  I haven't worn them for any considerable length of time, but I'm hoping for the best.

reviewText: I just wanted some comfy, canvas sneakers for everyday wear. I started by ordering only one pair to make sure they would fit before buying any more. They are sized a bit large but I knew that from reading the reviews and because my foot measurement coincided with their size 9 on the size chart. I normally wear a size 10 so I (gladly) went down to a size 9. They fit perfectly. The shoes are lightweight and comfortable. They also have plenty of cushioning. I think there's enough room in the shoe to add an insert for arch support if you need that - I don't because I don't have much of an arch anyway. The laces are not the stretchy type. They are the standard cotton-type, which I like.I was so happy with my first pair (the multi-color red/pink), that I bought 2 more - the Volcanic Gray Lava Linen and the Olive Green. I'm so tempted to also get the solid pink and the navy blue but that will have to wait.Pros: Very attractive, pretty saturated colors, nice detail stitching, comfortableCons: No arch support - not a problem for me, but could be an issue if you have high arches, sizing is a little big - but again, not a problem for me

reviewText: UPDATE: initially I gave these pants a five, but have since backed it down to a four. By the way, the color has stayed a bright white.I am a woman that wears 12-14 in pants. I bought these because I have to be covered in the summer. These pants fit great. Thigh has room, not tight in the crotch. I am 5’6”” I like to wear pants with 30-32”inseam. These fit like a 31” inseam in the medium size. Look much better on than the gauzy pants I have bought  before. Made from 31% Linen, 21% cotton, and 47% viscose. Breathable. Bright white. I wish the material was a little softer.  They  are a little stiffer so they look a more dressy and  hold a crease. The draw string makes it look a little more casual. I have tucked them in the pants when I needed more dressy.  It says to hand wash. I washed in washing machine and had no trouble.  I would highly recommend for me and women.  Perfect for string and summer. Perfect for casual and dressy.  I will buy again.

reviewText: So good!Comfort:The first thing I noticed was how soft and breathable the fabric is. Made from a blend of cotton and spandex, they have just the right amount of stretch while remaining incredibly comfortable throughout the day. There’s no pinching or bunching, even during more active moments, and they feel almost weightless.Fit:The fit is spot-on. They’re snug without feeling tight, and they maintain their shape without sagging or riding up. The waistband is smooth and doesn’t dig into your skin, which is a huge plus for all-day wear. I’ve worn them to the gym, during long workdays, and they’ve held up perfectly.Design:[Brand] has done a great job balancing style with functionality. The simple, sleek design makes them easy to wear under any outfit, and the subtle branding on the waistband isn’t overly flashy. They come in a variety of colors and patterns, so there’s something for every preference.Durability:After several washes, these have shown no signs of wear or fading. The fabric has maintained its softness, and there’s no fraying at the seams. These definitely feel like they’re built to last, unlike some cheaper pairs that lose their elasticity after a few washes.Value for Money:They’re a bit pricier than some basic brands, but in my opinion, the comfort and durability are worth the extra cost. When you wear something all day, it’s worth investing in quality, and [Brand] delivers on that front.Overall:These are probably some of the best underwear I’ve owned in terms of comfort, fit, and durability. Whether you’re lounging around or on the move, they hold up great in any situation. Highly recommended for anyone looking to upgrade their underwear game!

reviewText: I recently purchased the Tommy Hilfiger Men's Comfort Stretch Cotton Chino Pants in Regular Fit, and I must say that I am thoroughly impressed. From the moment I put them on, I could feel the exceptional quality and attention to detail that Tommy Hilfiger is known for. These pants offer a perfect blend of comfort, style, and versatility, making them a wardrobe staple for any man. In this comprehensive review, I will delve into the various aspects of these pants, including their fit, material, comfort, style, and overall value.Fit:The Regular Fit of these chino pants is simply impeccable. They provide a balanced and flattering silhouette without being too tight or too loose. The waistband sits comfortably on the hips, and the pants offer just the right amount of room in the thighs and legs. The sizing chart provided by Tommy Hilfiger was accurate, ensuring a precise fit. It is worth noting that the Regular Fit is suitable for most body types, making it accessible to a wide range of individuals.Material:Tommy Hilfiger has chosen an exceptional material for these chino pants. The Comfort Stretch Cotton fabric feels luxurious against the skin and offers the perfect amount of stretch for unrestricted movement. It is evident that the brand prioritizes both style and comfort, as the fabric is soft and breathable. Additionally, the cotton material is durable and maintains its shape even after multiple washes, ensuring that these pants will last for years to come.Comfort:Comfort is where these chino pants truly shine. The combination of the Comfort Stretch Cotton fabric and the thoughtful design elements creates an unparalleled wearing experience. The stretch feature allows for complete freedom of movement, making these pants ideal for both casual and more active occasions. Whether I am sitting at my desk for hours or going for a long walk, I never feel restricted or uncomfortable in these pants. They truly live up to their name and provide a level of comfort that is unmatched by any other pair of chinos I've worn.Style:Tommy Hilfiger has struck the perfect balance between timeless style and modern trends with these chino pants. The clean and classic design allows for versatile styling options, making them suitable for various occasions. Whether I need to dress up for a business meeting or dress down for a casual gathering, these pants always make me look polished and put together. The attention to detail, such as the precise stitching and refined logo placement, adds an elegant touch to the overall aesthetic. I have received numerous compliments while wearing these pants, which is a testament to their impeccable style.Value:When it comes to value for money, Tommy Hilfiger Men's Comfort Stretch Cotton Chino Pants deliver in spades. While they may be slightly pricier than other chinos on the market, the quality and longevity justify the investment. These pants are built to last, and their timeless style ensures that they will remain relevant for years to come. Additionally, the superior comfort they provide is unparalleled, making them a worthwhile purchase for anyone who values both style and comfort.Conclusion:In conclusion, I cannot recommend the Tommy Hilfiger Men's Comfort Stretch Cotton Chino Pants in Regular Fit enough. They excel in all aspects that matter, from fit and material to comfort and style. These pants have become a staple in my wardrobe, and I find myself reaching for them time and time again. Tommy Hilfiger has once again proven their commitment to quality and craftsmanship with this outstanding product. If you are in search of chino pants that offer unmatched comfort, style, and versatility, look no further than the Tommy Hilfiger Men's Comfort Stretch Cotton Chino Pants in Regular Fit.

reviewText: I've been wearing Brooks Adrenaline GTS shoes for 8 years, and during that time have bought multiple pairs of 3 different models of GTS shoes.  They are really good shoes, very comfortable, I can very easily wear then all day long (more comfortable than just wearing socks around the house), and perfect for the particular pronation of my feet.  However, this is the first time I've purchased the 2024 edition of these shoes (the Adrenaline GTS 24), and I'm disappointed to discover that there is now a conspicuous advertising message on the tongue of the shoes.  In a bold black stripe, it says Adrenaline 24 GTS, which is eye-catching and detracts from the appearance of the shoes.  On the GTS 18 and GTS 16 models of these shoes, the branding on the tongue of the shoe was very subtle, which I like.  But with these GTS 24 shoes, it's kind of like wearing a big NIKE message on the front of my shirt or something.  Part of the reason I chose this un-flashy gray color is so my shoes will blend in with any casual outfit I wear, but with these shoes, I feel like I'm making a big statement to the world that I love my Brooks Adrenaline GTS shoes.  The bold black stripe is made of a spandex material, and is only sewn-in on the ends of the stripe, so I guess I could use some scissors to cut it off.  But then there would be this little messy black edge where I cut off the advertising.  Anyway, bummer about the bold black advertising stripe, and I hope they omit this in future models of this shoe.  But it's still a really good shoe.

reviewText: I bought three of these in black, navy, and white. They're my go-to for working out or when I'm at home.Here's why I say to avoid the white ones. When I received it, they were more of a silver-white color than I expected but I didn't mind. The real magic began when I went to wash it. Machine washed with like colors, tumble-dried low, and Viola! Green shorts! Kind of like an old mirror green. Best to stick with darker colors I assume.Otherwise, they're great! Nice elastic waist, thin material (but not underwear-thin) with a solid layer underneath. Sturdy enough to toss in the wash without much thought.Haven't had any trouble getting anything snagged in the mesh on the outer layer, feels like you'd have to really brush up on something to do that. Pockets are deep enough to keep my phone comfortably while moving around.I'd say the only downside is length, I'm 6ft and this stops just above my knee.Overall, I'm pretty happy with them. Also I'm keeping the green one.

reviewText: I wanted to post an initial review in case anyone like me has events this weekend and is considering buying this.TL; Dr: these shaper shorts are great if you're looking for light compression/support and some smoothing.As a tall plus size woman (5'11, 310lbs, 50-46-56, usually wear a 3x/4x), this item suits my needs to look a bit smoother under clingy dresses, prevent thigh chafing, and provide some abdominal compression for POTS symptoms relief. I have my highschool reunion this weekend and will be wearing a bodycon dress, so I wanted some shaper shorts that would smooth me out a bit without being uncomfortable. The mixed reviews on this item scared me a bit, but so far I'm glad I took a chance. I've been wearing them to work the past couple of days to test them out in case I needed to switch sizes or to another brand.These shaper shorts are surprisingly comfortable for having a decent amount of light-modedate compression. While I'm tall, I'm also quite short-waisted with a long hip/pelvis, and carry most of my weight in my stomach, butt, and upper thighs. The waistband comes all the way up to my bra line, but so far has not rolled down thanks to the fabric quality and small stays strategically placed. The legs are also a great length to not roll on my thick thighs - I'm easily able to adjust them higher or lower depending on the length of my skirt. The fabric is fairly breathable and soft, doesn't irritate my sensitive skin. Other than the very top of the waistband, I can't feel them on after a bit.I'm glad I went with the 4x instead of the 3x. My measurements were on the low end of the 4x, and I decided to opt for comfort over stronger compression. The shorts are quite stretchy, and I imagine someone several inches bigger than me could comfortably wear them. The shorts washed fine in a laundry bag on delicate cycle and didn't shrink too much. I can't speak to their long-term durability and performance, but I will update this review after my events with pictures and final thoughts.Overall, I definitely can recommend these to others looking for similar qualities in shaper shorts. I hope this review helps other tall plus size women as I know how hard it is to find comfortable, flattering clothing for us.

reviewText: I'm usually an 100% cotton guy and search Amazon high and low for shirts and other things that fit this preference.  I was looking for some good basic t-shirts for round the house ware or maybe under a nicer shirt... but NOT undershirts.  These were very well reviewed, but they are a cotton-poly blend and thus I was suspicious.  I bought one as a tester.  It was nice and soft and well-shaped right out of the package.  Not too trim, not to wide.  Good fabric weight and density.  I'm 5'-10, 185 lbs. and the Large fits me well.  I wore and washed it three times to see how it held up and it was perfect.  No shrinkage to note, no puckering or warping of the collar or seams.  Still nicely soft and good looking, so, I bought three more in various colors.  Love their three-pack options, it's like they know what buyers want!  Two big thumbs up!

reviewText: Let me preface this by saying I'm not one for writing reviews, but for these TELALEO Compression Shorts, I'll make an exception. If you're recovering from hernia surgery, listen up - these shorts are game-changers.Pre-Surgery Skeptic:Before my surgery, I was skeptical about compression shorts. They looked...intense. Would they be comfortable? Restrictive? Honestly, I just wanted to be pain-free, not squeezed into sausage casing. But my doctor insisted, so I ordered a pack of TELALEOs on a whim.Post-Surgery Superhero:From the moment I slipped them on, it was like a sigh of relief for my entire core. The gentle compression was supportive but not suffocating, holding everything in place without feeling constricting. Walking, even just around the house, felt easier and less painful.Here's why I'm a die-hard TELALEO fan:Comfort is king: The soft, breathable fabric feels like a second skin. No chafing, no bunching, just pure comfort that lasts all day (and sometimes into the night, I confess).Compression that cares: The targeted support cradles your core without feeling overwhelming. It's like a gentle hug that reduces swelling and keeps everything feeling secure.Mobility matters: I was worried compression would limit my movement, but these shorts actually improve it. They feel like a stable base, allowing me to move with more confidence and less pain.Bonus benefits: The flat seams and tagless design eliminate any potential irritation, and the convenient pockets are perfect for stashing your phone or keys.More than just shorts, these are recovery allies:These TELALEO shorts have become an essential part of my post-surgery journey. They've helped me manage pain, regain confidence, and even get back to some light exercise sooner than I expected. They're not magic, but they're pretty darn close.Final verdict:If you're facing hernia surgery, do yourself a favor and grab a pack of these TELALEO Compression Shorts. They're an investment in your comfort, recovery, and well-being. Trust me, your sore abs will thank you.P.S. I even bought an extra pack for everyday wear. They're that good!

Underarmor is not an inexpensive brand, but what you get when it's new is what you have months later after active use and normal washing. reviewText: I'm 6'0 tall and weigh about 200. I normally wear 36 waist and ordered 36 with these. Surprisingly they are a bit lose! I had a little thrill when faced with the possibility that I've trimmed down, but unfortunately, all my other 36's still feel the same as they did. I guess I have to conclude my pair of these adidas shorts run big.They are very nice shorts. The three stripes above the rear pocket and the adidas logo below the left front pocket are both subtle blue-on-blue, so these don't scream golf shorts or athletic shorts. But they are just four-pocket shorts.They stretch quite a bit, and they look good, and I'm certain that the material will breath and perform well, but there is nothing else about these shorts that makes them golf shorts and therefor command the premium price for golf wear. There is no special rear pocket for your score book, no secret tee-pocket, and they don't even have gripper material on the inside waistband to help keep your golf shirt tucked in.Again, nice shorts, but where's the golf? At a list price of $60, it would be nice to have some features that make these adidas golf shorts, and not just adidas shorts.

reviewText: This was an amazing birthday gift from my sister. At the time I almost gave up on trying to find shirts that fit me well because my height is essentially 5 ft 11, and my current weight is 165, with a slim build. What made this shirt perfect for me is the classic fitted design, coupled with the material, which stretches smoothly.When you open the packaging, the fist thing that hits you is how bold the colors are. The shirt looks wrinkled when you remove it from its packaging, but all you’ll need to do is iron it for it to essentially become wrinkle free. You can’t iron it directly because the material will get damaged, so you’ll need to take a cotton pillow case, or a cotton shirt, and put it over the shirt to get the wrinkles out. Once that’s done, what you’re left with is a shirt that has stronger material around the collar, which makes it stay in place, as well as a shirt that’s largely stain resistant, which makes it easy to spot clean with simple soap and water. As a DJ that does venues, weddings, and private parties, this makes the shirt perfect for me. I love these shirts so much that it lead to buying the blue, rose red, and white shirts, since my sister sent me the solid black shirt as a gift. My plan is to get nearly all of them since they look color accurate. There have been a lot of complements on how nice these shirts look, or how well they fit. Normally, I wear them with a solid black undershirt, and the colors are so bold and strong that you can’t see the undershirt. Lion Nardo’s white dress shirt is only color they have that’s very slightly see through, so my recommendation is wearing a light grey or white undershirt to make it pop more. All in all, the only complaint that someone might have is that the material feels different than any other dress shirt if you wear it without an undershirt.I currently have 6 different colors of these Lion Nardo shirts, and as noted, my plan to get more of them in different colors. It’s safe for me to say that these stylishly fitted, well designed, bold and wrinkle free shirts make them an easy 5 star product.

Whether I‚Äôm sitting for long periods or running errands, they stay comfortable throughout the day.Material & Quality ‚Äì 5/5Levi‚Äôs is known for its durable denim, and the Signature Gold line lives up to the reputation. The fabric feels sturdy but not stiff, and even after multiple washes, the jeans retain their shape and softness. The stitching is well-done, with no loose threads or weak seams, making them a long-lasting addition to my wardrobe.Style & Versatility ‚Äì 5/5These jeans come in a variety of washes and styles, making them versatile for any occasion. Whether I pair them with a casual t-shirt and sneakers for a relaxed look or dress them up with heels and a blouse, they always look effortlessly stylish. The mid-rise and high-rise options provide a flattering silhouette, and the classic five-pocket design adds a timeless touch.Sizing & Fit Accuracy ‚Äì 4.5/5The sizing runs pretty true to size, but if you‚Äôre between sizes, I‚Äôd recommend sizing up for a more relaxed fit. The stretch in the fabric helps with a customized fit, so even if they feel slightly snug at first, they tend to mold to your shape perfectly.Value for Money ‚Äì 5/5For the price, these jeans are a fantastic deal. You get Levi‚Äôs quality without the premium price tag, making them a great investment for everyday wear. They hold up well over time, and the fabric doesn‚Äôt fade easily, which is a huge plus!Final Verdict: 5/5 ‚Äì A Must-Have Pair of Jeans!If you‚Äôre looking for stylish, comfortable, and well-made jeans that won‚Äôt break the bank, Levi Strauss Signature Gold Women‚Äôs Jeans are a perfect choice. reviewText: This might not be brief, but it will be efficient (and worth it)!1. I bought/tried these shoes because, within six months, I have always ripped the front of my new balance shoes (for ~ a decade) requiring new ones. Hence I waited 1 year + to write this review...2. These shoes are as comfortable as new balance and still look new! So no need to constantly replace them... Or baby them (I'm hard on shoes).As you can imagine the steel keeps the front of the shoe from ripping. So never again...3. I run (with my dog -- fast) in these shoes, they are that comfortable.4. Therefore they are perfect from a security perspective. Not only can no one stomp on your foot and do you harm, but imagine getting kicked with these suckers on! Also, you could run away if you needed to...5. These shoes are so comfortable, I routinely think I'm wearing my slippers and thus fail to swap them when I get home. I've caught myself many times realizing I wore them all day.6. I made a mistake when I bought my first pair. I knew I would get lazy and not change shoes to walk my dog, so I wanted to avoid smashing my toes against the steel plate during a run. If you're a runner of any distance, you know how much damage that can do to your feet. So I bought 10s instead of 9.5. Four months later I bought 9.5 because they clearly accounted for that in the design. And the 10s were too big. My feet were sliding around too much in those, even with pads in them.7. They are roomy vertically so I doubled up some pads in them (the 9.5s) thus increasing their comfort. Yet they remain roomy/comfortable. I never bump up against the plate.8. You can put HEAVY things on them, I often hang drywall, and you can set it on your shoes feeling no pressure on your feet while keeping the drywall off the ground.9. They are a tad on the warm side. Terrific in winter, and even good for walking in snow, but in the summer, on a hot day my feet will sweat. Not wonderful. They breathe, but there are tradeoffs. IE It's hard to breathe through a steel plate. So I can't blame the manufacturer, I still love them.10. The sole is not particularly flexible, it doesn't exactly conform/bend to your feet during a run, but I wouldn't think buyers of shoes like these would care.  I got used to it, but it's worth mentioning in case others might (care). And that leads to my next point:11. During a run, a sharp rock came up through the bottom of my first pair. I was shocked because that never happened before. And I suspect the ridgidness of the sole may have contributed. They weren't destroyed by that, but if you're walking around a construction site, be careful. Safe on top, not so sure about the bottom. In a year + that hasn't happened with this pair. They're not bad soles, but perhaps the only room for improvement.12. I never thought someone stomping on my foot could do me harm. I thought that was ridiculous in movies until I dropped something heavy on my foot 2 years ago. Wow - ouch! So even if you don't do construction, these are a great upgrade to your personal security for that reason alone.13. Even with the steel plate and sturdy construction, I don't find them all that heavy (anymore), but they are heavier and a bit clunky, runners will notice and it took some getting used to. Eventually my laziness, about changing shoes, won out and now I'm used to running in them. And I no longer view them as such a drag. For several months, I loathed running in them until one day I just forgot.14. I don't consider them waterproof. Water resistant maybe, but don't sell your waders. Your feet will get wet if you submerge them.15. If you want shoes that will last forever, look good without maintenance, increase your personal security, protect your feet, and that you will eventually find very comfortable, these are for you.

reviewText: I was getting ready to take a trip to England, Scotland, and Ireland, and needed a jacket that would handle temps between upper 40's and lower 60's (October and November) with occasional rain.  This jacket handled all aspects admirably.  Using their sizing chart, size was perfect.  Jacket has a lot going for it, especially from a travel pespective:  It is easy to layer clothing underneath it, pockets are warm and lined, and something I found expecially helpful, was that the interior pocket is particularly deep.  Was great for gloves, paper items, etc. with no doubts about them staying in place.Coat is also excellent for when you have to change temps, such as you are going inside but still need to wear your coat.  It is light enough that it doesn't get in the way and you don't overheat with it on.  Bonus for the jacket was that it folds up well so that I could put it under the straps of my travel backpack and it would still fit inside the overhead bin.Got caught in the rain a couple of times (no surprise there) and it handled the rain extremely well, shedding the rain quickly and also drying quickly.Only minor negative (and it didn't impact me, but it might some) is that the zipper on the small pocket on the left sleeve (used for keys, etc.) had a habit of sliding open.  Again, no problem for me since I was not storing anything in there, but something to be aware of.All in all, an excellent purchase.  Worth the money.

reviewText: Honestly one of the best shoes on the market for wide foot people, if your looking to snag a simple set of running sneakers, in my opinion. Here's some in-depth info along with  pro's and con's:TLDR: Great quality shoes for the price, and easy to clean. Recommend to beginner and intermediate runners/hikers, experts may be willing to pay more money for increase of quality.PROs:- Perfect Fit. I usually wear 9.0 wide (USA), so that is what I ordered and it fit perfectly.- Comfort and Ease. I like how comfortable they are and they are easy to slip on and off (if you wish) by the use of the heel pull tab. The tab also prevents the heel from getting bunched in or broken when putting on the shoes, which was a frequent problem with some other brands I have owned in the past.- Easy to Clean, Quality Mesh. I have seen some reviews saying these shoes wear out easily or the mesh is easier to damage. YMMV but I didn't seem to have this issue and I've had these shoes for about a year. IMO I find the mesh to be much more durable than the cloth mesh most sports shoes have these days and much easier to clean, which is essential for anyone like myself, who often hikes or runs in forestry/mud.- Above Average Quality. As for the year timeframe, the 1st set was about 8 months of extreme use, then I purchased a 2nd pair which I've had for about 3 months now. This may seem like a short timeframe to some but for me, I usually have to change shoes every 6 months or less if they are lower quality because they get a lot of mileage and use. I still have the 1st set which I use as lawn mowing shoes, as they are still usable but the tread does not get much grip/traction anymore for running. I liked them enough to buy that 2nd pair instead of some other brand/model.- Decent Arch Support and Sole Tread. You will find other shoes with the same or better, but I didn't see many that were this cheap in price.- Part of Amazon's Try Before You Buy. Free try-ons. You can take up to 6 days to decide whether to keep/return if you wish, and only be charged if not returned by the 7th day. Day 1 is the day they are delivered.- Uniform in Color. The shoe currently comes in all-black or all-white, including the logo. YMMV but this is a pro for me due to work restrictions requiring all-black shoes, so I can also wear them leisurely at work if I choose (I'm a mechanic). Great for anyone with the same issue, or military, etc.CONs:- Not the most expert/elite quality shoe out there, but will definitely check most people's boxes for average needs, imo.- Cost is higher than one might desire for just simple leisure shoes. But as an avid runner, the price is about average. However, they are usually on sale. My 1st set was around 40% off which dropped it from $70-something to $43, which was worth it for me. 2nd set was about 20% off. Winter holiday seems to be the best time for sales price.- Tread pattern is smooth and circular, instead of rigid and square/triangle, in case that matters to you (in regards to rock climbing etc)Overall I was surprisingly satisfied with this shoe model personally, but your mileage may vary.

reviewText: I wanted to leave a review for these shoes specifically because Amazon has a habit of throwing old reviews at the buyer rather than more recent ones. There aren't many with a fair critique, or they resort to omg it sucks/rocks. So, here we go.After years of using TredSafe shoes due to just not having the money to afford fancy-shmancy, I bit the bullet on these shoes figuring I could at least default to other shoes if they didn't work out. Also, a lot of reviews complained on durability and such, but they were recommended, so I went for it.Durability: Uhhhh, folks must have run over their pairs with a lawn mower to get them wrecked like they were, because wow have mine been accidentally kicked into and scraped by a LOT of old metal equipment and hardware with basically no damage. Really, the only damage was a screw I somehow stepped on, drilling a hole into the bottom. I mean, it didn't poke my foot, so no harm done.Comfort: Okay, so memory foam is a big your mileage may vary situation, but generally the foam is pretty okay in these shoes. Seeing as I run around a lot more at my new job than I did my old one, these do pretty good at cushioning my 13W feet. Then again, I am also a tall dude, so the memory foam cushioning may not be as effective for me. It hasn't been long enough to really wear it out either, but again, your mileage may vary. Also depends on whether you really understand memory foam, which I kind of don't. I might be totally off-base.But anyways. Even without that, the general feel and support of the shoe is good. The fact that my heels basically never hurt after eight-hour shifts when they would tend to hurt in the old, cheap TredSafe shoes is a pretty good testament to that fact.The fit: It fits...? I mean, 13W feet, I bought 13W. It fit pretty much as expected. The only minor complaint I can make is more a special case: there isn't a lot of room for inserts. See, I'm weird and have a tendency to put more pressure on the front of my feet than the heel, and not a shoe can be found at reasonable price for someone weird like me. I'd like to be able to fit some front support into the shoes to counter that, but there's just not enough room. Maybe once I wear out the memory foam, but otherwise... Well, that's a me thing. If you walk like a normal person rather than like I did as a kid to catch late-night TV without being caught, then you should be okay.Other stuff: One other minor complaint is just a typical sneaker issue but a bit worse. When the bottoms of the shoes get wet, walking on any kind of hard floor gives off an obnoxious squeaking sound. I don't mean like basketball court squeaking. I mean like twisting leather squeaking. To be fair... They're sneakers. They'll make noise like that, but it's usually not that annoying. They do dry out pretty quick so long as you don't keep getting them wet, so it doesn't last particularly long.So... Four stars? Yeah. They're pretty good overall, and they sure do take a beating. I keep expecting something I do to rip it open, but there isn't a single tear or crack anywhere (besides the hole from the screw). Main problem is just memory foam getting in the way of using inserts, lack of front foot support for those like yours truly, and the obnoxious wet squeak. Still a solid shoe, though. Worth the money.Update: 07/22/2023Just bought a second pair because the pair I use finally showed signs of serious wear, which is pretty impressive since I've used these shoes for almost everything from job work to yard work. They have had their soles handed to them regularly and only just now started actually falling apart in any measure. They aren't dead just yet, but the shoes were on a good sale so I bought pair two ahead of time.I did end up wearing out the memory foam rather quick (but I also walk weird, so once again your mileage may vary) but pulling them out to replace with new inserts was really easy, so it was a simple swap-out. I will say it's best to just swap for more memory foam since other support inserts didn't help just because of the shoe's own support.So yeah, running back in to say you REALLY have to try to destroy these shoes to make them fall apart: for having lasted 3 years of me, they've done a very good job staying together. They're still comfortable, pretty good support, and make the annoying leather-twisting noise when wet, but I definitely think they're worth the price, sale or not.

reviewText: I recently purchased the Champion Men's Midweight Cotton Crewneck T-Shirt, and I have to say it's one of the best basic tees I've owned. This shirt strikes the perfect balance between comfort, fit, and style, making it an essential wardrobe staple for men.First and foremost, the cotton fabric is of excellent quality. It's soft, breathable, and feels great against the skin. The midweight thickness is just right - not too heavy, not too light - making it suitable for year-round wear. Whether I wear it on its own during warmer months or layer it under a jacket in colder weather, it always feels comfortable and keeps me at the perfect temperature.The fit is spot on as well. The crewneck tee is cut in a way that offers a flattering shape without being too tight or too loose. The sleeves have just the right length, hitting the mid-bicep, which I find very comfortable and stylish.I also appreciate that Champion offers this tee in both regular and big & tall sizes, ensuring a perfect fit for all body types. The inclusivity in sizing is a big plus, and it's a testament to Champion's commitment to providing comfortable clothing for all men.The design is simple yet classic, with the iconic Champion logo subtly embroidered on the sleeve. This minimalistic approach allows the shirt to be versatile, easily paired with jeans, shorts, or activewear for various occasions.Moreover, this tee holds up well to washing and retains its shape and color. The durable construction and high-quality fabric ensure that it will last for a long time, making it a great investment.Overall, I highly recommend the Champion Men's Midweight Cotton Crewneck T-Shirt to any man looking for a high-quality, comfortable, and versatile basic tee. Whether for everyday wear, casual outings, or workouts, this shirt has become a go-to item in my wardrobe. I'll definitely be purchasing more of these in different colors!

reviewText: First  impressions: These jeans look great and fit well with a loose, comfortable feel—perfect for layering thermals in Korea’s colder months. I’m a fan of Levi’s (and still love them), but these cost only a quarter of the price. The material feels quite rough and stiff, so I washed them before wearing to see if they’d soften, but they haven’t yet.Since the previous pair ran slightly smaller, I gave it to my son and ordered another one (36” x 32”) for myself. This pair fits better, but I noticed the actual length is longer than usual compared to Levi’s, and the waist still runs slightly small. If you’re considering these jeans, keep the sizing differences in mind. Overall, they’re a great value for the price!.

reviewText: I really like these pants. I ordered one pair in white and another in gray, which is a very light colored gray. I like to wear these type of pants around the beach or resorts we visit, as I’m not a big fan of using sunscreen. Having had skin cancer dug out me for the last 10 years from too many years of excessive sun exposure here in Southern California, these pants give me some protection from that. I realize these would most likely have a low SPF rating in regards to sunblocking, but that’s fine, as I don’t sit out in direct sun all that long anyway when I go places. I do have sun blocking hiking type pants when I do need something like that. I also realize that you still need a certain amount of vitamin D that the sun provides naturally, so these fit the bill in that regard. I like their loose fit, and being all cotton, they dry fast as well if you do get them wet.I’m 6’ 1” / 195 lbs. and normally wear a size 34 waist with a 32 inseam in low waisted jeans. The size large I ordered in these pants seem to fit me just right with a good length to them. Being that they are all cotton, I plan on washing them on a cold cycle and hang drying them to keep them from shrinking up. I would highly recommend these pants, as I am more than satisfied with their quality and fit.

reviewText: I recently purchased this Under Armour Men's Tech Golf Polo, and I must say, I am extremely pleased with this product. From the moment I put it on, I knew I had made an excellent choice.The first thing that struck me was the quality and thickness of the fabric. It feels durable and well-made, providing a sense of confidence that it will withstand regular wear and tear. The material is soft against the skin and has a slight stretch, making it incredibly comfortable to move around in, whether I'm on the golf course or at work.The detailing on this polo is top-notch. Under Armour has paid attention to the little things that elevate the overall look, giving it a sophisticated and polished appearance. The subtle logo and design elements add just the right amount of flair without being too flashy, making it suitable for various occasions.One of the things I love about this polo is its versatility. It truly fits the dress-casual category, making it suitable for both professional settings and leisure activities. I can easily wear it to the office with a pair of slacks, and then transition seamlessly to a round of golf without feeling out of place.I was so impressed with the first one that I also purchased this polo in multiple colors. Each one looks fantastic, and having a few in the rotation has become a staple in my wardrobe. It's one less thing to worry about when getting dressed, as I know I'll always look put together and stylish with these shirts. I can't explain it, but I feel more confident when I wear this polo.The fit of the Under Armour Tech Golf Polo is spot on. It's not too loose or tight, providing a flattering silhouette that enhances my physique. What's more, I appreciate that it didn't shrink after washing, maintaining its original fit and shape, which is essential for a garment I plan to wear frequently.As for the price, it is reasonable considering the quality and versatility of the product. It's evident that this polo is built to last, making it a worthwhile investment in my wardrobe.In conclusion, the Under Armour Men's Tech Golf Polo is a winner on all fronts. Its excellent quality, thickness, and attention to detail make it a standout choice for anyone looking to add a touch of sophistication to their wardrobe. The ability to dress it up for work or dress it down for play makes it a highly versatile piece. With a great fit and exceptional comfort, it's a pleasure to wear all day long. I highly recommend this polo to anyone seeking a reliable, stylish, and comfortable addition to their clothing collection. I hope my review was helpful to you.

reviewText: I just purchased more because they are like $8 cheaper than anywhere else. Wrangler has so many different styles and fits that you need to know what you need to get. Ok example Ariat M4 I wear 42x32, on cinch black label same 40x32. Wrangler 20x relaxed 40x32, on the wrangler 13MWZ pre-washed indigo, stoned washed tan and all other washes 44x32 these don’t shrink much. For the wrangler 13MWZ rigid indigo 46x32 they do shrink but not that much. So rigids after the initial treatment they shrink to a 45x31 the only thing if you know the original cowboy cut these are high rise jeans so they go higher up on the waist, the thighs are relaxed but not straight leg, they stack on boots(depending on the stack you want that is how long you get them) I do like stacked jeans but not a lot of material. Because of the larger size I get on these jeans the waist is fine, the length is fine but the thighs feel a little more loose, but I have tried the 44x32 and they feel tight after I shrink and break them in. They are easy to break in for the first wear, this is what I do. Flip the jeans inside out( this is the only way you should be washing jeans)I wash them on the heavy cycle with hot water, then dry them in dryer on hot cycle. Get them out throw them in the washer again same hot cycle, get them out dry again in hot cycle. The first two rounds no laundry detergent the 3 round I add detergent and a dryer sheet on the dryer, I don’t complete the last dryer cycle I take them out after 10 minutes and air dry them. After you do this they are way softer they have shrunk enough and fit way better. So if you want a tighter fit go with your regular size, if you like a little space go up one size. They will shrink just a bit more after that but it is not very noticeable. Ok now that they are ready,  wear them a couple of times before you wash them again if they start to smell air them out. If you don’t stink them up go as many wears as you can. Next time you need to wash them flip them inside out zipped them up button them up throw them in the delicate cycle with cold water setting with very little detergent try not to use laundry softener. Take them out of washer and air dry them inside your house, try not to sun dry. If you need to use dryer on an emergency use the lowest setting possible. They last a while and better if you have several pairs on rotation I always have 5-6 pairs on rotation so they don’t get washed often once they need washing I get another 5-6 pairs an start rotation on those. I have pairs that are pretty old. You dye these pants if you need to but the natural worn use gives them personality.

reviewText: I've worn Levi 517 boot cut jeans my entire adult life, but in the last few years I've notice a marked decline in their quality and ease of tearing and wearing, so I've been trying to find alternatives. Landed on these Carhartt jeans because they are one of the few still sewing in 7 belt loops and have always had a good reputation. Well, these are still holding up longer than the previous pair of Levi's! I do a lot of metal work and bending/squatting and a fair amount of trying to maneuver around mildly pointy bits of miscellaneous materials in tight spaces, but haven't had a single puncture or rip. Waist sits right, pockets aren't paper thin inside like some other brands, they're comfortable, cost a little less, and the color hasn't even run out with washing and scrubbing diesel soot out! I only wish they had a larger flare to get over my boots easier. I've found it best to roll the legs up, out my boots on and roll them back down to make it easier to get the leg opening over the top of my boots, particularly the wide tops of muck boots.

reviewText: I'm writing this review for those of you wondering if these are similar to the chubbies everywear shorts. I'll do a more in depth comparison, but from a high level they are extremely similar! There are a couple differences between them highlighted below. I have also included several pictures with direct comparison to actual chubbies which are my favorite shorts that I've been wearing for the past year or so. I snagged these up on prime day looking for a much cheaper alternative to my favorite chubbies shorts. These are super close for a fraction of the price.Biggest differences; maamgic is slightly longer (more material) overall despite having a half inch shorter inseam. Maamgic has also added a couple features not on the chubbies; metal tips on the drawstring, small key ring/loop on the front right belt loop, an additional 'change' pocket sown into the front left pocket. Maamgic also uses 90% polyester and 10% spandex, where chubbies is 89% polyester and 11% elasthanne.Minor differences; I would also say the threads and seams are a little more noticeable and visible on the maamgic depending on the colorway you choose. They only have one color for the drawstrings of the maamgic, if that matters to you. The chubbies have a slightly softer feel to them and less shiny looking, this could be that I've washed and been wearing the chubbies for awhile where I just got the maamgic shorts. The maamgic comes with a small elastic cord attached to the rear zipper pocket. There is also a slightly different tint to the similar colors of each brand just based on the materials they use.Maamgic pros; price ($37 difference), slightly longer overall, added belt loop key ring, metal drawstrings tips, added 'change' pocket inside front pocket, great basic colorways.Chubbies pros; name brand, slighter higher build quality (threads, seams, material & zippers etc) and overall softer feel, cool names for, along with, more colorways and patterns, both 6 inch and 8 inch inseam options.So if you're looking for a much cheaper alternative to chubbies everywear shorts, this is it! I plan to buy several in the colorways I'm missing from chubbies. I can't comment on the long term use of the maamgic compared to chubbies but I hope they hold up and last just as long! Let me know if this helps or you have any questions!

reviewText: This jacket is a pretty outstanding value, even though it’s more than I needed. I purchased three in hopes that they were lighter—more like a top to wear over a t-shirt. As a fleece, this is pretty heavy, like a light coat. The tail comes down to mid butt and the sleeves are perfect—just a tad long on my average arms. At 5’9” and 155, I almost always wear small and these smalls fit with room to easily wear a couple base layers or a sweatshirt underneath. Not as soft as I was hoping for—again, was thinking more of a top, not a coat—but reasonably soft for a jacket. Looks just fine. Was at an outdoor sports store and compared this to a Patagonia offering that was very similar in quality and feel. Zippers all work just fine. The bonus inner pockets do (inexplicably!) have holes in them large enough to lose your AirPods case, but good for larger things like hat, gloves, trail map, or cell phone. I wore one over a wool tshirt for a mountain hike. 30 degrees with 15 mph winds in the Boulder Flatirons. Overall just a little chilly after working up my body heat during a 2 hour hike.  I didn’t really need any more jackets but made room in the rotation for these. Smoking deal for what I paid!

reviewText: If you’re debating between these CRZ Yoga’s Hybrid Workout Shorts and their higher priced Casual Thicker Shorts, here’s the real scoop from someone who lives out of a suitcase:The Hybrid Workout Shorts are your go-to for almost anything. They’re lightweight, slightly tapered at the back for a clean look, and so versatile I wear them everywhere—from the gym to the grocery store. They pack so small, you can take several pairs without sacrificing space.However, the Casual Thicker Shorts, while incredibly comfortable and slightly more polished in appearance, have a downside. They’re bulkier, making them less ideal for a tightly packed bag. Plus, I found a slight inconsistency with one pair where the pocket didn’t sit flush against the hips, which could be annoying.Bottom line: For the active traveler or anyone with limited packing space, the Hybrid Shorts are a no-brainer. They’re multifunctional and efficient. Choose the Casual Shorts if you’re not pressed for space and prioritize comfort over convenience. Always check the fit right out of the box, especially around the pockets.

reviewText: Ladies and gentlemen, gather 'round, because I'm here to talk about the Signature by Levi Strauss & Co Men's Slim Fit Jeans, size 30x30. Now, let me be clear—I'm no fashion guru. But when I slipped into these jeans, I felt like I'd unlocked a secret level of coolness I didn't know existed.**Slim, Not 'Suffocate Your Legs' Fit:** I'll admit, I was a bit skeptical about slim fit jeans. I mean, aren't they supposed to be for runway models? But surprise! These jeans are more like slim but still let your legs breathe fit. I can actually bend, squat, and even dance without feeling like I'm in a denim straightjacket.**Ladies Love 'Em (and So Do I):** I've gotta say, these jeans are like catnip for the ladies. I've had more compliments about my legs in these jeans than in my entire life. It's like I've unlocked the secret to attracting admirers, and it involves denim. Who knew?**Durable as a Tank:** Despite my newfound ninja moves, these jeans are tough as nails. I've worn them on hiking adventures, casual Fridays, and even a surprise dance-off (long story). They still look as good as the day I got them. It's like having indestructible leg armor.**They Make You Look Taller:** I don't know if it's the magic of Levi's, but these jeans make me look taller. I mean, who wouldn't want a few extra inches without wearing heels? It's like an optical illusion for your legs.**Versatile as a Swiss Army Knife:** These jeans go with everything. I've paired them with t-shirts, dress shirts, and even a Hawaiian shirt once (don't judge). They're like the chameleon of my wardrobe, always fitting right in.In conclusion, if you're a guy like me who's always been on the fence about slim fit jeans, do yourself a favor and give these Signature by Levi Strauss & Co Men's Slim Fit Jeans a shot. They're slim, stylish, and surprisingly comfy. They make you look good and feel even better. I've become a denim convert, and I'm never looking back. Trust me; these jeans are the real deal!

reviewText: When you're short it can be very difficult to find pants with an appropriate inseam. You either have to resign yourself to cuffing your pants a few times or invest in a tailor. Big and tall men have a lot of options for clothing nowadays, but if you wear less than a 30 in inseam (and more than a 30 in waist) you're just out of luck. I love that these jeans are from a reputable brand and actually offer a 28 in inseam option! I will be buying several more pairs in the future and also going to Lee for my work slacks. I will say the waist is a LITTLE bit tight compared to other 32 in waist jeans I own, and they're not the most flexible, otherwise this would be easy five stars.

reviewText: Recently, I was officially diagnosed with plantar fasciitis while also being diagnosed with Tarsal tunnel syndrome, oh and my great toe started hurting. Both feet. Ugh! some of the worse foot pain out there.Three things: 1) I went up a half size because EVERYTHING about both my feet were hurting.2)I have soooo many sneakers/ clogs/ shoes for work at between $100 to $180 apiece, it gives privileged, overindulgent to the uninformed: The reality is that I kept buying different shoes seeking to relieve the pain of feeling like Ive been standing on nails.3) I finally decided on Try before you buy tried and eventually bought these on the advice of my foot and ankle specialist. Best decision.For the first time in the last two or more years  I've worn the same shoe to work for two weeks. (I work three to four 12hr shifts/week.)Here's why, I like a soft padded foot bed, particularly at my heels. These are abundantly padded.  HOWEVER; foot specialist, and Physical therapist informed me that plantar fasciitis needs a firm foot bed with adequate arch support for relief.  Uhmmmm!!! But how's this for plot twist: My podiatrist ordered me custom inserts, five weeks later they arrive, and they are FIRM! he fits them OVER the inserts of these sneakers and voilà! I now have my plush padded foot bed, good ankle support while the shoe is deep enough to accept a custom insert without unnatural pressure at the arch, toe box, top or ball of foot. In fact I do NOT feel the inserts at all.  I think my decision to go up half size may have helped the insert fit. Shoes still are bigger but does not feel loose or unstable. These are breathable and stylish even for my sz 11 feet AND I went up a half size.  Great shoe. I also think they're hand washable.

reviewText: These shoes are an absolute game-changer for anyone who spends a lot of time on their feet. As someone who works in a busy restaurant, I needed a shoe that could provide both comfort and support for long shifts, and the Skechers Men's Nampa Groton delivers in spades.Here's what I love about them: * Comfort: The memory foam insole is like walking on clouds. It molds to your feet and provides incredible cushioning, even after hours of wear. I no longer dread the end of my shift with aching feet. * Support: Despite the plush insole, these shoes offer excellent support. My feet feel secure and stable, which is crucial when navigating a slippery kitchen floor. * Slip-Resistance: Speaking of slippery floors, the slip-resistant outsole is a lifesaver. I've never felt more confident moving around, even with spills and grease. * Durability: I've been wearing these shoes for several months now, and they still look and feel great. The synthetic leather upper is easy to clean and shows no signs of wear and tear. * Style: Let's be honest, nobody wants to wear clunky work shoes. The Nampa Groton has a sleek, sporty design that looks good both on and off the job.Overall:I can't recommend the Skechers Men's Nampa Groton enough. They're comfortable, supportive, slip-resistant, and stylish â€“ everything you could want in a work shoe. If you're on your feet all day, do yourself a favor and invest in a pair. Your feet will thank you!Additional Notes: * I found the sizing to be accurate. * The shoes are lightweight and breathable. * They're easy to slip on and off, which is convenient for busy days. * I've received several compliments on their appearance.In short, these shoes are a winner!

reviewText: The Gildan Men's Heavy Cotton T-Shirt has become a wardrobe staple for me, and its consistent comfort, durability, and versatile design make it a reliable choice for various occasions. This classic tee from Gildan effortlessly combines affordability with quality, creating a go-to option for everyday wear.One of the standout features of the Gildan Heavy Cotton T-Shirt is its fabric. The 100% cotton material feels soft against the skin, providing a comfortable and breathable experience throughout the day. The heavyweight cotton adds a sense of durability without compromising on the shirt's overall comfort, making it suitable for year-round wear.The fit of the Gildan Heavy Cotton T-Shirt is another notable strength. The shirt offers a generous and relaxed fit without appearing overly baggy. The seamless integration of shoulder-to-shoulder taping enhances the overall structure and ensures that the shirt maintains its shape even after multiple washes. The crew neckline and sleeves are designed for comfort and flexibility, adding to the shirt's easy wearability.Durability is a key aspect of the Gildan Heavy Cotton T-Shirt. The sturdy construction of the fabric, coupled with double-needle stitching on the sleeves and bottom hem, contributes to the shirt's longevity. I've found that it holds up well to regular washing and maintains its color and shape over time, making it a cost-effective investment in my wardrobe.Versatility is a strong suit of the Gildan Heavy Cotton T-Shirt. Whether worn on its own for a casual look or layered under a jacket or hoodie, this tee seamlessly adapts to various styles and occasions. The wide range of available colors ensures that there's a Gildan tee to suit every taste and wardrobe preference.The affordability of the Gildan Heavy Cotton T-Shirt makes it an attractive choice for those looking to build a versatile collection of basics without breaking the bank. The quality of the shirt, especially considering its budget-friendly price, positions it as a reliable and accessible option for individuals and organizations alike.The wide availability of sizes ensures that the Gildan Heavy Cotton T-Shirt accommodates diverse body types, making it an inclusive choice for a broad range of consumers. The comprehensive size range contributes to the shirt's popularity and accessibility for individuals of all shapes and sizes.In conclusion, the Gildan Men's Heavy Cotton T-Shirt has earned its place as a trusted and timeless wardrobe essential. Its comfort, durability, and affordability make it a reliable choice for everyday wear. Whether you're dressing casually, working out, or customizing for events, the Gildan Heavy Cotton T-Shirt delivers on its promise of comfort and style, making it a reliable and practical addition to any wardrobe.
