reviewText: Not enough people put their body dimensions on here to make sizing an unseen/unknown shirt easy.I'm a guy - so I don't care if you know my specs - here they are:6' 5" tall310 lbs23" technical torso measurement (back of neck to waist line)21" armpit to waist line54" chest18" pythons (biceps for you skinny hipsters)Usually I buy shirts in 2 XL, 2 XLT, or 3X.Normally I buy shirts with the "tall" designation since my gut sticking out typically makes a "non-tall" shirt rise just to the point of showing skin when I lean back or reach up with my arm(s). No one wants to see that - unless that is your "thing"I went with the 2XLT version of this as a baseline.Results:100% cotton shrinks even if it "preshrunk." Pre-shrunk does not shrink as much, but there is a noticeable shrink none the less.New from package w/ no wash - length was fine - fit was snug, but not too much to show off the moobs or gut too badly.First wash - length still fine - fit was too tight - moobs and gut sticking out like an over packed sausage - not flattering.-You can pull the shirts to stretch it out to be less form fitting, but I don't want to mess with that after every wash.Returned both 2 XLT's and went with a 3X regular length.3X reg length is good enough (unless reaching with arms up as far as I can) - fit is quite loose on the moobs and gut (read comfortable and flattering), but not to tent proportions.Shirt really is heavyweight and I love it. Can't see through it and looks like it will last a while, just like most Dickies items do!Pocket is a touch too tight/small for my Galaxy S5 with case since they seamed in a dedicated pen/pencil pouch inside the total front pocket dimensions. As is, it is good enough to hold a couple pens or something along the size of a deck of cards.Ask your grandma, mother, or wife for a seam ripper to remove the Dickies tag on the front pocket. If they are good with the stitch, ask them to rip out the dedicated pen/pencil pouch and the pocket becomes big enough for a smart phone.I used to buy Fruit of the Loom Men's Short Sleeved Pocket T-Shirt from both the Normal and Best collections since they used to be available locally in a "mart" store. That Wal place doesn't carry the front pocket shirt in my sizes anymore so I found them here on Amazon. FotL changed their material/construction practices with this shirt recently and they are bad quality, even at $5-$8 a pop.  They lasted me about 6 months of 1-2x/week use and one weekly washing before fabric was worn thin and piling badly.  They are now dedicated "I don't care what happens to them work shirts"I am a fan of Dickies items and I would say that these shirts display overall good quality and with some modifications done at home I would highly recommend them.

reviewText: We purchased several packs of these onesies for our newborn, and indeed, onesies proved to be the go-to outfit for hanging out at home and for layering when we go out.  They are easy to put on and take off and they snap securely at the bottom.Some positives about these Gerber onesies:1) They are solidly made.  So far we have not had any rip or tear.  Admittedly our infant isn't playing rugby in them, but in the course of everyday wear they are holding up admirably.2) The three snaps at the bottom are secure but not so tight that they are difficult to fasten.3) The "lap shoulder neckline" (i.e. overlapping fabric on either side of the neck) make it relatively easy to slip over your baby's head.4) The white cotton is slightly transparent, which makes it easy to see the blue indicator line on diapers with the color-change feature.  ("Honey, we have a blue stripe situation here!")5) They are very reasonably priced.A few things to know:1) Being cotton, these do shrink a bit.  No big surprise there.2) The Gerber onesies seem to run a bit small, at least in comparison with several other brands we have used.  Our baby was 8 1/2 lbs at birth and 21 inches long, and she basically skipped the 0-3 month size.  At 10 weeks of age she was ready for the 6-9 month size.  Admittedly she was near the top of the weight and length charts, but I confirmed with other parents that the Gerber onesies do run a bit small.  Not a problem as long as you're aware of it!

reviewText: I purchased two of these “Midi” dresses~~one in light blue and one in green. The colors were so absolutely gorgeous in the pictures and on the models, and I was looking so forward to receiving them in a MIDI size that would not be too long on me!!! The models in the pictures wearing “this” dress have the bottom of their legs showing, as though these truly are MIDI size in length!!! However, THESE DRESSES GO TO THE FLOOR ON ME!!! There is no possible way I could wear them even if I wanted to!!! I also DO NOT WANT TO WEAR THEM SINCE THE COLORS ARE NOT AT ALL AS PICTURED!!! They are dull and boring and just look “BLAH!!!” I had ordered a green one last year from a different vendor and the color did not arrive as pictured in that one either, but I thought I would keep it because it at least looks like it could appear as green. I deeply regret keeping that one also!!! The dresses are WAY TOO LONG and THE COLORS ARE WAY TOO DRAB AND UGLY!!! I love the pattern on the dresses and I love how the sleeves and the bottom ruffle are sheer with the pattern still covering them, but these dresses just do not live up to the pictures at all!!! I am SO ABSOLUTELY DISAPPOINTED IN THESE DRESSES!!! I returned them both!!! This is false advertising when they show the beautiful colors of the dresses on the screen, but the pictures IRL are almost colorless!!! They are also describing these dresses as “MIDI” length, and you can see the models’ legs at the bottom of the dress, BUT THEY DO NOT MATCH THE COLORS OR THE DESCRIPTIONS OF EITHER!!! Don’t waste your money~~you’ll have to return them anyway. Also, if you’re like me, I feel so disappointed to have found these gorgeous dresses yet find the real thing nothing like it was described and pictured!!! So sad!!!

reviewText: The basic fit is similar to basic white FTL cotton briefs.  So if those fit, these should be the same in terms of fit and comfort.I've had them for a couple of years and have been able to see the durability.  The first thing that's noticeable is that the FRUIT OF THE LOOM printing (light grey over charcoal grey) around the waistband will start fading.  Definitely faster if it's machine washed.  The tagless washing instructions are printed on the cotton, and may be difficult to read and will likely be unreadable after multiple washings.  After a while some of the elastic material starting breaking and popping out through the band, especially at the edge of the band but sometimes in the middle.  That's probably just normal wear for any underwear, but these seemed to wear rather fast.  I can't feel them anyways and however much elastic is broken isn't enough to affect the fit.The inside of the band is soft/fuzzy and comfortable, but after enough washings it will start to pill up.  Not a huge deal.  The blue colors will fade (like a dark cotton T-shirt) after enough washings, but that's normal for dark colored cotton.I like them enough (and it looks like the design/materials haven't changed since my last package) that I bought another pack.  So despite all the problems I like these enough to buy them again.

reviewText: Nautica Men's Short Sleeve Solid Stretch Cotton Pique Polo Shirt in Bright Cobalt.  Nautica is one of my go-to brands, because I generally like their materials, look, and fit.  I have not come across the material that this polo is made out of before.  The material is a stretch material, and it stretches pretty easily with movement, in a good way.  The material seems decent.  It's not too thin, and I like the stretchiness to it for movement.  The color is true to the image.  The one issue I am running into is the shoulders are very boxy.  Where the top shoulder stitching is it steaks straight out left and right, so it gives it this very boxy squared off look that is not good.  I don't know if it is because the shirt is new and has not been work or washed, but I might return it because of it.  As far as cut, I would say the body of this shirt is about a modern cut, so in between a traditional cut and a slim cut.  The shoulders, arms, and upper chest area are traditional in fit.  The jury is out on this as to if I want to take the risk to see if the shoulders round off or stay boxy.

reviewText: I was conflicted between the small and medium size, but I took a chance on the small, even know I normally wear mediums in hoodies and other jackets.I based my size off of a Wrangler work jacket I recieved last year for Christmas that was a size medium. Unfortunately, that jacket was a bit too big, for the sleeves went far past my wrists and the shoulder seams went too far past the end of my shoulder. It felt too bulky as well.So for this Carharrt I took a chance on the size small and didn't regret it. It fit perfect; the shoulder seams lined up and the sleeves covered my wrists perfectly. The length was good as well without it extending too low below my hips. I was even able to wear my favorite hoodie underneath it without the jacket feeling constrained and arm movement still feeling spacious.Keep in mind I have a relatively small frame, anyway so your mileage may vary.I asked my dad to try the jacket on, who is an inch shorter than me and has a more athletic build with slightly bigger shoulders, and it fit him perfect as well.The jacket itself feels high quality and will definitely hold up to some wear and the sherpa will definitely keep you warm. It's now probably the best jacket I've ever owned with plenty of pockets and a lightweight feel to the overall coat.Highly recommend if your considering it, for it is a solid alternative if the Detroit jacket lacks too little features for you.

reviewText: I recently picked up a pair of these shorts, and they have quickly become my favorite go-to shorts for any occasion. From the very first wear, I could tell that these shorts were designed with both comfort and practicality in mind. The fit is perfect, thanks to the stretch fabric that moves with you rather than against you, making these shorts ideal for all-day wear.One of the standout features of these cargo shorts is the material. The fabric blend provides just the right amount of stretch, allowing for a comfortable fit without feeling restrictive. Whether I'm out for a hike, running errands, or just lounging around, these shorts offer incredible flexibility and comfort. The material is also durable and stands up well to frequent washing without losing its shape or color.The design of the Wrangler Authentics Men's Classic Cargo Stretch Shorts is both functional and stylish. The multiple pockets are a game-changer, offering ample storage space for my essentials. The cargo pockets are spacious and easily hold my phone, wallet, keys, and even a small notebook. The added convenience of having secure places to store my items without needing a bag is fantastic, especially when I'm on the go.The craftsmanship of these shorts is top-notch. The stitching is strong and sturdy, ensuring that the shorts will last for years to come. The zipper and button closures are robust and reliable, adding to the overall quality of the product. The classic cargo style is timeless and versatile, making these shorts easy to pair with a variety of tops and footwear for different looks.One aspect I particularly appreciate is the attention to detail in the design. The waistband is comfortable and sits just right, without digging in or slipping down. The length of the shorts is perfect, hitting just above the knee, which gives a modern yet classic look. The color options are also great, allowing me to choose a shade that fits my personal style.These shorts have exceeded my expectations in every way. reviewText: I am not exactly what one would call an In Shape human. I'm a big guy, husky, and at age 45 finding a pair of pants that both stays up and doesn't feel like I'm wearing spandex or a parachute is quite the task, let me tell you. And I have tried A LOT of pants on here over the past couple of years.This right here is the clear winner. Hands down. 40-30's fit me like a glove. I've been at work for 10 hours and just now noticed as I was getting close to leaving this morning that I had forgotten to wear my belt. Never noticed at all. Normally I don't go anywhere without it or my super sexy dad bod that is somewhat shaped like a turnip these days would push them to my knees within ten steps. I even wear suspenders sometimes because I detest holding/pulling my pants up we I walk around.The pants themselves are very good quality. Excellent material that seems much more durable than any other pair I have tried on Amazon. They feel like they're double layers of fabric instead of a flimsy single layer. Good quality belt loops and the waistband is stretchy, they feel like they're meant to last. I ordered a pair of similar wranglers at the same time as these bad boys and while the wranglers fit, the quality feels cheap and thin. Considering the wranglers were WAY more expensive, it's a no brainer. Wranglers are going back, these stay and I'm ordering more of them right now. Hopefully they don't jack the price up after my good review lol. If you're looking for some new duds to wrap those sexy dad bod stems of yours in, and you're on the fence about which ones to get, this one is your best bet I assure you. For the love of God don't buy the Amazon essentials one, I've run through 8 pairs of them in the past two months, they're made of paper or something that just rips off belt loops, pockets, and everything else after you wear them to work a few times.

reviewText: Thin, inexpensive, but well-cut men's undershirts. They don't have the technical fabric or closer fit of the Under Armour or Calvin Klein.. But the price is much lower per shirt, and the insubstantial, non-clingy fabric is light enough to forget you're wearing that layer.I was looking for new, basic black shirts after my usual suppliers had grown unreliable-- something that would look good under a button-down shirt or sweater, wouldn't add bulk, wasn't super expensive, was long enough to tuck but not too long  so I could still wear it out, and wouldn't look bad if worn by itself.  I also tried the Calvin Klein Men's Undershirts Cotton Stretch and the Under Armour Men's Cotton Stretch Crew Undershirt:* This Amazon Essentials is the most under-shirt of the bunch. The thin fabric doesn't hide much. The sleeves are loose rather than fitted, and slightly longer than the other two. The L doesn't cling on the shoulders or back. It feels like a thin version of a normal tee-shirt cut. The sleeves are a bit bulky under another shirt.* The CK is a stretch fabric (which usually wears better over time than plain cotton), but not too fitted. The material is thick enough to wear comfortably as a tee. It has a really nice roll collar (a folded/stitched collar rather than a flat one-- rolled ones don't get messed up as quickly by repeated wash/wear cycles). There's a white CK tag on the hem that stands out a bit too much if you wear it untucked. The CK is the most expensive of the three.* The UA is the most fitted of the bunch, with the shortest sleeves-- it'll be easiest to wear comfortably under another tight layer. The stretchy material is good quality and like the CK could be worn by itself, although its clinginess requires a reasonably athletic build in that case.I tried size L in all cases. All three brands break at the right spot (hip) to be tuckable for most heights. I like the Amazon Essentials the least of the bunch since I don't like to fiddle to get my under sleeves to sit right, but it's going to be the most familiar fit for people who regularly wear undershirts. It's also the cheapest.Like Amazon's other house brands, Essentials is a good choice for can't decide between brands, providing value without having to spend too much time comparison shopping.This shirt is a little too under-shirty for the wear by itself category, but otherwise works well. Recommended if you want a basic, standard-fit undershirt.

reviewText: The adidas Boys' Big Active Sports Athletic Tricot Jogger Pant is a fantastic addition to any young athlete's wardrobe. Here's why I highly recommend this versatile and comfortable athletic wear:Superior Comfort:One of the standout features of these jogger pants is their exceptional comfort. Crafted from high-quality tricot fabric, they offer a soft and cozy feel against the skin, ensuring maximum comfort during sports activities or casual wear. The elastic waistband and adjustable drawstring provide a secure and personalized fit, allowing for unrestricted movement and flexibility.Durable and Long-Lasting:Built to withstand the demands of active lifestyles, the adidas Boys' Tricot Jogger Pant is incredibly durable and long-lasting. The sturdy construction and quality stitching ensure that these pants hold up well to frequent washing and wear, maintaining their shape and color over time. Whether worn on the soccer field, basketball court, or playground, these pants are up to the challenge.Versatile Style:With their sleek design and iconic adidas branding, these jogger pants offer a versatile style that transitions seamlessly from sports practice to everyday wear. The classic jogger silhouette and tapered legs provide a modern and athletic look, while the signature adidas 3-Stripes down the sides add a touch of sporty flair. Available in a range of colors, there's an option to suit every boy's personal style.Functional Design:The adidas Boys' Tricot Jogger Pant features practical design elements that enhance their functionality. The side pockets offer convenient storage for small essentials like keys or coins, while the ribbed cuffs ensure a secure fit around the ankles, preventing the pants from riding up during activity. Additionally, the breathable fabric helps regulate temperature, keeping young athletes cool and comfortable.Great Value:Considering their comfort, durability, style, and functionality, these jogger pants offer excellent value for money. As a parent, I appreciate investing in quality athletic wear that not only looks great but also stands the test of time, ensuring long-term wear and enjoyment for my child.In conclusion, the adidas Boys' Big Active Sports Athletic Tricot Jogger Pant is a top-notch choice for young athletes seeking comfortable and stylish athletic wear. With their superior comfort, durability, versatile style, functional design, and great value, these jogger pants are sure to become a favorite in any boy's wardrobe. I highly recommend them to parents looking for high-quality activewear for their active kids.

reviewText: These Polos are a bit light for my taste—preferring heavier weight materials that wick moisture away from the body during hot & humid days—but they are nicely designed and well crafted. As a professional pilot, I find that a shoulder pocket for pen & pencil comes in handy, but I’m inclined to think this shirt’s pockets may be too short for many writing instruments.The Polo are cut somewhat small. I invariably wear Medium shirts, but found this brand a little smaller than expected; fitting more like a body shirt. My advice to buyers is select a size bigger that usually purchased and you’ll probably be pleasantly surprised.

reviewText: Having recently acquired the Adidas Men's Hoops 3.0 Mid Top Sneakers, I am thoroughly impressed with the combination of style, comfort, and performance that these shoes bring to the table. Adidas has once again delivered a product that not only meets but exceeds expectations.First and foremost, the design of the Hoops 3.0 Mid Top Sneakers is striking. The mid-top silhouette not only adds a fashionable edge but also provides excellent ankle support. The iconic three stripes and the Adidas logo contribute to a sporty and timeless aesthetic, making these sneakers versatile enough for both athletic activities and casual wear.Comfort is a standout feature of these sneakers. The padded collar and tongue, coupled with a cushioned insole, deliver a plush feel during every step. Whether I'm walking for an extended period or engaging in more rigorous activities, the shoes provide ample support and alleviate pressure points, ensuring a comfortable wearing experience.In terms of performance, the Hoops 3.0 Mid Top Sneakers don't disappoint. The rubber outsole offers excellent traction on various surfaces, providing a secure grip. This is particularly noteworthy for those who engage in basketball or other sports where quick movements are essential. The durability of the outsole also ensures a longer lifespan for the shoes, making them a reliable choice for athletic pursuits.Breathability is another positive aspect. The upper material allows sufficient airflow, preventing excessive heat and moisture build-up inside the shoes. This is especially appreciated during more intense activities, as it contributes to overall foot comfort.The fit of the Adidas Hoops 3.0 Mid Top Sneakers is true to size, and the lace-up closure allows for a customizable and secure fit. The shoes provide ample toe room without feeling overly spacious, striking a good balance between comfort and support.As for value for money, these sneakers offer a compelling package. The combination of quality materials, stylish design, and performance capabilities make them a worthwhile investment for anyone in need of reliable athletic footwear with a touch of urban flair.In conclusion, the Adidas Men's Hoops 3.0 Mid Top Sneakers are a commendable addition to the brand's lineup. Whether you're hitting the court or just looking for a stylish and comfortable everyday shoe, these sneakers deliver on multiple fronts. With their impressive design, comfort features, and performance capabilities, they stand out as a solid choice for individuals seeking a well-rounded athletic and casual footwear option.

reviewText: I was a bit skeptical to get these because of the mixed reviews, but I'm glad I did. The black is a true dark black and the material is incredibly forgiving. They are surprisingly long on me, but I prefer that. They are advertised as mid-waisted straight leg jeans, but they look like high-waisted wide leg jeans with a slight flare/bootcut on me. Based on other reviews, I think the jean style depends heavily on your body type.I'm 5'6, ~180 lbs, and typically a 10/12 in most brands. According to the size chart, I am a 14 so I ordered that. Perfect fit, albeit a bit long. The button and zipper are definitely on the flimsier/cheaper side, but we'll see how they hold up. No crazy smell when I opened them; they smelled like regular new factory fresh clothing (if that makes any sense).

reviewText: While these are labeled as workout shirts I think perhaps they are a bit dressy for that, in fact they are quite a bit dressier than my usual pick of all cotton tee shirt, the brand that has tens of thousands of reviews here. These aren’t quite as popular but they should be, they are better made and about the same price per shirt if you buy the multipacks with five shirts in them. And the biggest thing they have going for them is the incredible choice of colors, although I would suggest to them that they should try to stay away from including so many of the dull dark colors, today’s active man doesn’t dress like his grandfather, bright colors are very popular now.The material isn’t like most casual tee shirts, it is a shiny slick manmade material that on close inspection looks like it is knit like a very thin sweater.WHAT I LIKETopping the list of likes are the great bright colors that stay bright wash after wash. They don’t shrink either and they are true to U.S. men’s sizes.  That makes them easy to buy.  They feel great and don’t show wrinkles.NOT SO POSITIVEThere is nothing that I dislike about these but there are a few things you should know. One is that they are fairly thin. That coupled with the shiny texture makes them reveal everything including the nips. They also look too expensive and dressy to wear casually around the house, like mowing the lawn for example. Like I said, not a negative just something to be aware of. If you live in a hot climate as I do these are absolutely wonderfully cool and lightweight feeling.YES OR NOAfter getting ready to order my usual brand and being disappointed that their shades are so boring I searched and was amazed how many choices there were. I landed on these because of the huge range of colors available. Once I saw the price (especially for the multi-paks) I was hooked. These are one of the best values around.

reviewText: Super nice jacket.  For me, it's very warm, and yet keeps you cool as well.  I'm always cold, and generally wear a hooded sweatshirt under my jacket.  With this one, I've not needed one.  We'll see when we get some sub-freezing temperatures again, as I'm in California, and the lows have been mostly mid to higher 30s lately in my area.  I'm pretty sure it will be fine as the bottom stays snug against you, keeping the drafts out.  The sleeves do as well, and I love that the canvas extends below the cuff, hiding it.  The hood is nice and large, drawstring will tighten it to the point it looks like a ski mask, and when zipped up fully, the neckline is nice and snug.  Ample pocket space, but can't use the outer pockets for a cellphone without it standing, risking it falling out.  Inside pockets are zippered on the left and velcro patch in middle of right.  Left can close with my s24+ inside, but in right pocket, it fits, but blocks the velcro.  Small details in my opinion, but may matter to some.  As for the zipper, it's metal(looks like brass), and feels like it's robust enough that it will last the life of the jacket.  Overall, excellent quality as always.

reviewText: Oh my goodness, these pants remind me of my dad.  I'm retired but clearly remember my father wearing similar pants.  I'm judging these pants against the ones my dad wore, which (I'm sure) were 100% wool.  These are a polyester blend, so they don't have quite the same quality look and it is unlikely that they will hold up as well as his, which he seemed to wear for many years.  However, the style is similar.  Also, these are reasonably priced.In my mind they look very retro and masculine.  However, I showed them to my daughter, who thought they looked more feminine.  Why?  A fashion trend in women's pants is the front pleat that was the hallmark of men's pants in the 50s and 60s!  Funny how fashion trends work.  Anyway, I like these pants.  I think I'll wear them with a white shirt... hmmm, I wonder if I have any suspenders in my closet!

reviewText: UPDATE 9/2023: I finally had to wash these, and was sad to find that they do shrink in the wash. So the 30 inch length that was perfect for me before washing is now too short. They're also less soft now that I've washed them. I will order a new pair in the 32 length and try to get the length tailored since they aren't offered in a 31 inch length.Seriously, finding jeans like these is like finding the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow. It's virtually impossible, so it feels almost miraculous when it does happen.I have decently large thighs (from cycling and other things), and calves, and a decent size rear. Most men's jeans are too straight, so they're too tight across the thighs (showing pocket lines and underwear lines), or too saggy in the butt, or the legs are just plain too tight, or they're too baggy and look messy.I'm a tall, muscular guy with a decently athletic build. I don't claim to be a model or anything, but pants shouldn't look as sloppy on me as they tend to. I shouldn't have to pick between pants that fit like skinny jeans and pants that make me look like I have absolutely no sense of fashion (i.e. the infamous baggy, shapeless, dad jean fit). I see tall, muscular guys in movies and tv shows that have great fitting jeans that complement their muscular builds without looking like skinny jeans, and I think to myself people love this look, so why can't I find that pants that fit like that?It turns out, pants like that do exist. These Levi's 541 Athletic Fit pants in the Native Cali color fit, feel, and look amazing. They're beautifully manly pants, without being too cowboy or too hip. They're very neutral, allow you to wear them with leather dress shoes, boots, or sneakers, without looking too weird.The fit around the hips/but is great, with enough room for them to sit where you want them to (not low-cut skinny jeans or saggy hipster jeans), so you shouldn't have issues with plumber's crack, as long as you get the right fit and wear a belt.The fit around the thighs is also great. Depending on what size you order, they have enough room that they don't show pocket lines or underwear lines, and unlike many pants, they're actually cut in such a way that if the pants fit well at the waist, the thighs aren't too tight. These come in 1 inch sizes, you can experiment to find the right fit for you. I find that both the 36 and the 35 waist fit me well. The 35 I do fold up the pockets to avoid pocket lines, and that size gives me more of a custom-made for me look. The 36 has a little more room, so the lines aren't an issue so far, but they aren't quite so fitted, but they also aren't straying into dad-jean territory.I also love that even though they have extra room in the seat and thighs, they aren't too tight in the calves, OR too wide and shapeless at the ankle. As I mentioned, my legs are different widths at the thigh, knees, calves, AND ankles, so finding jeans that fit ok in all places is incredible. The fit being right at the ankles makes for a nice modern look that can work with a variety of footwear. If the ankles were wider, they would splay out at the show and give more a bootcut or dad-jean look that doesn't look good with sneakers or other snappy fits.The one downside is that the length varies. I had to buy two pairs of the same length to find one that fit right. The other pair was slightly too short.I haven't washed these yet, and I'm reluctant to do so until I really have to. It's possible that doing so will change my rating. But right now, they fit perfectly, and the color is so black that I can wear these with a formal black vest and a button down and it looks great. I'm sure the dye will fade over time the more I wear these, and then they'll become more casual-wear jeans. But for now I love these just the way they are.

reviewText: I have yet to wear these out, but from initial trials they seem comfortable and have plenty of toe room, and even though not a wide size, they accommodate my orthotic and don't bind in areas where I'm developing age-related foot issues.  They are more stylish than a normal athletic shoe while having the comfort of one. A couple drawbacks I'll learn to live with: This style, in a longer size, really exaggerates how long they look on the foot. It would help if they had some vertical details/stitching along the upper part to break that long plane from laces to toe. I am a woman who must often go to men's shoes to get the length I need, and while many styles are interchangeable with a woman's version; this one, because of that long stretch of uninterrupted fabric does make me self-conscious about how big my foot looks. The other issue for me is the bright white sole. It is difficult to find a comfortable shoe with a coordinating sole color. The white looks OK on this and keeps them from becoming too oxford-like, but I fear the white will soon be stained by the elements. I bought these to look a little more dressy with dress slacks, and since I can no longer wear leather uppers, these will be fine, and the length should seem less dramatic once there's a pant's cuff. breaking up the total length.  I purchased these for the reasonable price on a shoe I won't wear often. I think they will prove to be exactly what I need: a more dressy looking shoe with the comfort of a sneaker.

reviewText: Both the undies and socks are packaged (and sub packaged) so that you can chuck them in some luggage or squeeze in a spare corner of your laptop carry on and go.The briefs are made of thicker (tho not heavy) fabric than expected.  They are lightweight enough to sink laundered, in a pinch. There is no fly, but there is an extra panel for the Y front, as well as a good width for the crotch area so your business is appropriately supported. (I’ve ordered sets that are unwearable by many men— a larger women’s panty relabeled .)The socks are fine. If you will be walking a lot, double up to prevent blisters. The fabric doesn’t seem quite as robust.Both the socks and underwear, while “disposable” seem as if they might survive one or two rounds of conventional laundry.Recommended.

reviewText: I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase of the Nike Men's Gymnastics Shoes Slipper. As someone who works tirelessly at a no-kill animal shelter, I cover anywhere from 7 to 10 miles on my feet each day. These shoes have been an absolute game-changer for me.First and foremost, the comfort level is outstanding. I used to experience foot fatigue and discomfort after long hours of walking and standing, but these slipper-like shoes have made all the difference. They provide ample cushioning and support, allowing me to keep going without the constant ache and soreness I used to feel.Not only are they comfortable, but they're also incredibly lightweight, which makes my daily tasks at the shelter even more manageable. I no longer feel weighed down by heavy footwear, and that's a significant relief.The durability of these shoes is also commendable. Given the rigorous demands of my job, I was concerned about wear and tear, but they've held up remarkably well. I can confidently say that they are up to the challenge of my daily routine.In summary, the Nike Men's Gymnastics Shoes Slipper has been a true lifesaver for my feet. I'm no longer plagued by discomfort and fatigue, allowing me to focus on my important work at the animal shelter. reviewText: Edit to add: These do have horrible traction in wet/snow.  Use extreme caution on wet floors, and just don't wear if it's snowy/icy.  I'm removing 1 star for that, because I had to get a different pair of shoes for bad weather.  (Telluride Moc, which are better for traction, but not as comfortable.)  That said, I'm on my 3rd pair of these, and for regular office work, they're great.Original:Why did I not buy these sooner?TL;DR: Great shoes.  Fit big feet.  Comfortable.  Don't feel like clogs/slippers.I am someone who values my time and..... oh hell... I'm lazy.  I slip my shoes off by holding down the heel with the other foot, and put them on before leaving for work by sticking my foot back in.  As such, I tend to destroy the heels of all my shoes.(I'm a computer tech, so I mostly wear sneakers or "casual" shoes)For years I'd thought about getting these sort of shoes, and for years I'd held off because I have huge feet (15) and usually only new balance fit my foot correctly without a break-in period.I can now say there's an exception to that rule.  I got the 14s of these the first time around, because people said they ran big.  Not so.  14 was too small, so I went to 15, and they're perfect.  They also have arch support that at first felt weird, but now feels like something I don't know how I lived without.  They have also felt like a broken-in pair since the first (maybe second) day I wore them.If I have any complaint, it's that they pick up a TON of sand/salt/ice/snow in the tread and keep dropping it for a good half hour once you get to your destination in winter.  At home I take off my shoes at the door, but I notice it at work when my chair is crunching over sand from the parking lot.Most importantly, however, I've been wearing these for a couple weeks now, all day, every day, and they still slip on and off with ease, but don't feel floppy on my feet when I'm walking over weird terrain.  If I had any wish, I guess it'd be that they make a pair with mesh in the toe area.  They do get a little warm at times, but I don't see an easy way to do that with the design.Overall.... well, I guess the fact that I'm planning to buy a second pair speaks for itself.

reviewText: Let’s be real, finding the perfect pair of underwear is like finding a unicorn – it doesn’t happen every day. But Gildan Men’s Underwear Covered Waistband Boxer Briefs? Oh, they’re basically the unicorns of the underwear world. These bad boys fit like a glove, stay put, and make you feel like you’ve just discovered a hidden level of comfort.Pros: • Comfortable Fit: These boxer briefs hug you in all the right places. The soft, breathable fabric makes you feel like you’re wearing nothing at all, except, y’know, you are wearing something, and it’s perfect. No wedgies or uncomfortable bunching, just smooth sailing all day long. • Covered Waistband: The waistband feels like it’s been made for royalty. It’s covered in a soft fabric, so you won’t be feeling like you’re wearing an elastic band that’s constantly trying to cut off circulation. It’s like a cozy hug for your waist, without the awkward side hug vibes. • Multipack = Win: You’re getting multiple pairs of boxer briefs, which means you’re set for a while. No more laundry-day panic when you’re down to your last pair. Plus, the price is so reasonable, you’ll feel like you’re stealing them (but don’t, because that’s not cool). • Durable: These boxer briefs aren’t just comfortable; they’re built to last. Whether you’re throwing them in the laundry after a gym session or lounging on the couch all day (hey, we’ve all been there), they hold up and keep their shape. No sagging or stretching after a few washes, these briefs stick around for the long haul.Cons: • Basic Design: While they’re perfect in functionality, the design isn’t anything flashy. If you’re looking for some fun prints or neon colors to show off, you’ll have to look elsewhere. These are the dependable, no-nonsense kind of underwear, kind of like that reliable friend who brings the chips to the party, not the dip. • May Feel a Little Tight Initially: These are snug, which is great, but if you’re used to a looser fit, you might need a day or two to adjust. But don’t worry, once you break them in, they’ll feel like they’ve been custom-made for you.In conclusion, Gildan Men’s Underwear Covered Waistband Boxer Briefs are the everyday heroes of your underwear drawer. No frills, no fuss, just pure comfort and reliability. They’re the dependable, quiet champions of your daily routine, making sure you’re comfortable from morning to night. Plus, they make laundry day a whole lot easier, because who doesn’t love a good multipack?

reviewText: Looks like these reviews get piled under one item, and I can't figure out how to separate them. Anyway, I tried 2 kinds, and I'll post a review for each below.Long Leg Breathable (2XL):This was on the small end of the size range I shoot for, but unlike the competitor I usually use (ExOfficio), these run a bit smaller and stretch less. Couldn't hardly get them on. Now, I suppose it may be because they're not big & tall, but neither are ExOfficio and I've had good luck with them. Can't really give a review of them other than to say that the quality looks good, and if they fit, I would expect them to hold up well. They're soft and material feels as if it would be comfortable. Unfortunately, I've just wasted some money. At least it wasn't ExOfficio money, though. Those are far more expensive.Also, one pair came in a bright teal color. Doesn't bother me, but just beware, in case it would bother you.Big Man Boxer Briefs (2X):These fit better, overall, but offered little support up front, so there is still ample opportunity for a sweaty situation down there. They're thicker, and use way more cotton, so they're probably better at wicking moisture, I just wish they were more supportive. Also, they tend to ride up in the inner thigh a bit, and I think that opens the door for chafing. I just want something in between these two options. Bigger so that they fit around my waist and thighs, breathable, with long legs, and supportive. I'd prefer a blend with more natural fiber like cotton, but until I find one, I'll stick to my ExOfficio 9 boxer briefs. Their 2XLs stretch enough to fit me everywhere and they're super supportive.

reviewText: Me: 5'9, 230 lbs. Bought XXL, black. Fit as expected. Reasonably light in weight, not bulky. Could layer a hoodie under the jacket if desired. Arm length good for my 35 arms. Cuffs on sleeves for warmth. Hood: substantial, fleece lined, but no drawstring to tighten in the wind. No drawstring to tighten at the jacket's base either, which was just below my beltline, though little room for cold air to blow up & in given my 40 waist. Two medium sized lined outside diagonal pockets with easy-to-operate YKK zippers. One inside left lined breast pocket that was vertical in orientation with a 2cm Velcro strip closure - I'd have preferred a horizontal orientation so nothing drops out if the Velcro fails. Front closure also used same size YKK zipper as pockets. A flap with 5 snaps could be closed over the zipper for additional warmth. I like how the front zipper rises 2-3 up the neck like a scarf for additional warmth. Fabric sheds water effectively. Entire jacket is polyester/ polyester fiberfill. Machine wash cold, dark colors, delicate cycle - dry on low setting. NO dry cleaning. I have been pleased with my ability to move freely in the coat. I'm comfortable at 30*F, even when the wind chill is in the low 20's. Have not laundered yet - I'm hoping the fiberfill does not shift where I lose any insulating properties. Build quality seems good for a coat this reasonable in cost. Would recommend.

reviewText: I like everything about these t-shirts, especially the fact they are so affordable! Where else in the world can you buy better-than-average t-shirts for around $5 each in multipacks? And I'm not talking about cheaply made polyester- these are 100% cotton.Are these undershirts? I don't think of them as undershirt cuz they're much thicker than the thin white ones my wife used to buy for me to wear under my dress shirts. Yet, I suppose one could wear one under a nice flannel shirt to add an extra layer in cold weather.Are they soft/comfortable? Absolutely! They're 100% cotton, designed and cut to fit the typical American Male who wants to show off his biceps. And if you happen to be a plumber, these are long enough to cover that Crack, but not too long, if you know what I mean.How's the size, and do they shrink? Absolutely they shrink but they come literally oversized so I'd  recommend that you order your normal size and then wash them before wearing. As long as you don't use hot water to wash and you set your dryer for casual clothes and permanent press (not sheets and towels) you'll be fine. I ordered an XL in size cuz that's what I always wear, and now after multiple  runs through my washer/dryer they still fit perfectly with no fading so far.How are the colors? Well I ordered black this time, but u purchased several packs in a variety of colors  and not only are they deep , the colors match the photos perfectly!Do they Winkle? Absolutely, have you ever had cotton t-shirts that didn't come out of the dryer, wrinkled? But these are better than most, so if I take a few seconds to lay them flat fresh from the dryer and let them cool, they are good to go!!!Bottom line- you can't go wrong with these! As a guy, I never have too many t-shirts,  cuz there are so many reasons to wear one for work or play, when you have paiting or cleaning to do, if you go to the park or go camping, you need to add an extra layer cuz its cold; or you just need to cover you butt cheaks as you work on your neighbor's disposal!Finally, I've recently gone legally blind so it takes a long time for me to write a decent review, so if this one was helpful please give it a thumbs up. Thank you! ðŸ˜Ž

reviewText: Too long and don't want to read.- look discrete- comparable to Kohl's tekwear- comfy- wrinkle free- quick drying- great for travel- may display nipples (read below for the explanation)Firstly, I have been buying these as an alternative to the Kohl's tekwear dry tech which you can get 5 of these for the price of 2-3 at Kohl's when you are using a discount and they are on sale.  In comparison they have a slightly cheaper collar and don't quite last as long but pretty close otherwise they perform the same.The first benefit is for positions like programmers and engineers these are probably acceptable at work if you get the solid colors.The second is that these are excellent for travel, they can roll up around a pair of underwear and get stashed that way in a pair of socks allowing for some serious space saving.  They also DO NOT WRINKLE!They are also designed for working out.  When I didn't have daily lunch meetings I used to frequent a group workout at the gym.  I would wear one of these shirts in the morning and through the work out then exchange it for another shirt.  The one I got sweaty would usually dry during a quick shower and can be put away and the new one dries very quickly if I am in too much of a rush to fully dry off and get back to the office.The comfort is also another thing I love about these.  It is honestly hard to go back to normal shirts on occasions that I need to especially button ups and polos.Now for the few cons I can think of.  The material is conforming if you like to wear snug or are in the wind meaning it will show off your fat or muscles depending on your build in those conditions or your nipples if they are perky so if you or the place you are wearing it to have a problem with any of those things better go with a cotton T-shirt.

reviewText: I've been wearing Fruit of the Loom boxers for years, but these tag-free woven boxer shorts have quickly become my new favorites! Right out of the package, the first thing I noticed was the quality of the fabric – a soft yet durable blend of 55% cotton and 45% polyester that feels lightweight and breathable against the skin.The relaxed fit is exactly what I look for in boxer shorts, offering plenty of room without being too baggy. They fit true to size, and the elastic waistband is snug without being constrictive, ensuring they stay in place without any adjustments needed throughout the day.One of the standout features for me has been the moisture-wicking capability. Whether it’s during a workout or on a hot day, these boxers keep me dry and comfortable, which is a huge plus.The care instructions are straightforward - machine wash warm on a gentle cycle and tumble dry low. I've washed them several times now and the colors stay vibrant, with no noticeable shrinkage or wear.It’s also worth mentioning that they are tag-free. No more itching or scratching, which adds to the overall comfort of these boxers.In conclusion, if you’re looking for comfortable, durable, and well-made boxer shorts, the Fruit of the Loom tag-free woven boxers are a fantastic choice. They combine functionality with comfort, and at their price point, they represent excellent value for money. Highly recommended!

reviewText: I bought this for my husband, who normally just wear a fleece Columbia daily, but with the sub-zero temps in NW Indiana this week I wanted him to have an actual coat.  He wore it outside when it was zero degrees on top of his fleece Columbia.  He said that the coat was so warm that he was actually sweating in it!  So I would say it's a good coat.  He liked how soft the interior is as well and the hood is roomy enough that it can partly cover his face when you pull the strings.  He normally wears an XL and we purchased that size.  It seemed to fit him exactly like all his other clothing, so I would say it's true to size.

No loose threads, gaps or uneven seams.

reviewText: I never know what to expect with clothes I buy online, but this top was a wonderful surprise!  It was shipped in a shrink wrapped package, so I expected wrinkles, but when I took it out of the package and hung it up, the wrinkles were mostly gone within an hour.  It was nice enough to wear to the office without washing or steaming if I wanted to.  The top fits very well -  I got my normal size.  I’m 5’3” and wear a size 12.  I’m self conscious about my belly so I get a size X-LARGE in most tops like this to guarantee a loose fit.  I like that it wasn’t too long since I’m short - it is the perfect length to wear with leggings.  I especially like the fabric.  It’s soft and comfy with no clinging.  It drapes nicely over my body in a flattering way. I love that I can wear a nice looking, business casual like top to work but feel like I’m wearing my favorite old t-shirt!  I want more like this in other colors!

reviewText: The BALENNZ Golf Polos for Men are a welcomed addition to my summer golf wardrobe. These athletic men's polo shirts strike a good balance between style and functionality.Performance:One of the standout features of these polos is their quick-dry technology. Playing golf under the summer sun can be quite sweaty, but these shirts wick away moisture efficiently, keeping you dry and comfortable. The lightweight fabric is breathable, allowing for unrestricted movement during your swing.Design:The design is sleek and modern, making these polos not only suitable for the golf course but also for casual outings. The slim fit gives them a stylish edge, and the variety of available colors allows you to express your personal style.Durability:So far, the BALENNZ Golf Polos have held up well to regular wear and washing. The stitching is solid, and the fabric retains its shape and color even after several rounds of golf.Comfort:The soft and stretchy fabric feels great against the skin, and the shirts provide ample room for movement. The collar sits nicely, and the buttoned placket adds a touch of sophistication.

reviewText: I really like this style of top., Im a 1X. It flatters and kind of shows off your shoulders. The flat ruching in front is nice. The button closure on the back is pretty; very feminine. It hangs down far enough to cover most of your fanny and tummy so not too short. Looks great with slacks and heels or jeans and sandals.Chiffon I like as its very light. However, there is no stretch. Being no stretch keeps the top looking crisp all day, so I dont mind it not having any give. You can pop it over your head without unbuttoning the back button. Wash on delicate and NO dryer. I put mine in lingerie bags to keep the button from snagging off in the wash. If you take it out of washer to hang and it is wrinkled, you'll have to iron it smooth. So chiffon has its loveliness but one has to use more care than other fabrics. I take it out of washer and immediately hang and smooth flat with my hands and it dries ok that way without an iron; the first time out of its shrink wrap you definitely will have to iron out the creases.I bought about 5 solid colors and 3 patterned. All of the colors and patterns look like their pictures. The only 1 thing that I noticed thats a negative is that a couple of the tops were a little off the others' shaping. Two were a tiny bit shorter or wider than the others. Overall, though, I love the top and being inexpensive, I could buy a bunch.

reviewText: I’ve been on the hunt for a reliable pair of jeans that can serve as an everyday staple, and I can confidently say that the Amazon Essentials Men's Slim-Fit Jeans have hit the mark! These jeans offer the perfect blend of style, comfort, and affordability.Fit:The slim-fit design is exactly what I was looking for. It’s not too tight like skinny jeans, but still offers a modern, tailored look. The waist fits perfectly, and the leg opening provides just the right amount of room, making them ideal for both casual and slightly dressier occasions. The sizing is consistent, and they’ve maintained their shape after several washes.Comfort:The fabric is soft and comfortable, with just the right amount of stretch. I can move around easily, whether I’m sitting at my desk, going for a walk, or running errands. They don’t feel stiff like some other jeans I’ve tried, and they’re breathable enough to wear all day long without feeling restricted.Durability:These jeans are built to last! The stitching is strong, and the material feels thick and well-constructed. I’ve worn them for several weeks now, and they’ve held up perfectly—no fading, no loose threads, and no signs of wear. For the price, I’m impressed by the quality.Style:The classic look of these jeans makes them incredibly versatile. They pair well with everything—from a simple t-shirt and sneakers to a button-up shirt for a more put-together look. The color options are great too, giving me a few different shades to choose from depending on my mood.Overall:These Amazon Essentials Slim-Fit Jeans are hands down one of the best wardrobe investments I’ve made in a while. They’re affordable, comfortable, and stylish—everything I was hoping for in a pair of jeans. If you're looking for a go-to pair of jeans that won’t break the bank but still look and feel great, I highly recommend giving these a try. I’ll definitely be purchasing more!

reviewText: I have been buying Lee Extreme Motion jeans since they came on the market, and Lee L342's before that, which this series replaced. These new jeans have maintained the legacy of comfort that the L342's were known for. What sets them apart is their incredible stretch, ensuring a comfortable fit even during the busiest days. These jeans are a godsend if you despise the feeling of being constricted in denim.One caveat, however, is their durability. I'm quite hard on jeans, and these are no exception. Over time, I've noticed some wear and tear, which might be a concern for those who expect their jeans to last a long time. If you're looking for something that can withstand a lot of rugged use, you might want to consider a different option.But for the comfort they provide, I'm willing to overlook the durability issue. These jeans, continuing the tradition of the L342's, are perfect for those days when you need freedom of movement without compromising on style. They come in a variety of styles and washes, making them versatile for various occasions.In summary, having been a loyal customer since the Lee L342's, I can confidently say that these Lee Extreme Motion jeans are a worthy successor, offering exceptional stretch and comfort. Just be prepared to replace them more often if you're as tough on jeans as I am.

reviewText: So, this is designed to be worn as either a jacket or a shirt, allowing you to layer it in and wear it on cold blustery days.I am 6' 1 tall with an athletic build and the large was quite big.  I know it's to allow for a shirt underneath to be worn as a jacket, but it was just too big for me.  I returned it and ordered the medium which gives it a tailored look.I plan to wear it, here in Denver as a cold weather jacket and then as a shirt in the spring and summer.  It's really a great concept and allows for year-round wear (Denver is actually a very temperate climate, but plan accordingly depending on where you live).I got the brown with the plaid inner shell and it looks great.  This is a cotton/polyester blend with approximately 65/35 cotton to polyester respectively.I've ordered many, many shirts and the blend is the way to go in all cases.  I know everyone says cotton, but blends give you so much more in durability, comfort, moisture wicking properties, and bright colors.  I never by 100 percent of x in any shirt, it's always a blend.This looks great with jeans as casual wear; you can't go wrong and there is a wide selection or product with Legendary Whitetails store.Be careful on the care instructions as the tag states this may bleed if washed with white colors in warm to hot water.  It's best to do the first wash by itself and then wax the shirt with a water repellant wax to waterproof it.

reviewText: Let me start by saying that I have not had this jacket long enough to know how it will hold up over time but so far this jacket is amazing.FitAt 6'2 / 200 (long legs) I was tempted to get the XL but got the Large as I wanted something really light as I have a full winter coat but could not be happier with sizing of the Large.MaterialsThis jacket has a really soft and water resistant outer skin.  I placed my arm under my water spigot and the water just bounced off and two quick shakes of my arm and it was dry.  The inner liner is very good at storing body heat so you could probably get away with this being a three season jacket if you live in an area with relatively mild winters.FeaturesThere are four pockets on the jacket I have, two traditional waist-level jacket pockets on the left and right with an inner pocket and an outer left arm pocket.  The two hand pockets are decent but a little shallower than I expected.  The inner pocket is nicely sized and readily falls to hand.  I will likely never use left arm pocket as it feels odd to access and awkward to zip back up.  Speaking of zippers, all of them appear to be of at least decent quality as the zippers feel decently robust and the tracks are metal.  It is a bit annoying that the main zipper on this jacket is on the left which is different than any other jacket I have owned and takes a little brain retraining to get use to.OverallI have spent a lot of money on jackets in the past but also got my money's worth.  I went a bit cheaper this time but I am pretty impressed even in the short time I've worn this one.  I will add an edit if this impression changes due to unexpected quirks or wear.December 2023 Update: 2nd JacketThis jacket has been great and despite rolling around on concrete more often than I cared to as well as doing a lot of other more tasks that would cause wear, I bought a new one to wear when going out.  I am happy to report that the new one has the zipper on the traditional western right side of the jacket and there appears to be more insulation in it as well (still not bulky though).  I am still using the previous one for working on cars and such.

reviewText: These initially felt a little 90's swishy pants to me when I opened them and they were fairly wrinkled. A quick wash and the wrinkles came out. They say to hand wash but I just threw them on a delicate cycle and hung them to dry. Wore them to Disney World and put 20,000 steps in a 12 hour day in them. These things are great! They were so light and breathable. Did I sweat in them? You bet I did. Did they dry super fast? You bet they did. I never once felt like they were riding up or bunched up my boxers like my $60 Under Armour golf shorts did the next day at the park. I never noticed the infamous 90's swishy pants sound while walking all those steps. And believe me, my two daughters certainly would have pointed that out. I was able to keep my money clip and Pixel 5 XL in the front pockets. I never once felt worried that my phone would fall out of my pocket. Even with the extra  phone weight I didn't have to tie the drawstring. I didn't think that the pockets were sagging either with the extra weight. I'm 5' 9 182 lbs with an athletic build (I could spare to lose 5-10 pounds in the stomach) and I measured myself as a medium. So that is what I ordered. I will say that they are a bit if a slim/tailored fit and the bottoms were definitely an inch or so above my knees. That's what I wanted so I am happy I went with the medium. I'f your roughly my size and like more room for physical activities then order a large. I would highly recommend these shorts and am actually looking for a second pack to buy. I just wish the sold a navy and dark gray pack.

The elastic drawcord waistband allows for a custom fit.  Despite numerous washes, these shorts show little signs of wear, which speaks to their durability. Overall, I highly recommend these shorts for anyone looking for comfort, functionality, and durability in their workout gear.

I didn’t have a lot of money to spend and because of his odd size, I came straight to Amazon. These pants appeared on my second swipe up and I saw that one color was on sale for $9.99. I originally ordered him 3 pairs of the sale pants, but ordered him 30x34’s because that’s what he wanted. Got them in 2 days with my Prime and they were perfect for his needs, though he needed a 29” waist.  My son loves how comfortable they are and he says they’re much cooler than jeans. He can wear the 30’s, but I decided to order him some in his regular size of 29x34. I will say that he probably could have gone down to 33” length, possibly 32”, but with his cowboy boots, the 34” are fine. I’m thinking the pants might be slightly big in the waist and length measurements, so you might want to order one size smaller in both dimensions. They aren’t huge, just maybe an inch bigger. So here I go to order more pants and I saw there were 2 additional colors on sale except these were $6.62. What?!?! I couldn’t believe it! I immediately ordered him 6 additional pairs, 4 of one color and 2 of the other. Those 6 pairs were less than $10 more in total than my first order. I couldn’t believe it because I already knew the pants were well made. They hold up very well during washing and they don’t wrinkle. (Hallelujah!)  I mean can you imagine a better deal? The pants are appropriate for dinner, church, work (any kind), really anywhere you’d wear a pair of khakis. I could not be happier with this purchase and urge you to buy them if you’re on the fence. They are totally worth the price, especially if you catch an amazing sale like I did. You’ll be amazed at the quality versus price point and if you manage to get them for $6.62 it’ll make your day! Make sure you check all the colors because they don’t all cost the same. You don’t want to miss an opportunity to get them at rock bottom prices. Trust me, buy them! You won’t regret it.

reviewText: Getting a bit older, and hence a bit fatter-- as we will-- I realized I needed a more roomy fit in my jeans. Looked at these #569 Levi's.Bought them.The fit is exactly what I'd hoped it would be. Not exactly baggy, but looser than the #517 bootcut jeans I've worn all my life.I like them, but I must always mention the loss of value and longevity in products these days. These Levi's are quite thin. The denim is heavily washed-- which the company realizes will drastically reduce the lifespan of the item.And it began thinner, even before being processed. Denim was at one time a very thick and durable fabric. No more.The ordinary retail price for these is nearly seventy dollars.I might be old, and I admit that, but I get irritated by the constant cheapening of our clothing-- to reduce its usable life and compel another purchase.

Whether I’m pairing it with jeans for a casual look or with work pants for a more rugged style, this shirt fits the bill.Overall, the Carhartt Men's Loose Fit Heavyweight Short-Sleeve Pocket T-Shirt is a fantastic addition to any wardrobe. Its combination of durability, comfort, and practical design makes it a versatile piece suitable for various occasions. I highly recommend this t-shirt to anyone looking for a reliable and comfortable everyday shirt.

Is fairly heavy but to be expected. It is warm but not too bulky feeling. Has two front pockets that have no zipper or button to keep them closed. But I don't mind. I really wish this coat did have some sort of inner pocket. I am 6'2 and the 4 XL one reaches down past my knees. I generally struggle with getting trench coats because they usually are much too short. This one was perfect. The price is very good, doesn't feel luxury, but also doesn't feel completely cheap. Would definitely be buying again, amazing value and coat.

reviewText: I was a bit hesitant to order these shoes because I've myself never heard of Brooks. I took them out of the box and thought That is a really thick sole. And then I put them on my feet and I was thrilled nearly 100%.Pros- The regular width shoe is perfect for someone who has a generally skinny foot but a slightly wider ball of foot area. This has been a challenge for my entire life and I've often had to either buy wide shoes that make my feet swim or have shoes that are too tight around my toes and ball of my foot.- The toe area is long enough over center to accommodate those of us with a long second toe, or Greek toe. This can be especially helpful if you suffer pain or potential hammer toe due to cramped shoes. My other toes feel supported and don't feel like they're swimming, but my long toe also has plenty of room and support.- The cushy support from the nitrogen injected spongey soles is something I never knew I needed.- The arch support feel fantastic for high arches. I didn't even feel the need to switch out the insole.- The top of the shoe is stretchy and breathable.- I have felt comfortable and supported since I started wearing these about a week ago. I had major foot surgery in 2021 and have had issues with my feet and toes ever since. These don't solve all those problems but I feel a lot better. I didn't feel like I could comfortably walk 10,000 steps per day and now I do. I'm going over 13,000+ per day.- They were easy to wear even without breaking in. I've had only minimal breaking in pains and that is a really big deal for me because that's never been the case before.Cons- The shape and height of the heel back on this shoe rubs into my heel, not just on the bridge but on the sides as well. This meant that I had to buy socks with a heel tab on them. I am not a huge fan of those kinds of socks because they are always super thick. This means that a lot of the glorious room I got in these shoes was then taken away from me by thick socks that I didn't even want to buy. So just remember that if you buy these shoes you now also have to buy $20 of socks.- The shoelaces are not typical for tennis shoes and they're the kind of tubular ones. This means that they are harder to untie and more likely to get stuck in annoying knots.- I had to relearn to walk in these shoes. The sole is so thick and springy that walking is not intuitive at first. I fell off my walking pad the first time I used it with these shoes.Overall, these are really great shoes and I highly recommend them.

reviewText: Update 3 - Fingers Crossed, I've re-ordered again.  Its a great looking jacket, and the material is better than most.  I've had similar, that were a little warmer. See images.  This was in the Return Pile at the UPS store within an hour of my receiving it!Update 1 - Its been a couple years I've been wearing this jacket now.  When I first got it I noticed the zipper was hard to pull, almost like it was cross threaded somehow; that never went away.  I figured after 2 years that was the way it was.  I'm surprised it lasted a couple years, almost exactly.I love this material, I live in New England; our weather changes to the extreme day to day.  This is the jacket Material I wear most often(Fall Spring and half of the Winter.)  This is my 5th jacket like this, but my first with an extra warm hood.  The size is pretty accurate.  I actually bought an XL and an XXL.  I like my coats large for style and I like to have room to layering underneath, so I kept the XXL; though the XL looked pretty sharp too(just without any layers,) I was stuck between the sizes.  I'm not sure my real Winter Coat would be much warmer with enough layers.  I may purchase a second, in another color; to be seen at night, and because it was a good enough deal I'd get mad if I ever ripped or lost one..

reviewText: My husband has been a Wrangler man for probably the last 10 years. He used to be a hardcore Levi's guy, until their prices became ridiculous and the denim started completely wearing out after just a couple months of use.We used to go with the unwashed denim, for longer wear, but honestly, they were such a hassle and always got odd creases in them even with the most strict following of the instructions that we just decided to go with the PWD, which stands for Pre-Washed Denim.Things to note about the Cowboy Cut 936pwd style:1) These pants are supposed to fit at your natural waist, not your hips! Your natural waist is above your hip bones, and USUALLY can be found in line with the middle of your belly button. If you don't know how to find your natural waist, look it up- lots of helpful pics and articles.2) These pants are supposed to fit snugly! They are not supposed to be baggy at all.3) These pants may shrink a bit, so if you are on the edge of sizing up because these are already a bit uncomfortable, size up!4.) These pants fit best on people/men who are long and lean. I say this because they are so snug, and sit at your natural waist. Some may find this too constricting.My husband does manual labor for a living as a glazier. Wranglers have been awesome at protecting his legs from some crazy scary glass shards that have ripped other people's sissy brand pants to shreds. They have always been well worth the cost. A pair of Wranglers typically will last my husband about a year and a half to two years depending on how many he has on rotation. During lean times, if he only has, say 3 pair on rotation, they may last about a year due to the increased wash and wear. I recently splurged when I saw that Amazon had an amazing price on these babies, putting them at less than half of retail. So I bought 6 for less than I would have in store for 3. Sweet!!If you are a lean person like my husband, who looks like they are wearing their older and bigger sibling's pants when you try on Original fit or Relaxed fit and you DON'T want to look disheveled/unprofessional, these pants are for you.  They look tailor-made to fit your body, and they are classy and professional looking.No butt bling, or saggy britches showing off your boxers here! These here are real man's pants.I have pictures of a pair that he has been wearing for about 6 months, that we purchased in store, compared to a pair I bought from Amazon, brand new out of the box.Note that the older pair have shrunk by about 2 inches. Now, I didn't measure the store bought ones when we brought them home, but they always fit him a little long and then after a few weeks of wash, they fit just right in the length.The only difference in the two pair is that the store bought ones were made in Mexico of U.S denim, and the ones I purchased from Amazon are made in Nicaragua from U.S. denim. Not sure if Wrangler switched their manufacturer (again) or if they have different manufacturing places for different sellers.I have already washed these several times and they have been in his rotation for about a month. They have conformed nicely as expected to his frame, and he has expressed no complaints.All in all, if you want some nice, presentable pants that are professional looking, durable as all get out, or maybe some nice jeans for Sunday dinners, church, or a night out, look no further!

Think might be my favorite material on these. Wish I knew which other colors are made with this same material!Blue, 511 ; This material is more what I expect with Levi's. Exterior not too rough, inside good, comparatively a medium stretch. My favorite fit and color. A Win.Bottom line; I'll but more these. Each color is like having a different type of pants but knowing they'll fit!

reviewText: I'm 6'4 and not a super model. I wouldn't... um, couldn't... do the splits in them. But I can get in the car without worrying they'll rip, unlike most pants which are way too tight for tall mountain man kind of guys. These fit as comfortably as $60 Dillard's jeans.Selvedge sewing and thick oz flex denim for outdoor use for $30 would be reasonable to me. I believe in things being well made. I have no problem with fashion, as long as it does the job for the right price. Mass manufactured can do good sewing. Not hard. Everyone has YKK zippers now. Why not beat that? I'd rather care about a product and improve it. Canvas bell tents > plastic garbage. So these pants are store quality. Not grandpa quality and long term, but not like the Lee's I got off Amazon that had major sewing problems. A little loose thread in the button hole, easily fixed with a flame. But otherwise a great buy.They are very comfortable with a little stretch in the fabric. Thin, but not paper thin. Just not heavy duty. Great for daily wearing. The only flaw I've found was small. The hole for the button above the zipper had a bit of loose thread in the inner circle. A quick flame will fix it easily enough. Otherwise, no issues. The Pittsburgh color is slightly darker than the picture, like a hint of deep ocean blue in it. It got a compliment for the color right out the door.

reviewText: I have two teenage boys, who are full-figured and at the top of the height curve. My 14-year-old is now 6 ft tall and 260 lb. I bought these pants a while back. I was thinking that I was buying standard sweatpants in a three pack. I was not thrilled when I opened the pack to find a very strange texture I think. However after, I don't have to wear them, so I presented them to him to be honest, I expected him to reject them out of hand. To my surprise. He tried them all on and said that he liked them. He has been wearing them for months now. They have held up very well in the wash. Unlike traditional cotton or polyester, Jay are not going to pill. They are extremely stretchy they do look nicer than what you would think from my description. So yeah, if my son wanted me to buy them again, I would. But if I had touched them about before purchasing them, I would not have bought them .Just for reference, my son is extremely picky about his clothes. He will not even wear a shirt with pink or purple in it because he thinks it looks feminine. A major plus of these pants are the zippered pockets. They can hold his iPhone 13 and his beats securely. The material feels thin to me, and I would not want to wear it in the winter. However, it seems to be fine for him. Since he is doing this whole teenage thing of wearing giant hoodies when it's 90° outside, at least these pants don't seem so outrageous.

reviewText: I am 5' 10 tall and 172 lbs., and old. I wear a 41 suit. The size L fit the way I like. Because some reviewers suggested they were cut small, I bought XL. They were huge, and I returned them for size L. I have work 3 of them for indoor workouts in a temperate climate (low to mid 70s, within 2 miles of the ocean). They were comfortable. And, they look good. They are easy to wash and come out of the dryer wrinkle free.But, they arrived with that chemical smell common to microfiber clothes.  Realessentials included a card inviting the user to email them for any issues, but I elected to try self-help.  I washed them in Kirkland Free, and the odor diminished. I ran them through the dryer a second time, with a Bounce dryer sheet, and they were much improved. (Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets on microfiber towels. They will lose their absorbency.  I don't think it hurt the shirts).  Then, I rewashed them with Downey fragrance free laundry detergent and dried them without a dryer sheet.  After that, they were suitable for wear. I suspect that one washing with a pleasantly scented detergent might be sufficient.

reviewText: I love these shirts!  They are pretty much all I wear.  They have held up to abuse in the kitchen while cooking and I've been able to get grease stains out of them easily.  I like that they are breathable and lightweight/moisture wicking.They are frequently on sale and super cheap so I don't worry too much if I find myself in a situation where it might get destroyed - like painting - because at 3 for $20, if I get paint on it, I'll just use it for painting in the future.  I've even been able to get car gunk stains out when I work on my car and accidentally touch my shirt with a dirty parts.I like how comfortable and light they are, it almost feels like I'm not wearing a shirt at all.  I've never had any issues with stitching poking me or coming undone and I've been wearing these for 7-8 years now.They look nice enough to go out in public, but fit/feel like a super comfortable T-shirt.  The lightweight fabric is a MUST here in South Carolina.

reviewText: This has become my new summer go-to for just hanging around the house.  At this price, it's never going to be that one that you hold onto for 15 years until your wife gets tired of seeing it and accidentally destroys it or wear to that singles event at the park where you want to look like 1M$.  It is the one however, that you wear to Lowe's, mow the lawn, and don't really care if you get some random schmuz all over it or you suddenly can't find it [ask the wife if she has and look for guilty body language].They are cheap, they do shrink a bit but won't Hulk Hogan on you by accident, and reasonably comfortable.  The one suggestion is that like many red things, you'll want to run that one through the washer with other dark colors first, and probably never with the white clothes unless you think pink socks are flattering.Maybe best of all, even when you've moved onto the next set, the old ones have a second life, if not for that painting project you don't want to get all over your new ones, then for cleaning up after the dog, washing the car, or any number of other dad-activities that we don't brag about.  I think I still have one of my first ones hanging around as a stain rag.  And you won't shed a tear when it finally does come to an end because after spending $5 on it and getting $15 worth of wear and utility, it deserves to go with dignity.

reviewText: I was skeptical on the price but needed a new winter jacket as I recently relocated from Florida to Northern Texas and we get weather in the low teens during the winter months. I notice a lot of people say buy a size up I got a medium I’m 6 foot about 175 lbs and it fit great. My only thing is engraving things like “fashion” on the buttons and the “fashion, sport” leather badge on the left sleeve are a little tacky, (I actually took the badge on the sleeve off with a needle and small knife), but for the money this is a great jacket that seems durable, fits to size and will keep you plenty warm in at least the weather conditions that I have explained.
