reviewText: These pants are pretty darn excellent!  Here‚Äôs the size info to help you buy the correct size.Me- 5‚Äô7‚Äù long legs! 170#pictures are the size 16.I always wear L (long) pants.  I was already wearing Lee brand jeans which stretched.  I started with a 12L, but gained weight and was wearing a 16L until I found these.The previous Lee jeans had a waistband which came up to hip area.But sadly I faced medical problems and consoled myself with ice cream.  The medical problems were caused by the surgeon who  left me with a deformed foot.  It is very hard to get enough exercise when you can‚Äôt really walk well let alone run, jog, skip rope or do any other stuff that would help.Ice cream + inactivity = fatness.  Anyone who goes from a size 12 to a 16 has no business wearing jeans which don‚Äôt have enough fabric to make it up to the hip bones any longer. I‚Äôm sure I looked like some chubby middle aged woman who should look in the mirror and stop dressing inappropriately.These jeans stretch pretty much all over. I ordered a pair in Amazon‚Äôs recommended of size 14 but also in the size I suspected was better for me, size 16.I took reviewer‚Äôs advice and did not get ‚ÄúLong‚Äù.This was sound advice, the long‚Äôs would have required hemming.I tried the size 16 first- they are incredibly comfortable and soft. They are roomy in the right places and the waist band height is much better.  The crotch area was an exception though. That shouldn‚Äôt feel like there‚Äôs extra unneeded fabric, but it did. After washing this hasn‚Äôt bothered me.  I do need a belt to keep these up if my phone is in the pocket.Next I tried the size 14. I‚Äôm fairly confident that they will fit better if I lost 5 pounds. reviewText: The Brooks Glycerin has been my go-to sneaker for years. I’ve already been professionally fitted a few times and this is usually the winner, so I wasn’t buying blind. I’d been squeezing the last bit of life out of my 20s when faced with the decision of going for the 21s or the new 22s. The 21s were marked down due to the release of the 22s, but it’s all about comfort. Several running reviews guided me to the 21s over the 22s. I’ve got about 85 miles on them so far and I love them. Bonus points for an ultra bright color with top notch reflective elements. These are not a fast shoe but they’re great for anyone looking for a neutral shoe that’s comfortable enough for long distances. As is true with most premium running shoes, they are good to go straight out of the box. They also work for just standing around. I have a work desk that can be raised to standing height and these keep me comfortable when I choose to stand for an hour or two.

reviewText: The adidas Men's Essentials Warm-up Open Hem 3-stripes Tracksuit Pants are a fantastic addition to any athletic wardrobe. The quality is top-notch, with a comfortable and durable fabric that feels great against the skin. The iconic 3-stripes design gives these pants a classic and stylish look, perfect for both workouts and casual wear.However, I did find that the pants run a bit long. At 6' tall, I usually don't have issues with length, but these pants require some hemming to get the perfect fit. It's a minor inconvenience, but worth mentioning for those who might not want to deal with alterations.Despite the length issue, the overall fit is excellent, and the waistband provides just the right amount of stretch and support. The open hem design offers a relaxed feel, and the pockets are a handy addition for carrying essentials.In summary, the adidas Men's Essentials Warm-up Open Hem 3-stripes Tracksuit Pants are great quality and very comfortable, but be prepared for some adjustments if you're not on the taller side. Still, a solid choice for anyone looking for stylish and functional tracksuit pants.

reviewText: I've been searching for a high-quality winter jacket for quite some time, and I'm so glad I stumbled upon this one. From the moment I put it on, I was impressed by the incredible warmth it provides. Even in temperatures as low as 10°F, I've been able to stay comfortably warm without needing additional layers.The secret to this jacket's warmth lies in its Sorona Aura filler. This innovative material is known for its exceptional thermal insulation properties, and it's the same filler used by premium brands like Spyder, who charge upwards of $300 for their jackets. The fact that this jacket offers the same premium quality filler at a fraction of the cost is simply remarkable.Aside from its outstanding warmth, I'm also blown away by the jacket's stylish design and comfortable fit. It's incredibly lightweight and doesn't feel bulky or restrictive at all. The materials used are top-notch, and the stitching is impeccable. I can confidently say that this jacket is built to last.Overall, I'm absolutely thrilled with my purchase of this jacket. It's an exceptional value that surpasses my expectations in every way. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a warm, stylish, and durable jacket that won't break the bank. You won't find a better jacket at this price point.

reviewText: The COOFANDY Men's Sport Coat is a versatile and stylish blazer that strikes the perfect balance between casual wear and business attire. Ideal for a range of occasions—from a smart-casual office look to a night out—this jacket combines comfort, style, and affordability.Design and FitThe one-button design is sleek and modern, offering a sharp, streamlined look. The fit is tailored without being too tight, providing a flattering silhouette. It’s not overly slim, so it's comfortable to wear throughout the day without feeling restricted. The fabric is soft yet sturdy, giving it a premium feel without the high price tag. The colors and patterns (available in several options) are versatile and easy to pair with both casual and formal attire.Comfort and DurabilityWhile it's lightweight, the jacket still feels well-constructed, and it doesn't have that cheap, flimsy vibe that some budget-friendly blazers tend to have. The material has a nice amount of stretch, making it suitable for all-day wear. It's breathable enough to wear in warmer weather but substantial enough for cooler temperatures when layered with a shirt or sweater underneath.Styling OptionsYou can easily dress this jacket up or down. Pair it with dress pants and a button-down shirt for a business meeting or with jeans and a T-shirt for a more relaxed look. The versatility is one of its strong points, making it a wardrobe staple for anyone looking to add a polished touch to their closet without breaking the bank.Pros:Affordable yet stylishVersatile for various occasionsComfortable and breathable fabricSlim, flattering fitEasy to care for and maintainCons:The fabric may not be as heavy-duty as higher-end options, so it's not ideal for very formal or colder-weather eventsLimited color/pattern options depending on availabilityConclusion:Overall, the COOFANDY Men's Sport Coat Casual Blazer is an excellent choice for anyone in need of a budget-friendly blazer that still delivers on style, comfort, and functionality. It’s perfect for those who want a smart-casual look without splurging on expensive formalwear. Whether you're dressing up for a work event or just adding a touch of sophistication to a casual outfit, this jacket will serve you well.

reviewText: My wife introduced me to slip ons with her shoes, so I decided to give this a try. These are my first ever Sketcher shoes and I'm quite impressed in the build quality. I normally wear a 9 1/2 but my feet is a little wide, so I will juggle between a 9 1/2 and a 10, but mostly 10. I bought a 10 since I didn't try these on at a store which I recommend. It's a tad big, but it's comfortable. I probably will fit in a 9 1/2 perfectly, but won't know until I try.What I really like about these shoes is that you can truly slip these on without a shoe horn or bending over. It's a quick process. They are lightweight and comparable to athletic shoes. I'm going to buy another pair but go smaller. The four star rating is for the loose fit and not knowing the longevity yet, but otherwise, it's a nice shoe.

reviewText: The Hanes Men’s Athletic Shorts are a fantastic addition to any workout wardrobe. They’re incredibly comfortable, thanks to the breathable cotton jersey fabric that feels soft against the skin. The loose, spacious fit allows for unrestricted movement, making them ideal for gym sessions or casual lounging. They also do a great job of absorbing moisture during workouts, helping to keep you cool and dry. However, keep in mind that if you choose the gray color, sweat can be more noticeable, which might be a factor for some buyers. Overall, these shorts are practical, lightweight, and a great value for everyday wear or exercise. The material quality is good so good I use them as pajamas.Rating: 4.5/5 (minus half a point for sweat visibility in gray).

reviewText: I would just like to start off by saying that this jacket fits well and there are some reviews that I have read giving it a low amount of stars and saying that the pockets aren't real.Perhaps they got a defective jacket but all of the pockets on mine are functional and real.It is pretty durable and water seems to bead off of it although I imagine like anything water will get through eventually especially if you're swimming with it.The fleece interior is very warm and comfortable.I see in other reviews as well that they mentioned the zipper is on the wrong side. The zipper mechanism is on the left hand side instead of the right hand side which really doesn't matter to me it functions I am not concerned with zipper etiquette.Some people are led to believe that this is a woman's jacket because the zipper is on the left, well I've seen soft shell jackets for women as I bought some for my partner and they are usually pleated around the upper chest and armpit area to allow room for breasts. This jacket is not pleated in such a way so I would say that's wrong.Although women can wear the jacket I'm just saying it does not possess that pleat that allows extra room for lady partsI would love if this had an attachable Hood as it does not the hood is permanently attached but can be rolled away although I'm not sure why you would want to anyway but you can you have options.That does not detract from the quality of the jacket in any way as it is not stated as having a removable Hood so there's no reason to deduct a star for that.This jacket will keep you warm it will keep you protected and it looks good. It's true to size as far as I can say and the material is satisfactory.It does have pull cords within to adjust the fit of the jacket as well as the hood and in other reviews I have taken note that they report their jacket not having retention clasps for the chords but mine does.Again I don't know if they got it defective jacket or if this jacket has changed and the company has fixed the issues. But that being said my jacket is complete and it has everything the bad reviews say it does not so quite happy with it.

reviewText: Great button down. Very versatile for work or casual. Fabric is lightweight, great feel against the skin. White blouse is not see thru as long as you wear skin tone undergarment. Really like the elastic sleeve, great alternative to rolling up long sleeves.  Very feminine, stylish and comfortable. It’s a boyfriend fit so it’s roomy. The elastic on the arms is fitted so they hold up very well.  Personally I do not find the elastic too tight. For my arm size it is comfortably snug that I don’t need to fuss with because it’s sliding or because it’s too tight. With that being said others could find it constricting. Bought one in black and another in white. Like that the buttons match the fabric. Blouse has side pockets which is great if you were the blouse out.  Once tucked in the pockets for me are not functional. Washes well, I hung to dry, minimal wrinkles, light steam or ironing. Highly recommend.

reviewText: I recently picked up a Hanes sweatshirt, and while it’s an okay option, it didn’t quite live up to my expectations compared to the Fruit of the Loom sweatshirts I’ve owned in the past.The fit is decent, and it’s comfortable enough for lounging around the house or running errands. However, I found that the fabric feels a bit thinner and less substantial than what I'm used to with Fruit of the Loom. While it keeps me warm, it lacks that cozy, heavyweight feel that I really enjoy in a sweatshirt.One thing I appreciated about the Hanes sweatshirt is the variety of colors and styles available, so there’s something for everyone. Still, in terms of overall quality and comfort, I would choose Fruit of the Loom any day. If you're looking for a basic sweatshirt that will get the job done, this Hanes option is fine, but for those who prioritize warmth and durability, I recommend going with Fruit of the Loom instead.

reviewText: Ah, let me regale you with the epic saga of the Under Armour Men's Tech Graphic Shorts – the unsung heroes of leg liberation, the Thor's hammer of athletic wear that will have you feeling like a superhero, even if your only superpower is a killer sprint to the fridge.First off, these shorts are like a second skin, a fabric symphony that dances around your legs with the grace of a gazelle and the comfort of a thousand marshmallow hugs. I've worn them for everything from intense workouts to casual couch marathons, and they've yet to betray my trust. It's like your legs found their soulmates in short form.The Tech Graphic design is like wearable motivation. It's not just a pattern; it's a visual anthem that screams, You got this! Whether you're lifting weights, running a marathon (or a marathon of Netflix episodes), or just attempting the heroic feat of tying your shoes without sitting down, these shorts have got your back – or, well, your legs.Now, the moisture-wicking technology is a game-changer. It's like having a personal climate control system for your nether regions. I've sweated like a racehorse in these shorts, and yet, they stay drier than a desert in a heatwave. It's almost magical – the kind of sorcery that leaves you questioning the laws of sweat physics.But let's not forget the pockets – glorious pockets! These shorts are like the Swiss Army knives of legwear, equipped with pockets deep enough to hold your dreams and ambitions. Need a place for your phone? Boom, pocket. Car keys? Pocket. Snacks for the post-workout refuel? You betcha – pocket party!And the elastic waistband is like a gentle hug from a fitness deity. It stays put, never digging into your sides or betraying you during that extra slice of pizza celebration. It's like having a loyal sidekick, ensuring your shorts stay where they should be – on your hips, ready for action.In conclusion, Under Armour Men's Tech Graphic Shorts aren't just shorts; they're a lifestyle. With a design that inspires, a fit that's comfier than a cloud, and pockets that rival Mary Poppins' magical bag, they're the shorts that will accompany you on every leg of life's journey. So, fellow leg warriors, adorn yourselves in the armor of Under Armour – where every stride is a step towards greatness, and every squat is a salute to shorts that redefine comfort and style!

reviewText: The Lacoste Men’s Short Sleeve Crew Neck Pima Cotton Jersey T-Shirt is an excellent choice for anyone seeking both comfort and style in an everyday shirt. The pima cotton fabric feels incredibly soft and smooth against the skin, making it perfect for all-day wear. The shirt has a clean, classic look that pairs well with jeans, shorts, or casual trousers, making it versatile enough for various occasions.The fit is true to size, offering a relaxed yet tailored silhouette that flatters without being too tight. The crew neck design is simple and timeless, and the Lacoste logo adds a subtle touch of sophistication without being overly bold.What sets this T-shirt apart is the quality of the pima cotton—it’s soft, breathable, and durable, maintaining its shape and feel even after multiple washes. This is definitely a wardrobe staple that offers both luxury and everyday comfort.

reviewText: I compared this item to several pairs of cargo shorts purchased from a clothing seconds reseller.  Often high quality expensive items ended up here simply because the size label was incorrect, or stitching was slightly off.  Yet those were well made and lasted nearly a decade.  The Wrangler brand used to represent a quality pair of jeans, years ago.Pros:  Main advantage:  The fit is as advertised and comfortable in the crotch region and waistline.  The fabric is thin, this may be what you want if you prefer a lighter fabric.  There are 5 smaller cargo pockets instead of 2 large ones.  It uses Velcro pocket closures.  A side point regarding fit is that the crotch and groin region is snug in the Amazon Basics cargo shorts.  It's fine if you never sit down.  This item, https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01JQTPQDQ/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1Cons:  Main disadvantage:  On a dayhike the old shorts mentioned above could carry a sandwich and a deflated bag of chips or small water bottle.  You won't be able to do that with these shorts, but you could carry all sorts of tiny doohickeys from your junk drawer such as marbles.  The larger of the 5 side pocket could not carry my smartphone.  In addition, the fabric is thin and is likely not durable, another one of the cheap disposable clothing.  I can live with the Velcro but like buttons.  I preferred the old shorts but they had expired from years of use and abuse.

reviewText: When it comes to finding the perfect summer top, I always look for comfort, versatility, and style. This casual women's summer top, made from 90% polyester and 10% elastane, ticks all these boxes and more. Whether I'm dressing up for the office or down for a casual day out, this shirt effortlessly adapts to any occasion. Here's why it's become a staple in my wardrobe.First off, this top is incredibly comfortable. The high-quality knitted fabric is soft and lightweight, giving it a cozy feel against my skin. The material blend of polyester and elastane offers just the right amount of stretch, so the shirt moves with me without feeling restrictive. It's a bit loose-fitting, which is perfect during the hotter months because it allows for better air circulation and has a relaxed vibe. Despite the loose fit, the material's elasticity ensures it drapes nicely, keeping it flattering.Style-wise, this shirt is a gem. The crew neck and batwing sleeves add a touch of elegance, while the pleated texture and classic solid color make it a standout piece. The design is simple yet stylish, making it easy to dress up or down. One of my favorite ways to wear this top is under a blazer for a polished office look. The crew neck provides a neat neckline that complements the sharp lines of a blazer, making it a great choice for professional settings.For a more casual look, pairing the top with white pants is a winning combination. The contrast of the solid color against white creates a fresh and clean look that's perfect for summer. Personally, my go-to outfit is this shirt with white jeans and a white denim jacket. This combo not only looks chic but also enhances my summer tan beautifully. The solid color of the top allows my tan to pop, giving me a radiant and healthy glow.This top is also incredibly versatile in how I can pair it with other wardrobe staples. Tucking the front of the shirt into skinny jeans or denim shorts creates a chic and stylish look that's perfect for a casual day out. Alternatively, wearing it with leggings provides a comfortable yet fashionable outfit for running errands or meeting friends for coffee. The top also pairs well with skirts, cardigans, heels, sandals, sneakers, and accessories like necklaces, making it a truly adaptable piece.Whether I'm heading to the office, going out for a date, attending a party, or just running errands, this top fits the bill. It's suitable for various occasions, including vacations, holidays, clubs, daily wear, school, and even workouts. The loose fit and lightweight fabric make it an excellent choice for summer, spring, fall, and winter, ensuring I get year-round wear out of it.Another great thing about this top is its easy care instructions. Being machine washable, it saves me time and effort, making it a practical addition to my wardrobe. The fabric holds up well after multiple washes, maintaining its shape, color, and softness, which speaks to its durability and high quality.All in all, this casual women's summer top is a fantastic addition to my wardrobe. Its combination of comfort, style, and versatility makes it a standout piece that I find myself reaching for time and again. Whether I'm dressing it up with a blazer for the office or keeping it casual with white jeans and a denim jacket, this top always makes me look and feel great. The soft, lightweight fabric ensures maximum comfort, while the elegant design adds a touch of sophistication to any outfit. If you're looking for a reliable and stylish top that can adapt to various occasions, this one is definitely worth considering.

reviewText: Lost a bunch of weight and needed new pants, so bought this and its smooth front cousin. The color is very dark, blue-black, so it is fairly dirt resistant. If it got dirty, quick dab with damp towel should take care of it, just don't let it soak in. Needs almost no ironing if you got it out of dryer when damp and hang it up with the pant legs folded properly.Should be worn with a belt, as the stretch is for emergencies. The stretch parts are hidden near the pleat and covered behind panels, which can be covered by the belt so they are completely invisible.The side pockets are a bit shallow, but perfectly usable. You don't buy these for pocket capacity.Once you wear they you'll find them to be quite comfortable, as the waist does stretch to accommodate sitting and so on. All in all great value for the price.

reviewText: I have been looking for a nice pair of flattering, well-fitting dressier pants for over a year. I've returned multiple pairs and kept a few, but ended up taking most to Goodwill because they just didn't make me feel like I looked good in them. I had almost given up and tried these as a last resort, thinking I'd probably have to return them as well. But no, you can't pry these away from me, these will be my go to's for the foreseeable future. What I love:1. The fit. I bought Lee's for many years but quit buying them several years ago because the sizes were so inconsistent. I could try on a 14 that fit like a 10, and another 14 that fit like a 16.  They were also cut too tight for my liking. Not these, no sir. The 16 fit like a glove and made me look great. I felt like a million dollars in them, and they will go with anything.2. The wash. I threw them in the washer and then the dryer and they looked great. No shrinking at all, even though they are 50% cotton.3. The fabric. The cotton/polyester/elastane is a winner in my book, very comfortable to wear and they look good as well.4. The pockets. I have returned several pairs of dressy pants because the pockets were on the side of the pant. They stuck out and made my hips look really wide. The pockets on these are just below the waistband, giving you the best of both worlds-- nice pockets but also a clean side hem with no sticking out.5. The overall look- very classy, clean and neat.I should note that the medium length was just a tad too long for my 5' 5 frame in flats, but they are perfect with medium heels.Lee, please don't change anything. We love these pants and I will buying another pair in gray.

reviewText: The Lion Nardo Stretch Men's Dress Shirt has quickly become one of my favorites for formal and semi-formal events. The fabric of this shirt is simply outstanding—completely wrinkle-free and incredibly comfortable. It's hard to put into words just how pleasing the material is; I just wish more dress shirts were made like this.I recently wore this shirt under a sport coat to a wedding, and it was perfectly comfortable throughout the event. It wasn't overly warm, and the stretchy, soft fabric combined with its wrinkle-free nature made it an ideal choice for long wear. The shirt's fit and feel are fantastic, providing a modern, sleek look without compromising on comfort.The sizing is accurately aligned with American standards, which made it easy to select the right fit without any guesswork. My wife has even commented several times that I should order more of these shirts.While I find these shirts to be worth the investment, I do have a slight reservation about the price point, especially when compared to similar brand-name shirts. It can be a bit challenging to justify the cost when the prices are nearly the same. However, for the quality and comfort you get, these shirts are definitely worth considering.If you're looking for a dress shirt that combines exceptional comfort with elegant styling, the Lion Nardo Stretch Men's Dress Shirt is a superb choice. Just keep in mind the pricing when comparing with other brand options.

reviewText: Ok, so this is just a bad product, not terrible or the worst ever or anything silly like that, just bad.I ordered a few pairs online because I know my size well, and I have never had significant issues with it after 42 years. No matter what, if I order a 30 x 30, I will get a pair that fits. For some brands, the fit might be a little different depending on the cut and stuff, but I have never gotten a pair that I could not wear.And then I met Amazon pants (trousers). The first set of 4 that I ordered in 30 x 30 in the indigo wash, all 4 at least were the same size which is good, but all 4 were far too small. After washing them the first time I tried them on, and both the waist and the length were off. Ok, that was my bad I figure, so I order 1 more pair this time in the 32 x 32 in the indigo wash, and 1 pair in the light wash also in 32 x 32, the next largest size in both dimensions as both dimensions were off. Seems reasonable.Got the new indigo wash pair in, and it was too big. Amazon alone of all the clothing companies I have ever owned seems to think the size I am should be I guess a 31 x 31, a size I so far have been unable to find. But low and behold the 32 x 32 is pretty good, the length is a bit off but the waist is good.Ok, that sucks, but they are not so bad that I can't wear them at all, the too-small ones were, but you can wear too-big. So keep them I did and I have now had them for exactly 43 days. I have worn them a bit, but as with most people, I think, I have other pants and have simply added them to the rotation. I also have not taken a hammer, beating stick, or anything else I can think of that should have affected durability this quickly. But they are now falling apart. I noticed something hard in my shoe yesterday, dumped it out and it turned out to be one of the rivets at the corners of the pockets. Checked both pairs, and both are missing at least 2. Also, there are some small frayed threads here and there, but I think that is mostly normal. Not something I would expect in the first two months of normal wear.Long story short, until someone purchases one of each color of these, be warned. The sizes may be somewhat off or perhaps ridiculously off of what you would think are normal sizes. At least with the indigo wash, I would recommend avoiding them as the sizes I think were tampered with by someone who should not have done so, but of course, I have a small sample size so just proceed with caution. The light wash seems to be mostly on track with what sizes actually are, though, of course, your results may vary. The quality on the other hand, again with the caveat of small sample size, but across two pairs from seemingly entirely different lines since the sizes are so different, to have quality issues on 2/2 units is exceptionally bad from a QC standpoint.I do appreciate Amazon stepping in with a lot of the basic items to give some competition, but I have had some pants that I am pretty sure came from third-world countries and such, especially in the 80s and 90s, and these are the worst I have ever owned. Save your money, and buy some Levi's that will actually make it through the first few years without falling apart on your body. This one may well be another failure that they have stopped caring about and are just trying to get costs back out of at this point.

reviewText: Ordered these because, like many others here, I've got bigger thighs and a butt that are the limiting factor on the cuts of jeans I can wear.  I was specifically looking for jeans that can be appropriate for work and evenings.  I was a little hesitant after seeing some reviews here talking about the different material ratios and fits of the different colors.  I can confirm that this is accurate, but that's something that's pretty common when you're talking about jeans.  I did, however, expect that after looking at the Levi's website, seeing which washes had the 98/2 cotton/elastane ratio that those washes would fit the same.  That wasn't the case either though, and that's why I'm giving them 4 instead of 5 stars.The two colors I went with at first were the Midnight and the Timberwolf.  Both arrived with tags that marked them as "stretch," which made me feel kind of weird.  They both do, in fact, have a bit of give to them, but you don't have to worry about them looking or feeling like you're putting on yoga pants.  They are roomy where they need to be while looking neat and thus can be used for work like I wanted.  However, I'd say that the Midnight wash was slightly larger than I was expecting while the Timberwolf were somewhat smaller, or rather, they just fit more snugly than the Midnight ones.  They're probably closer to what I expected the size to be, but it was odd that there was any difference for two pairs of pants supposedly in the same line (541) and made from the same material "98% Cotton, 2% Elastane."Regardless, they still both were cut the way I was looking for in terms of their general shape if not necessarily the specific fit on the waist.  Color-wise, the Midnight pair look exactly as pictured, while the Timberwolf are darker than what's pictured above.  The Levi's site has a more accurate color for them if you take a look there.  I prefer the color I received to what I saw above, but just know they will be darker.I also wanted a darker blue pair, but did not read good things about The Rich or Rigid Dragon here.  I was apprehensive, but decided to try The Rich to see for myself.  I was pleasantly surprised.  They're definitely a fit closer to the Timberwolf than the Midnight, which I guess is why some people said they're a bit more "rigid" but I've had those rough old Levi's in the past and these are certainly not anything close to that.  They also look like they're going to bleed, so I'm going to need to do the whole cold water + vinegar wash on them before I wear them.Overall these are good pants for anyone with a build that's got more meat in the butt/thigh region and struggling to find comfortable and stylish jeans in the straight or slim(mer) style.  Just be mindful that not all the washes are created equal in terms of the fit or feel and that there may be some color deviations from what you see above.

reviewText: I absolutely love the Dickie's heavyweight tee shirts for men. I buy them for my husband frequently.  I think the first one I ever bought was for our 2nd wedding anniversary, because the traditional gift is cotton (yes we are dorks and try to do that every year with some kind of applicable gift).  It was a light brown color.  We will be celebrating our 7th anniversary in a couple of months, and that tee shirt after 5 years and a million washes is still in top condition - no holes, no rips, no fading of the color, no loose stitches. These are very high quality heavy material tee shirts (i.e., not see through or so thin that you can see chest hair or nips), and I am told very comfortable.  Worth every penny.

reviewText: The Signature by Levi Strauss & Co. Gold Men’s Relaxed Fit Flex Jeans are an excellent choice for anyone seeking comfort, style, and durability in a single package. The relaxed fit provides ample room for movement, making them perfect for both casual outings and active days. The Flex technology in the fabric ensures a comfortable stretch without compromising the classic denim look.These jeans are well-constructed, with sturdy stitching and high-quality materials that hold up well to frequent wear and washing. The relaxed fit is true to size, offering a comfortable, not-too-baggy appearance that’s versatile enough for both work and leisure. Whether paired with a T-shirt or a dress shirt, these jeans adapt effortlessly to different styles.One of the standout features is the affordability of these jeans. They offer the trusted quality of Levi Strauss & Co. at a price that’s easy on the wallet. However, the fabric, while durable, is slightly thinner than premium Levi’s options, which might not be ideal for extremely cold weather. That said, the lighter material makes them breathable and perfect for all-season wear in moderate climates.

reviewText: I needed a simple polo shirt for casual, leisure wear around the house and running errands.  Let's try on this one by Aulemen.Likeable features (+):*Fits true to size: M fits my 40 chest well.*Soft, comfortable, cotton blend fabric: 35% cotton, 60% polyester, and 5% elastane.*2 chest pockets with flaps for carrying small items.*Available in a variety of colors.  The Army Green complements my dark khaki cargo pants.*Suitable for most casual, leisure occasions or as a golf shirt.Design shortcomings (-):*The waist hems and shirttail is not long enough for my long torso when not tucked in (my preference).*I prefer polo shirt collars and pocket flaps to have slightly rounded edges.*The 2 chest pockets are not deep/long enough for carrying larger items.*The 2 pocket flaps are not necessary; make the shirt look homely. 1 standard sized pocket without flap on the left chest would look better.*2 placket/chest buttons rather than three look better.

reviewText: This is a no frills rain coat that does what it should: keep the rain off. It's made of nylon-poly fabric with a rubber-like coating. It has a rain proof zipper along with a zipper-covering flap that fastens with metal snaps. The snaps are good quality that are easy to use and look like they'll last. There's a good size hood with a drawstring. There are two 6.5 by 7.5 pockets with flaps but no snaps. I'm 5' 9 and a medium fits me well. There is enough room for a bulky hoodie sweater.Overall, I gave this a rating of 4 stars. It didn't get the fifth star for several reasons. First of all, there are no vents, not in the arm pits, not along the upper back. The fabric is non breathing, so in warmer weather you're likely to get a bit sweaty if the coat's fully zipped. The pockets are simple patch pockets with no access to inside pockets. If you're in the rain digging for keys in your pants pockets you have to unzip or pull the coat up.  There are no cord locks on the hood drawstring. If you want to tighten the hood opening you'll have to tie a knot and then untie it when you want out of the coat. The zipper does not have the option to partially open from the bottom. If you have a longer stride you may find the zipped coat a bit constraining due to coat's length. To be fair, you could not use the zipper and depend on the top three or four snaps.Overall I like this raincoat. It's not perfect, but none of its shortcomings are showstoppers.

reviewText: After booking a trip out of state, I realized I didn't have shoes that could withstand several day's worth of walking.I'm so thankful I found this pair. Never once did my feet, knees, or back ache. Also, the tongue of the shoe is attached, so no fumbling around with ensuring it stayed in place was a huge plus for me. If anything, this feature makes the shoe easy to slip off and on.I've also since worn these to work where I'm on my feet about 10 hours each day, walking, kneeling, etc. and no discomfort whatsoever. I've received many compliments on them everywhere I go!Additionally, I've handwashed my pair about 2 times now and each time they look brand new again.I don't often leave reviews on anything, but these were worthy of it. I would recommend these shoes to absolutely anyone!

reviewText: These pants are a great fit for my tall, slender boys. The waist is slightly smaller than average for UA pants, which is great because they don’t have to cinch them in near as far. I got them on sale which made them a great value for what I paid. The material is a good weight, not too hot but shouldn’t rip easily. They have fully functional pockets the back one is a standard line style pocket, but the side pockets are full zip which is fantastic for on the go people. They even offer these in tall, which is rare. My 6’3” son who weighs 150 pounds fit beautifully into a medium tall. My younger son is 5’6” and 115 pounds and fits solidly in an XS, but we bought a S for later as well.The calf area is somewhat narrow, in the jogger style. If you don’t like a very fitted calf, these may not be for you, but other wise they are functional, fashionable, and cost efficient too.

This led me to the Rockport Eureka Walking Shoes. Let me tell you that they were exactly what I was looking for in a pair of shoes. The Rockports are not only comfortable, but they look great, too! The shoe has more than 28,000 reviews, all with many outstanding ratings. I found a great way to test them out to determine their comfort, and that's on the treadmill.UPDATE: Unfortunately, I am returning the shoes. My initial thoughts on the shoes was a bit premature. As others have mentioned, the tongue on the left shoe is too short, resulting in the corner of the tongue digging into my ankle. I've given enough time (walking on a treadmill for miles) to break them in to see if that would correct the problem. Also, I was in a fast food restaurant while they were mopping the floor, and I walked outside the wet area where there was simply a lightly damp area, and I slide as thought I was on a skating rink. I love the style and fit of the shoe until I start walking. It appears there may be a quality control problem. I've read numerous reviews about the issue and yet it continues to be a problem. I changing my rating from a 5 to a 3. I hope the company will correct the issue, because the shoe is a great shoe! The shoes were made in India. I do believe that my problem is not everyone's problem, and every shoe manufactured does not have this problem, therefore, I am still recommending the shoe with a 3 rating.

reviewText: I always start out saying that measuring tape doesnt lie.This brand is Lee. Like most brands, they have their own size chart. Also this particular style won't flatter all figures... Especially if you choose a size too small. So measure yourself, and look at the sizing guide. Theres a bit of a trick to it (not really).I like:1.The material of these jeans is soft and has some stretch to it but its not suffocating in warmer weather.2. The high waist is perfect height.3. They give the perfect silouhette (like wide legs pants/jeans circa 1930s-1950s) *as long as you get the correct size for YOUR measurements.*My height and weight cannot help you decide your own size. Why? You might ask.I AM 5'4. My measurements taken with a seamstress tape at various times of the year:Fullest part of bust with bra on: 35-37Waist at navel: 25-27Hips:35-37My legs and arms are a bit lengthy and my shoulders are broad. I have to buy larger shirts just because of my shoulders for some brands.Someone with the same height and and weight as myself might have a larger bust, a smaller waist and hips than mine. And they would need a smaller size of these jeans and wear larger size shirts.Or if a person is a pear figure they might need a larger size while their shirt size would likely ve smaller than mine.  Even if we weigh the same we need different sizes. Get it? Good.I purchased the 2 short. Why?1. Im 5'4.2. My waist measures 26 most of the time.3. My hips measure 37 most of the time.Usually when jeans are sized they shouldnt be the exact same measurement as the body. They should provide an extra inch or so to accomodate for tucking in your shirt a d fitting over undergarments.I had a suspicion that Lee would factor that into the sizes... They did.The jeans add 1.5 inches to accomodate and they call it size 2 (i guess for vanity's sake?). While the EU size us 26 (an actual size 6 according to classic garment making). They are stretchy so the fit is a little more forgiving than a non stretch alternative. However these jeans are not the same as skinny jeans. Youre not supposed to squeeze into them.For that perfect silhouette, you really must pay atrention to your waist AND hip measurements. If the difference between your waist and hips is greater than 15 i.e. You're a wasp waist hourglass (i kind of envy you guys), or a wasp waist pear: you want to make sure these are the right fit for your hips first.  Thet should give that extra 1-1.5 according to the chart, or even get a size up. After you get them you could take them to a tailor to custom fit the waist (if you got a perfect hip size) and the hip area to perfection (thats where the larger size comes in) and these would look SUPER AMAZING on you.A banana figure may need a small adjustment at the waist or hips. They could possibly size down if their hips and waist have a very small difference since the material stretches.If you have an apple or inverted triangle figure, you should pay the most attention to your waist size. If necessary, you can also have the hips adjusted to improve the line if your silhouette.Final thoughts: i am happy that I can find wide leg jeans easier now. Before, i would just make do with boot cut jeans (i like those a lot too). I had to wait a while for them to come back in style (jeans at least). However, i dont think it should be like this. Jeans arent supposed ti be like this! Different jeans flatter different figures in various ways. For instance an inverted triangle figure might have a more striking silhouette in a set of jeans with a harem pant fit,  or a Monroe style jean. Both would balance out the shoulder line quite well. An apple body would probably rock some bell bottoms like a champ by highlighting slender thighs and having the bell to balance their upper body.Each figure can create the perfect silhouette for their personality and figure. So... Look at all the various jean styles available and choose whats best for YOUR body and personality.After all comfortable clothes that compliment our figures are always the best!

reviewText: Levi's 505 jeans are a classic choice for men that have been popular for decades. Here's a review covering key aspects:Fit: The 505 jeans are known for their straight leg cut, which is neither too slim nor too loose. This makes them versatile and suitable for various body types. They provide a comfortable fit without feeling overly baggy or constricting.Comfort: Levi's is renowned for using high-quality denim that is durable yet comfortable. The 505 jeans typically have a bit of stretch, which adds to their comfort level, especially for daily wear or activities that require some movement.Durability: One of the standout features of Levi's jeans, including the 505 model, is their durability. The denim is sturdy and holds up well over time, even with regular washing and wear. This makes them a reliable choice for long-term use.Style: While the 505 jeans are known for their classic, timeless style, Levi's also offers them in various washes and finishes to suit different preferences. Whether you prefer a faded, worn-in look or a darker, more polished appearance, you can likely find a 505 style that fits your style.Value: Levi's jeans, including the 505, are typically priced competitively considering their quality and reputation. While they may be slightly more expensive than budget jeans, many customers find that the durability and comfort justify the cost.Sizing: It's worth noting that Levi's sizing can vary slightly between different batches or styles. Some customers may find that they need to size up or down compared to their usual size, so it's advisable to check the sizing guide or try on the jeans if possible before purchasing.Overall, Levi's 505 jeans are a solid choice for men seeking a classic, comfortable, and durable pair of jeans that can withstand everyday wear and various activities. Their timeless style and reliable quality have made them a staple in many men's wardrobes for years.

reviewText: I have just gotten back from my trip to Japan in winter.  In my time there I am amazed by how often I used this jacket and how wonderful it was.First off it is surprisingly warm for the size.  I have a large REI travel jacket that is waterproof.  I noticed that when wearing that travel jacket I was cold!  I thought that the warmth of the travel jacket would have been equivalent to this puffer jacket, and I was very wrong.  It is very warm for it's size.It is very packable.  I often times packed it in the little duffle pouch, and pulled it out at evenings when it became cold.  It made all the difference, and kept me nice and warm.  It is part of a layering system and worked very well (Heat tech top and botton, jeans, a sweater, scarf, hat, and this puffer jacket).It was not exactly trendy, but did not look out of place in Tokyo.  Many many puffer jackets were on the streets, and it blended right in.  It was probably the single most useful purchase I made for the trip.  I wholly recommend this jacket.

reviewText: The material in these jackets starts to rub and large amounts of pilling occur within hours of wearing. I don't know what material it's actually made of but even pure polyester doesn't wear as badly as the material in these coats.A buddy of mine had one that was several years old You could see how terrible it looked after a few years of wearing it.I'll be giving these to my 15 year old cousin because he enjoys the style and isn't going to be wearing these in any kind of work or professional setting. Definitely would not be appropriate at the office or anywhere professional...the appearance after just a few wears makes these more like a barn coat only.I mean some people might not notice it but if you're on a date or you're sitting or standing close to someone it becomes obvious the quality of the materials that the jacket is made out of.Which is weird because the construction and the sewing and the design are actually quite nice. There's two interior pockets with lots of space and two exterior pockets and the sewing and stitching are all great It's just the material is trash..I'm sorry to give such a bad review but for this price I expected better and these are essentially a waste of money because they only look good the very first time you wear them.Also not to mention they were not insulating at all and provide very little warmth in the winter.And I mean I'm sorry to give a negative review but I literally wasted over $100 on these coats and by the time I figured out how bad they were it was too late to return them.

reviewText: I ordered this polo to use both as a shirt for the shooting range as well as a hiking shirt on the days I expect it to be hot and humid where I want a shirt that wicks moisture and dries quickly.This polo looks and feels great and is lightweight, but not see through when wearing it.  It wicks and breathes well, dries quickly, and feels comfortable on the skin. Whet it does get wet, before it dries, it does not stretch out like cotton fabrics do. I don’t notice any seams while wearing it and it has just the right amount of stretch.For reference, I am 5’8”, 150 lbs., with a 38-inch chest and I ordered the Medium. It fits just right, and I think a Small would have been too tight; the medium size polo is 28-inches from the seam on the back of the neck just below the collar down to the hem, and 25.5-inches from the front of the neck down to the hem.  The length of the sleeve from under the armpit to the cuff is 2.5-inches, and the length of the sleeve from the seam at the top of the shoulder to the cuff is 8-inches.It's just long enough to tuck-in if I wish, but if I want to wear it causal with my Carhartt’s untucked or with hiking pants, it looks great with just the right amount of length. The collar is not too stiff or too floppy and holds its shape well.The only nitpick that I have is that the buttons have made an imprint on the back of the shirt, but fortunately my long hair covers that up. Otherwise, at the current price of around ten bucks at the time of this writing, this is a great deal and comparable to similar shirts costing many times as much.

reviewText: Finding clothing that a picky 7-year-old actually loves can feel like finding a needle in a haystack. Enter the HonestBaby Multipack Short Sleeve T-Shirts, made from 100% organic cotton. These tees were a big hit in our house, so much so that we had to reorder them!Fit and SizingI bought the size 8 for my 7-year-old daughter, and they fit perfectly. The sizing is true-to-size, with just enough room for her to move comfortably without feeling baggy. If you’re unsure about sizing, these tees provide a great balance between a tailored and relaxed fit.ComfortHere’s the standout feature: the softness. These t-shirts are so incredibly soft and lightweight that even my picky daughter—who usually vetoes everything—fell in love with them instantly. The organic cotton feels gentle on the skin and is breathable enough to wear in any season. No itchy tags, no annoying seams—just pure comfort.DurabilityAfter multiple washes, the tees have held up beautifully. The fabric hasn’t pilled or lost its shape, and the colors remain vibrant. These are built to withstand the wear and tear of an active child’s life.StyleThe simple yet classic design makes these t-shirts a wardrobe staple. They’re easy to pair with shorts, leggings, or even a skirt, making them versatile for both playdates and outings. The color variety in the multipack is also a plus, offering options that can match any outfit.Why We ReorderedThese tees checked all the boxes: soft, comfortable, durable, and stylish. My daughter’s reaction was the ultimate seal of approval. When she asks for a repeat order, you know it’s good!

reviewText: Comfortable Fit:The cargo shorts feature a relaxed fit, sitting at the natural waist with a comfortable seat and thigh. The 11-inch inseam provides just the right amount of coverage without feeling restrictive. I found the size 38 to be true to expectations, ensuring a comfortable and relaxed fit throughout the day. The shorts allow for ease of movement, making them suitable for various activities.Ample Storage:One of the standout features of these cargo shorts is the abundance of storage options. With four cargo flap pockets, two back flap pockets, and two slash pockets, there's plenty of room to securely store essentials such as cell phones, tools, wallets, and other small items. The flap pockets add an extra layer of security, ensuring that your belongings are safely enclosed.Durable Construction:Crafted from 100% cotton twill, these cargo shorts are built to withstand everyday wear and tear. The materials used are of excellent quality, providing durability without compromising breathability and comfort. Even after multiple washes, the shorts maintain their shape and color, further highlighting their long-lasting nature.Versatile Style:The Midnight color option I chose is a classic and versatile choice that pairs well with various tops and footwear. Whether you're going for a casual or slightly more dressed-up look, these cargo shorts offer the flexibility to adapt to different styles and occasions. The neutral color options available allow for easy coordination with your existing wardrobe.Overall, I highly recommend the Wrangler Authentics Men's Big & Tall Premium Twill Cargo Short. The combination of comfort, functionality, and durability make these shorts a reliable choice for everyday wear. With their generous storage options and comfortable fit, they are well-suited for both leisure activities and practical use. Invest in these cargo shorts, and you'll have a go-to option that will last you for seasons to come.

The shoes are really nice looking and one of the most comfortable pair of shoes I have ever owned because I suffer from a number of foot ailments caused by my service in THE USMC. Because of injuries I suffered I have severe neuropathy from the neck down so these shoes I can just step into and go. That way I don't need my wife or daughter to tie my shoes anymore. Great in the ice and snow in northern Indiana while it's easy to maintain the shoes appearance. Definitely going to buy another similar designed Skechers shoe.

reviewText: These are great looking and fitting shorts. The length is perfect in that they hit just above the kneecap. I feel like a gangbanger wearing shorts that come below my knee and those kinds of shorts just aren't age appropriate for over 60 (for me anyway). I like that these have the amount of stretch in the waistband. It allows me to wear a size down from what I need in shorts with no stretch. These are size 36 and fit perfectly. The belt loops are an added feature in these types of shorts over just those with a string to tie. I'm 5'9 and 189 pounds and my stomach is bigger than my hips, so a belt is essential to keep them up. It hard to get the string tie tight enough to stay up and still be comfortable in a seated position. Good quality, nice deep pockets. I could have done without the front pockets having zippers, but that is not a deal breaker. Same with not having two pockets on the rear. I have carried my wallet in my left back pocket for years and I keep reaching around to get it out. Otherwise, these are great summer shorts, and I have bought another pair in a different color.

reviewText: I purchased three pairs of these for a cruise to the Bahamas. The fit is the best thing about these linen blend pants. In comparison to other brands I have purchased, these have a tapered leg and less voluminous overall fit. Are these skinny fit? No...so don't misunderstand. I never understand why people expect a beach pant to be skinny, when the point is to wear a loose, cool pant for the hot weather? I bought white, navy and beige and all have a nice weight to the fabric. They're not flimsy feeling or see-thru like some others I tried. As other reviewers have stated, the beige is slightly yellowish and the navy is slightly lighter than navy. The color difference isn't a deal breaker for me, so I kept all three. The pockets are patch pockets, which give them a casual vibe. I like the dressier look of non-patch pockets on another brand I bought at the same time, but this is the only brand I've found that's more fitted. After washing the pants in gentle, cool water and line drying, I didn't notice any shrinkage. For reference, I wear a 32x32 jean and size 32 fit perfectly in length and waist. The only negative about these pants involves the beige color pant. I experienced the same problem as another reviewer. When the beige pant was washed, it looked like the color was bleached out of the fabric over a large area. I thought I overused the oxyclean when I tried to remove some stains from the trip. However, after drying, the color was perfectly normal over the entire pant with no problems. I definitely recommend these pants.

reviewText: I love the look and feel but as far as durability/ruggedness this is not a jacket you want to wear for working in rough dirty environments, the jacket just seems too nice and delicate. For something more suited for a harsh outdoor work environment I would go with a more durable option from a company like Carhart, the downside being it will cost 3-4 times as much. This is a good jacket for walking around in public and looking good on chilly days which is what I wanted. The arm length was very short on the medium I originally ordered.  I'm 5' 8 with medium build and when I bent my arms the sleaves road up to my elbows. I ordered a large and it fits a lot better. I wear it daily now for running errands around town or doing small task outside. This jacket is just not thick enough on its own to stay warm for long in hash winter weather. It was 34 degrees today and a little windy and I could feel the cold seeping through for the short time I was outside. Definitely would want to add another layer underneath it if you plan on being outside on a cold winter day for more than an hour. Other than that, the stitching looks good, zipper, pockets are good, but we'll see how well it holds up after a few wash cycles.

reviewText: I purchased this coat based on the raving reviews, but it did not meet my expectations that they set. I find it hard to believe this coat would be warm enough to wear skiing or shoveling snow in Northern Michigan. I guess I'll find out in the next 36 hours as we are expecting at least 7-10 of snow and near 0° temps. The shell is rugged and feels like it could withstand some abuse. The liner, which is not removable, is a furry fleece that is very soft to the touch. The zippers are plastic, so you shouldn't have to worry about them freezing up, and the coat has multiple,  functioning pockets. I don't see the need for multiple embroidered logos, but it is what it is. For the price, it would seem to be a reasonable purchase. Sizing is accurate and color is uniform. As for functionality; time will tell. Overall it's an excellent purchase at the sale price (I paid about $35). I would definitely recommend it as something to keep in the car or camper for emergencies, but I'm not sure it would be my first choice for a daily wear in inclement weather.

reviewText: I really like these shoes.  My only thought about them is that they make your feet slide forward after time.  My feet slide forward because it has a wedge design to them, very much like other shoes.  These just have more of that wedge grade.  I have others like this, so I can feel that my feet have moved forward because my toes start to feel scrunched up.It's not that big of a deal, but a deal enough to remove one star.  Otherwise, it would have gotten 5.The shoes themselves are comfortable and they do have a really good grip.  So much so that they keep a layer of snow on the soles when walking through it. lolThey are water-repellant. I have not soaked them to find out, but I have splashed water on them by accident. Of course, the snow that Colorado has received has put the repellant part to the test, and the shoes win every time, as the insides are always dry.

reviewText: I recently purchased the Olidarua Mens Casual Short Sleeve Henley Shirt, and I couldn't be happier with my choice! The fabric is incredibly soft and breathable, making it perfect for both casual outings and relaxing at home. The button detail adds a touch of style, while the pocket provides practicality without compromising the overall look.The fit is true to size, allowing for easy movement and all-day comfort. I've received several compliments on the stylish design, and it's quickly become a go-to staple in my wardrobe. Whether paired with shorts for a laid-back day or dressed up with chinos, this shirt is versatile enough for any occasion. Highly recommend it to anyone looking to upgrade their casual wear!

reviewText: I love the pockets placement, the ease of them sliding on, and the material is soft as butter. But,,, it attracts everything. I’d order these in every color IF…..I didn’t have a cat, could get a slimmer leg,  and this weight would disappear. Autoimmune diseases. So back they go. reviewText: For reference I'm 5'8 and pear-shaped. My weight fluctuates between 174 - 179 lbs, waist 34in and hips 42in. I followed the size chart and went with a size 18. First impressions: the jeans are very soft, stretchy, and comfortable. Fabric feels durable not flimsy. The jeans were a tad too long for flats but would be fine with a platform/wedge/heel. Comfortable fit in the thighs and overall flattering shape. However, the waist-hip area was too big, and the pockets weren't centered on my butt so that looked a bit off. I'm thinking of returning these and ordering a smaller size, but I'm not sure which size to get because the size chart was not accurate for me.

reviewText: I mainly bought these shorts for hiking.  However, after buying them I feel like they can be worn whenever (excercising, walking, lounging, etc.). Just minor things though and still very happy with them.
